text:
[b' 
', b'FIRST REGULAR SESSION  
', b'SENATE BILL NO. 49  
', b'102ND GENERAL ASSEMBLY   
', b'INTRODUCED BY SENATOR MOON.  
', b'0202S.01I  KRISTINA MARTIN, Secretary   
', b'AN ACT  
', b'To amend chapter 191, RSMo, by adding thereto one new section relating to gender transition 
', b'procedures.  
', b' 
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Missouri, as follows:  
', b'     Section A.  Chapter 191, RSMo, is amended by adding thereto 1 
', b'one new section, to be known as section 191.1720, to read as 2 
', b'follows: 3 
', b'     191.1720.   1.  This section shall be known and may be  1 
', b'cited as the "Missouri Save Adolescents from Experimentation  2 
', b'(SAFE) Act".  3 
', b'     2.  For purposes of this section, the following t erms  4 
', b'mean: 5 
', b'     (1)  "Biological sex", the biological indication of  6 
', b'male or female in the context of reproductive potential or  7 
', b'capacity, such as sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex  8 
', b'hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous internal and external  9 
', b'genitali a present at birth, without regard to an  10 
', b"individual's psychological, chosen, or subjective experience  11 
", b'of gender;  12 
', b'     (2)  "Cross-sex hormones":  13 
', b'     (a)  Testosterone or other androgens given to  14 
', b'biological sex females in amounts that are larger or more   15 
', b'potent than would normally occur naturally in healthy  16 
', b'biological sex females; and  17 
', b'     (b)  Estrogen given to biological sex males in amounts  18 
', b'that are larger or more potent than would normally occur  19 
', b'naturally in healthy biological sex males;  20  SB 49  2 
', b'     (3)  "Gender", the psychological, behavioral, social,  21 
', b'and cultural aspects of being male or female;  22 
', b'     (4)  "Gender reassignment surgery", any medical or  23 
', b'surgical service that seeks to surgically alter or remove  24 
', b'healthy physical or anatomical characterist ics or features  25 
', b"that are typical for the individual's biological sex in  26 
", b'order to instill or create physiological or anatomical    27 
', b'characteristics that resemble a sex different from the  28 
', b"individual's biological sex, including, but not limited to,  29 
", b'genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery performed  30 
', b'for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender  31 
', b'transition;  32 
', b'     (5)  "Gender transition", the process in which an  33 
', b'individual transitions from identifying with and living as a  34 
', b'gender that cor responds to his or her biological sex to  35 
', b'identifying and living as a gender different from his or her  36 
', b'biological sex, and may involve social, legal, or physical  37 
', b'changes;  38 
', b'     (6)  "Gender transition procedures":  39 
', b'     (a)  Any medical or surgical service , including, but  40 
', b"not limited to, physician's services, inpatient and  41 
", b'outpatient hospital services, or prescribed drugs, related  42 
', b'to gender transition that seeks to:  43 
', b'     a.  Alter or remove physical or anatomical  44 
', b'characteristics or features that are typ ical for the  45 
', b"individual's biological sex; or  46 
", b'     b.  Instill or create physiological or anatomical  47 
', b'characteristics that resemble a sex different from the  48 
', b"individual's biological sex, including, but not limited to:  49 
", b'     (i)  Medical services that provid e puberty -blocking  50 
', b'drugs, cross -sex hormones, or other mechanisms to promote  51  SB 49  3 
', b'the development of feminizing or masculinizing features in  52 
', b'the opposite biological sex; or  53 
', b'     (ii)  Genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery  54 
', b'performed for the purpo se of assisting an individual with a  55 
', b'gender transition;  56 
', b'     (b)  The term "gender transition procedures" shall not  57 
', b'include:  58 
', b'     a.  Services to individuals born with a medically - 59 
', b'verifiable disorder of sex development, including, but not  60 
', b'limited to, a n individual with external biological sex  61 
', b'characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous, such as  62 
', b'those born with forty -six XX chromosomes with virilization,  63 
', b'forty-six XY chromosomes with undervirilization, or having  64 
', b'both ovarian and testicular tissue ; 65 
', b'     b.  Services provided when a physician has otherwise  66 
', b'diagnosed an individual with a disorder of sexual  67 
', b'development and determined through genetic or biochemical  68 
', b'testing that the individual does not have normal sex  69 
', b'chromosome structure, sex stero id hormone production, or sex  70 
', b'steroid hormone action;  71 
', b'     c.  The treatment of any infection, injury, disease, or  72 
', b'disorder that has been caused by or exacerbated by the  73 
', b'performance of gender transition procedures regardless of  74 
', b'whether the gender trans ition procedure was performed in  75 
', b'accordance with state and federal law; or  76 
', b'     d.  Any procedure undertaken because the individual  77 
', b'suffers from a physical disorder, physical injury, or  78 
', b'physical illness that would, as certified by a physician,  79 
', b'place th e individual in imminent danger of death or  80 
', b'impairment of a major bodily function unless surgery is    81 
', b'performed;  82  SB 49  4 
', b'     (7)  "Genital gender reassignment surgery", a medical  83 
', b'procedure performed for the purpose of assisting an  84 
', b'individual with a gender tran sition, including, but not  85 
', b'limited to:  86 
', b'     (a)  Surgical procedures such as penectomy,  87 
', b'orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, or vulvoplasty for  88 
', b'biologically male patients or hysterectomy or ovariectomy  89 
', b'for biologically female patients;  90 
', b'     (b)  Reconstruction of the fixed part of the urethra  91 
', b'with or without a metoidioplasty; or  92 
', b'     (c)  Phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, or  93 
', b'implantation of erection or testicular prostheses for  94 
', b'biologically female patients;  95 
', b'     (8)  "Health care provider ", an individual who is  96 
', b'licensed, certified, or otherwise authorized by the laws of  97 
', b'this state to administer health care in the ordinary course  98 
', b'of the practice of his or her profession;  99 
', b'     (9)  "Nongenital gender reassignment surgery", medical  100 
', b'procedures performed for the purpose of assisting an  101 
', b'individual with a gender transition, including, but not  102 
', b'limited to:  103 
', b'     (a)  Surgical procedures for biologically male  104 
', b'patients, such as augmentation mammoplasty, facial  105 
', b'feminization surgery, liposuction,  lipofilling, voice  106 
', b'surgery, thyroid cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation,  107 
', b'hair reconstruction, or various aesthetic procedures; or  108 
', b'     (b)  Surgical procedures for biologically female  109 
', b'patients, such as subcutaneous mastectomy, voice surgery,  110 
', b'liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, or various  111 
', b'aesthetic procedures;  112 
', b'     (10)  "Physician", an individual who is licensed under  113 
', b'chapter 334;  114  SB 49  5 
', b'     (11)  "Puberty -blocking drugs", gonadotropin -releasing  115 
', b'hormone analogues or other synthetic drugs us ed in  116 
', b'biological sex males to stop luteinizing hormone secretion  117 
', b'and therefore testosterone secretion, or synthetic drugs  118 
', b'used in biological sex females that stop the production of  119 
', b'estrogens and progesterone, when used to delay or suppress  120 
', b'pubertal de velopment in children for the purpose of  121 
', b'assisting an individual with a gender transition.  122 
', b'     3.  A physician or other health care provider shall not  123 
', b'provide gender transition procedures to any individual under  124 
', b'eighteen years of age and shall not refe r any individual  125 
', b'under eighteen years of age to any health care provider for  126 
', b'gender transition procedures.  127 
', b'     4.  Any referral for or provision of gender transition  128 
', b'procedures to an individual under eighteen years of age  129 
', b'shall be considered unprofess ional conduct and any health  130 
', b'care provider doing so may be subject to discipline by the  131 
', b'appropriate licensing entity or disciplinary review board  132 
', b'with competent jurisdiction in this state.  133 
', b'     5.  The provision of gender transition procedures to an  134 
', b'individual under eighteen years of age in violation of the  135 
', b'provisions of this section shall be considered grounds for a  136 
', b'cause of action against the health care provider for  137 
', b'personal injury or death under chapter 538 and such cause of  138 
', b'action shall be gove rned by the provisions of such chapter.    139 
', b'An individual under eighteen years of age upon whom gender  140 
', b'transition procedures were performed in violation of this  141 
', b'section may bring the cause of action either through a next  142 
', b'friend or his or her own name, sub ject to the provisions of  143 
', b'section 516.105.  144 
', b'\xef\x83\xbc ']

title: Gender Reassignment Surgery
description: Amend The South Carolina Code Of Laws By Adding Section 40-47-300 So As To Provide Definitions; By Adding Section 40-47-310 So As To Provide That A Person Younger Than Twenty-one Years Of Age May Not Undergo Gender Transition Procedures; By Adding Section 40-47-320 So As To Provide That A Person Younger Than Twenty-one Years Of Age May Receive Appropriate Medical Services Otherwise Related To Gender Transition Procedures Under Limited Circumstances; By Adding Section 40-47-330 So As To Provide Prerequisites For A Person Older Than Twenty-one Years Of Age To Undergo Gender Transition Procedures; By Adding Section 40-47-340 So As To Provide That No Public Funds May Be Used To Pay For Gender Transition Procedures; And By Adding Section 59-32-35 So As To Provide That Gender Identity Disorders May Be Taught As Part Of A Comprehensive Health Education Program, To Provide That Students With Gender Identity Disorders Must Be Encouraged To Seek Mental Health Treatment For The Disorder And Must Not Be Encouraged To Seek Gender Transition Procedures, And To Provide That School Personnel Must Notify Parents When They Learn That A Student Suffers From A Gender Identity Disorder.
history: [{'date': '2022-12-07', 'action': 'Prefiled', 'chamber': 'S', 'chamber_id': 86, 'importance': 0}, {'date': '2022-12-07', 'action': 'Referred to Committee on Medical Affairs', 'chamber': 'S', 'chamber_id': 86, 'importance': 0}, {'date': '2023-01-10', 'action': 'Introduced and read first time', 'chamber': 'S', 'chamber_id': 86, 'importance': 1}, {'date': '2023-01-10', 'action': 'Referred to Committee on Medical Affairs', 'chamber': 'S', 'chamber_id': 86, 'importance': 1}, {'date': '2023-02-09', 'action': "Scrivener's error corrected", 'chamber': '', 'chamber_id': 0, 'importance': 0}]
text:
[b'
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'2023-2024 Bill 274 Text of Previous Version (Dec. 07, 2022) - South Carolina Legislature Online
', b' 
', b'
', b'South Carolina General Assembly125th Session, 2023-2024Bill 274Indicates Matter StrickenIndicates New Matter(Text matches printed bills. Document has been reformatted to meet World Wide Web specifications.)
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'A bill
', b'
', b'to amend the South Carolina Code of Laws by adding Section 40-47-300 so as to provide definitions; by adding Section 40-47-310 so as to provide that a person younger than twenty-one years of age may not undergo gender transition procedures; by adding Section 40-47-320 so as to provide that a person younger than twenty-one years of age may receive appropriate medical services otherwise related to gender transition procedures under limited circumstances; by adding Section 40-47-330 so as to provide prerequisites for a person older than twenty-one years of age to undergo gender transition procedures; by adding Section 40-47-340 so as to provide that no public funds may be used to pay for gender transition procedures; and by adding Section 59-32-35 so as to provide that gender identity disorders may be taught as part of a comprehensive health education program, to provide that students with gender identity disorders must be encouraged seek mental health treatment for the disorder and must not be encouraged to seek gender transition procedures, and to provide that school personnel must notify parents when they learn that a student suffers from a gender identity disorder.
', b'
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of South Carolina:
', b'
', b'SECTION 1.Chapter 47, Title 40 of the S.C. Code is amended by adding:
', b'
', b'Article 3
', b'
', b'Gender Reassignment Procedures
', b'
', b'Section 40-47-300.For the purposes of this article:
', b'(1) "Biological sex" means the biological indication of male and female in the context of reproductive potential or capacity, such as sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous internal and external genitalia present at birth, without regard to an individual's psychological, chosen, or subjective experience of gender.
', b'(2) "Cross-sex hormones" means testosterone or other androgens given to biological females in amounts that are larger or more potent than would normally occur naturally in healthy biological sex females; and estrogen given to biological males in amounts that are larger or more potent than would normally occur naturally in healthy biological sex males;
', b'(3) "Gender" means the psychological, behavioral, social, and cultural aspects of being male or female.
', b'(4) "Gender reassignment surgery" means any medical or surgical service that seeks to surgically alter or remove healthy physical or anatomical characteristics or features that are typical for the individual's biological sex, in order to instill or create physiological or anatomical characteristics that resemble a sex different from the individual's biological sex, including without limitation, genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition.
', b'(5) "Gender transition" means the process in which a person goes from identifying with and living as a gender that corresponds to his or her biological sex to identifying with and living as a gender different from his or her biological sex, and may involve social, legal, or physical changes.
', b'(6) "Gender transition procedures" means any medical or surgical service, including without limitation physician's services, inpatient and outpatient hospital services, or prescribed drugs related to gender transition that seeks to:
', b"(a) alter or remove physical or anatomical characteristics or features that are typical for the individual's biological sex; or
", b"(b) instill or create physiological or anatomical characteristics that resemble a sex different from the individual's biological sex, including without limitation medical services that provide puberty-blocking drugs, cross-sex hormones, or other mechanisms to promote the development of feminizing or masculinizing features in the opposite biological sex, or genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition.
", b'(7) "Genital gender reassignment surgery" means a medical procedure performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition, including without limitation:
', b'(a) surgical procedures such as penectomy, orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, or vulvoplasty for biologically male patients or hysterectomy or ovariectomy for biologically female patients;
', b'(b) reconstruction of the fixed part of the urethra with or without a metoidioplasty; or
', b'(c) phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, or implantation of erection or testicular prostheses for biologically female patients,
', b'(8) "Nongenital gender reassignment surgery" means medical procedures performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition including without limitation:
', b'(a) surgical procedures for biologically male patients, such as augmentation mammoplasty, facial feminization surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, voice surgery, thyroid cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation, hair reconstruction, or various aesthetic procedures; or
', b'(b) surgical procedures for biologically female patients, such as subcutaneous mastectomy, voice surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, or various aesthetic procedures.
', b'(9) "Puberty-blocking drugs" means gonadotropin-releasing hormone analogues or other synthetic drugs used in biological males to stop luteinizing hormone secretion and therefore testosterone secretion, or synthetic drugs used in biological females which stop the production of estrogens and progesterone, when used to delay or suppress pubertal development in children for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition.
', b'(10) "Public funds" means state, county, or local government monies, in addition to any department, agency, or instrumentality authorized or appropriated under state law or derived from any fund in which such moneys are deposited.
', b'
', b'Section 40-47-310.A person younger than twenty-one years of age may not undergo gender transition procedures.
', b'
', b'Section 40-47-320.Notwithstanding the provisions contained in Section 4-47-310, a physician may provide to a patient who is under twenty-one years of age:
', b'(1) appropriate medical services to a person who was born with a medically verifiable disorder of sexual development, including, but not limited to, a person with external biological sexual characteristics that are ambiguous, including, but not limited to, people who were born with forty-six XX chromosomes with virilization or forty-six XY chromosomes with undervirilization or having both ovarian and testicular tissue;
', b'(2) appropriate medical services to treat a disorder of sexual development arising because the person does not have normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone production, or sex steroid hormone action that was diagnosed through genetic or biochemical testing;
', b'(3) treatment of any infection, injury, disease, or disorder that has been caused by or exacerbated by the performance of gender transition procedures, whether or not the gender transition procedure was performed in accordance with state or federal law; and
', b'(4) any procedure undertaken because the person suffers from a physical disorder, physical injury, or physical illness that would, as certified by a physician, place the person in imminent danger of death or impairment of a major bodily function unless treated by the physician.
', b'
', b'Section 40-47-330.In order for a person twenty-one years of age or older to receive gender transition procedures, he must first obtain a referral from his primary care physician and a referral from a licensed psychiatrist who must certify that the person has been diagnosed with gender dysphoria or a similar condition by the psychiatrist and that the psychiatrist believes that gender transition procedures would be appropriate for the person.
', b'
', b'Section 40-47-340.Public funds may not be used directly or indirectly for gender reassignment services. 
', b'
', b'SECTION 2.Chapter 32, Title 59 of the S.C. Code is amended by adding:
', b'
', b'Section 59-32-35.(A) A comprehensive health education program may include instruction concerning gender dysphoria, gender identity disorder, and other psychological conditions that can result in a person identifying with a gender different than that of their sex assigned at birth or sex-related physical characteristics.
', b'(B) Instruction provided to students pursuant to subsection (A) must:
', b'(1) encourage students who are afflicted with a gender identity condition to seek assistance from a mental health professional; and
', b'(2) not encourage a student to pursue gender transition procedures, as defined in Section 40-47-300.
', b"(C) A teacher, school administrator, or other school employee who suspects or knows that a student suffers from gender dysphoria, gender identity disorder, and other psychological conditions that can result in a person identifying with a gender different than that of their sex assigned at birth or sex-related physical characteristics must notify the student's parent or legal guardian. The provisions in this subsection apply whether or not the teacher, school administrator, or school employee learns of the student's condition through instruction provided for in this section or otherwise.
", b'
', b'SECTION 3.This act takes effect upon approval by the Governor.
', b'----XX----
', b'This web page was last updated on December 07, 2022 at 02:32 PM
', b'
', b'
']

text:
[b'FIRST REGULAR SESSION
', b'HOUSE BILL NO. 916 102ND GENERAL ASSEMBLY
', b'INTRODUCED BY REPRESENTATIVE BUCHHEIT-COURTWAY.
', b'DANA RADEMAN MILLER, Chief Clerk
', b'AN ACT
', b'    2 3
', b'2
', b'2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9
', b'10 11 12 13 14
', b'To amend chapter 191, RSMo, by adding thereto seven new sections relating to gender transition procedures, with a delayed effective date.
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the state of Missouri, as follows:
', b'Section A. Chapter 191, RSMo, is amended by adding thereto seven new sections, to be known as sections 191.1720, 191.1725, 191.1730, 191.1735, 191.1740, 191.1742, and 191.1745, to read as follows:
', b'191.1720. Sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 shall be known and may be cited as the "Missouri Child and Adolescent Protection (MCAP) Act".
', b'191.1725. For purposes of this section, the following terms mean:
', b'(1) "Biological sex", the biological indication of male or female in the context of reproductive potential or capacity, such as sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous internal and external genitalia present at birth, without regard to an individual's psychological, chosen, or subjective experience of gender;
', b'(2) "Cross-sex hormones":
', b'(a) Testosterone or other androgens given to biological sex females in amounts that are larger or more potent than would normally occur naturally in healthy biological sex females; and
', b'(b) Estrogen given to biological sex males in amounts that are larger or more potent than would normally occur naturally in healthy biological sex males;
', b'(3) "Gender", the psychological, behavioral, social, and cultural aspects of being male or female;
', b'EXPLANATION \xe2\x80\x94 Matter enclosed in bold-faced brackets [thus] in the above bill is not enacted and is intended to be omitted from the law. Matter in bold-face type in the above bill is proposed language.
', b'HB 916 2
', b'15
', b'16
', b'17
', b'18
', b'19
', b'20

', b'22
', b'23
', b'24

', b'26

', b'(4) "Gender reassignment surgery", any medical or surgical service that seeks to surgically alter or remove physical or anatomical characteristics or features that are typical for the individual's biological sex in order to instill or create physiological or anatomical characteristics that resemble a sex different from the individual's biological sex including, but not limited to, genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition;
', b'(5) "Gender transition", the process in which an individual transitions from identifying with and living as a gender that corresponds to his or her biological sex to identifying with and living as a gender different from his or her biological sex and may involve social, legal, or physical changes;
', b'(6) "Gender transition procedure":
', b"(a) Any medical or surgical service, including, but not limited to, physician's services, inpatient and outpatient hospital services, or prescribed drugs, related to gender transition that seeks to:
", b"a. Alter or remove physical or anatomical characteristics or features that are typical for the individual's biological sex; or
", b"b. Instill or create physiological or anatomical characteristics that resemble a sex different from the individual's biological sex including, but not limited to:
", b'(i) Medical services that provide puberty-blocking drugs, cross-sex hormones, or other mechanisms to promote the development of features commonly associated with members of the opposite sex; or
', b'(ii) Genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition;
', b'(b) The term "gender transition procedure" shall not include:
', b'a. Services to individuals born with a medically verifiable disorder of sex development including, but not limited to, an individual with external biological sex characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous, such as those born with 46,XX chromosomes with virilization, 46,XY chromosomes with undervirilization, or having both ovarian and testicular tissue;
', b'b. Services provided when a physician has otherwise diagnosed an individual with a disorder of sexual development and determined through genetic or biochemical testing that the individual does not have normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone production, or sex steroid hormone action;
', b'c. The treatment of any infection, injury, disease, or disorder that has been caused by or exacerbated by the performance of gender transition procedures regardless of whether the gender transition procedure was performed in accordance with state and federal law; or
', b'
', b'HB 916 3

', b'd. Any procedure undertaken because the individual suffers from a physical disorder, physical injury, or physical illness that would, as certified by a physician, place the individual in imminent danger of death or impairment of a major bodily function unless surgery is performed;
', b'(7) "Genital gender reassignment surgery", a medical procedure performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition including, but not limited to:
', b'(a) Surgical procedures such as penectomy, orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, or vulvoplasty for biologically male patients or hysterectomy or ovariectomy for biologically female patients;
', b'(b) Reconstruction of the fixed part of the urethra with or without a metoidioplasty; or
', b'(c) Phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, or implantation of erection or testicular prostheses for biologically female patients;
', b'(8) "Health care provider", an individual who is licensed, certified, or otherwise authorized by the laws of this state to administer health care in the ordinary course of the practice of his or her profession, including mental health care providers;
', b'(9) "Nongenital gender reassignment surgery", a medical procedure performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition including, but not limited to:
', b'(a) Surgical procedures for biologically male patients, such as augmentation mammoplasty, facial feminization surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, voice surgery, thyroid cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation, hair reconstruction, or various aesthetic procedures; or
', b'(b) Surgical procedures for biologically female patients, such as subcutaneous mastectomy, voice surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, or various aesthetic procedures;
', b'(10) "Physician", an individual who is licensed as a physician under chapter 334;
', b'(11) "Puberty-blocking drugs", gonadotropin-releasing hormone analogues or other synthetic drugs used in biological sex males to stop luteinizing hormone secretion and therefore testosterone secretion, or synthetic drugs used in biological sex females that stop the production of estrogens and progesterone, when used to delay or suppress pubertal development in children for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition;
', b'(12) "Public funds", state, county, or local government moneys, including any such moneys deposited with or derived from any department, agency, or instrumentality authorized or appropriated under state law.
', b'
', b'HB 916 4
', b'191.1730. A physician or other health care provider shall not knowingly provide
', b'2 gender transition procedures to any individual under eighteen years of age and shall not
', b'3 refer any individual under eighteen years of age to any health care provider for gender
', b'4 transition procedures.
', b'191.1735. 1. Public funds shall not be directly or indirectly used, granted, paid,
', b'2 or distributed to any individual, entity, or organization that provides gender transition
', b'3 procedures to an individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'4 2. The MO HealthNet program shall not reimburse or provide coverage for
', b'5 gender transition procedures to an individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'6 3. The provisions of this section shall not apply to any speech protected by the
', b'7 First Amendment of the United States Constitution.
', b'191.1740. Any referral for or provision of gender transition procedures to an
', b'2 individual under eighteen years of age shall be considered unprofessional conduct and
', b'3 any health care provider doing so may be subject to discipline by the appropriate
', b'4 licensing entity or disciplinary review board with competent jurisdiction in this state.
', b'191.1742. Sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 shall not apply to the provision of cross-
', b'2 sex hormones to any individual under eighteen years of age who was prescribed cross-
', b"3 sex hormones before January 1, 2024, to treat an inconsistency between the individual's
", b"4 biological sex and the individual's perceived gender or perceived sex.
", b'191.1745. 1. The provision of a gender transition procedure to an individual
', b'2 under eighteen years of age in violation of sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 shall be
', b'3 considered grounds for a cause of action against the physician or health care provider.
', b'4 2. The provisions of chapter 538 shall not apply to any action brought under this
', b'5 section.
', b'6 3. (1) An individual under eighteen years of age may bring an action under this
', b"7 section throughout the individual's minority through a parent or next friend and may
", b"8 bring an action under this section in the individual's own name upon reaching the age of
", b'9 majority at any time from that point until twenty years after reaching the age of
', b'10 majority or four years from the time of discovery by the injured party of both the injury
', b'11 and the causal relationship between the treatment and the injury, whichever date is
', b'12 later.
', b'13 (2) If at the time the individual abused attains eighteen years of age he or she is
', b'14 under other legal disability, the limitation period under subdivision (1) of this subsection
', b'15 shall not begin to run until the removal of the disability.
', b'16 (3) The limitation period in subdivision (1) of this subsection shall not run
', b'17 during a time period when the individual is subject to threats, intimidation,
', b'18 manipulation, fraudulent concealment, or fraud perpetrated by the physician or other
', b'
', b'HB 916 5
', b'19 health care professional who prescribed or otherwise provided gender transition
', b'20 procedures or by any person acting in the interest of the physician or other health care
', b'21 professional.
', b'22 4. (1) An individual may assert an actual or threatened violation of sections
', b'23 191.1720 to 191.1745 as a claim or defense in a judicial proceeding.
', b'24 (2) The following damages may be awarded to a claimant described in
', b'25 subdivision (1) of this subsection:
', b'26 (a) Compensatory damages including, but not limited to:
', b'27 a. Pain and suffering;
', b'28 b. Loss of reputation;
', b'29 c. Loss of income; and
', b'30 d. Loss of consortium including, but not limited to, the loss of expectation of
', b'31 sharing parenthood;
', b'32 (b) Injunctive relief;
', b'33 (c) Declaratory judgment;
', b'34 (d) Punitive damages; and
', b'35 (e) Any other appropriate relief.
', b'36 (3) A prevailing party who establishes a violation of sections 191.1720 to
', b"37 191.1745 shall recover reasonable attorney's fees.
", b'38 5. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an action under this section may
', b'39 be commenced, and relief may be granted, in a judicial proceeding without regard to
', b'40 whether the individual commencing the action has sought or exhausted available
', b'41 administrative remedies.
', b'42 6. The attorney general may bring an action to enforce compliance with sections
', b'43 191.1720 to 191.1745.
', b'44 7. Sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 do not deny, impair, or otherwise affect any
', b'45 right or authority of the attorney general, the state, or any agency, officer, or employee
', b'46 of the state, acting under any law other than sections 191.1720 to 191.1745, to institute
', b'47 or intervene in any proceeding.
', b'Section B. The enactment of sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 of this act shall become
', b'2 effective on January 1, 2024.
', b'\xe2\x9c\x94']

', b'12  This bill enacts provisions reg arding  sex characteristic surg ical procedures.

', b'14 This bill:
', b'15 <defines terms;
', b'16 <prohibits performing  sex characteristic surg ical procedures on a minor for the
', b'17 purpose of effectuating  a sex  chang e; and
', b'18 <makes technical chang es.

[b'FIRST REGULAR SESSION
', b'HOUSE BILL NO. 419 102ND GENERAL ASSEMBLY
', b'INTRODUCED BY REPRESENTATIVE HUDSON.
', b'DANA RADEMAN MILLER, Chief Clerk
', b'AN ACT
', b'    2 3
', b'2
', b'2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9
', b'10 11 12 13 14
', b'To amend chapters 191 and 376, RSMo, by adding thereto eight new sections relating to gender transition procedures, with a contingent effective date.
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the state of Missouri, as follows:
', b'Section A. Chapters 191 and 376, RSMo, are amended by adding thereto eight new sections, to be known as sections 191.1720, 191.1725, 191.1730, 191.1732, 191.1735, 191.1740, 191.1745, and 376.1280, to read as follows:
', b'191.1720. Sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 and section 376.1280 shall be known and may be cited as the "Missouri's Children Deserve Help Not Harm Act".
', b'191.1725. For purposes of sections 191.1725 to 191.1745, the following terms
', b'mean:
', b'(1) "Biological sex", the biological indication of male or female in the context of
', b'reproductive potential or capacity, such as sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous internal and external genitalia present at birth, including secondary sex characteristics;
', b'(2) "Cross-sex hormones":
', b'(a) Testosterone or other androgens given to biological females in amounts that create serum levels greater than would normally occur naturally in healthy biological females, which may include, but are not limited to, the following risks:
', b'a. Irreversible infertility;
', b'b. Severe liver dysfunction;
', b'c. Coronary artery disease, including heart attacks;
', b'd. Increased risk of breast, cervical, and uterine cancers;
', b'EXPLANATION \xe2\x80\x94 Matter enclosed in bold-faced brackets [thus] in the above bill is not enacted and is intended to be omitted from the law. Matter in bold-face type in the above bill is proposed language.
', b'HB 419
', b'2
', b'15

', b'17

', b'19

', b'21
', b'22
', b'23 greater than would normally occur naturally in healthy biological males, which may
', b'24 include, but are not limited to, the following risks:
', b'e. Cerebrovascular disease, including strokes;
', b'f. Hypertension;
', b'g. Erythrocytosis, which is an increase in red blood cells;
', b'h. Sleep apnea;
', b'i. Type 2 diabetes;
', b'j. Loss of bone density; and
', b'k. Destabilization of psychiatric disorders; and
', b'(b) Estrogen given to biological males in amounts that create serum levels
', b'25 a. Irreversible infertility;
', b'26 b. Thromboembolic disease, including blood clots;
', b'27 c. Cholelithiasis, including gallstones;
', b'28 d. Coronary artery disease, including heart attacks;
', b'29 e. Type 2 diabetes;
', b'30 f. Breast cancer;
', b'31 g. Macroprolactinoma, which is a tumor of the pituitary gland;
', b'32 h. Cerebrovascular disease, including strokes; and
', b'33 i. Hypertriglyceridemia, which is an elevated level of triglycerides in the blood;
', b'34 (3) "Gender", the psychological, behavioral, social, and cultural aspects of being
', b'35 male or female;
', b'36 (4) "Gender reassignment surgery", any surgical service that seeks to surgically
', b'37 alter or remove healthy physical or anatomical characteristics or features that are
', b"38 typical for the individual's biological sex in order to instill or create physiological or
", b"39 anatomical characteristics that resemble a sex different from the individual's biological
", b'40 sex including, but not limited to, genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery
', b'41 performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition;
', b'42 (5) "Gender transition", the process in which an individual goes from
', b'43 identifying with and living as a gender that corresponds to his or her biological sex to
', b'44 identifying with and living as a gender different from his or her biological sex and may
', b'45 involve social, legal, or physical changes;
', b'46 (6) "Gender transition procedure":
', b"47 (a) Any medical or surgical service, including, but not limited to, physician's
", b'48 services, inpatient and outpatient hospital services, puberty-blocking drugs, cross-sex
', b'49 hormones, or genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery, that is provided or
', b'50 performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a physical gender transition;
', b'51 (b) The term "gender transition procedure" shall not include:

', b'a. Services to individuals born with a medically verifiable disorder of sex development including, but not limited to, an individual with external biological sex characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous, such as those born with 46,XX chromosomes with virilization, 46,XY chromosomes with undervirilization, or having both ovarian and testicular tissue;
', b'b. Services provided when a physician has otherwise diagnosed an individual with a disorder of sexual development and determined through genetic or biochemical testing that the individual does not have normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid production, or sex steroid hormone action;
', b'c. The acute or chronic treatment of any infection, injury, disease, or disorder that has been caused by or exacerbated by the performance of gender transition procedures regardless of whether the gender transition procedure was performed in accordance with state and federal law or whether funding for the gender transition procedure is permissible under section 191.1735; or
', b'd. Any procedure undertaken because the individual suffers from a physical disorder, physical injury, or physical illness that would, as certified by a physician, place the individual in imminent danger of death or impairment of a major bodily function unless surgery is performed;
', b'(7) "Genital gender reassignment surgery", a surgical procedure performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a physical gender transition including, but not limited to:
', b'(a) Surgical procedures such as penectomy, orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, or vulvoplasty for biologically male patients; or
', b'(b) Surgical procedures such as hysterectomy, oophorectomy, reconstruction of the urethra, metoidioplasty or phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, implantation of erection prostheses, or implantation of testicular prostheses for biologically female patients;
', b'(8) "Health care professional", an individual who is licensed, certified, or otherwise authorized by the laws of this state to administer health care in the ordinary course of the practice of his or her profession, including mental health care providers;
', b'(9) "Nongenital gender reassignment surgery", surgical procedures performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a physical gender transition including, but not limited to:
', b'(a) Surgical procedures for biologically male patients, such as augmentation mammoplasty, facial feminization surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, voice feminization surgery, thyroid cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation, hair reconstruction, or various aesthetic procedures; or
', b'

', b'(b) Surgical procedures for biologically female patients, such as subcutaneous mastectomy, voice masculinization surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, or various aesthetic procedures;
', b'(10) "Physician", an individual who is licensed to practice medicine in this state;
', b'(11) "Puberty-blocking drugs", gonadotropin-releasing hormone analogues or other synthetic drugs used in biological males to stop luteinizing hormone secretion and therefore testosterone production, or synthetic drugs used in biological females that stop the production of estrogen and progesterone, when used to delay or suppress pubertal development in children for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition;
', b'(12) "Public funds", state, county, or local government moneys, including any such moneys deposited with or derived from any department, agency, or instrumentality authorized or appropriated under state law.
', b'191.1730. 1. A physician or other health care professional shall not provide gender transition procedures to any individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'2. A health care institution or entity shall not facilitate the provision of gender transition procedures to any individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'191.1732. 1. A person or entity, including employees of other state governments, the federal government, or foreign governments, shall not knowingly engage in conduct that aids or abets the performance or inducement of gender transition procedures on any individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'2. The provisions of this section shall not apply to any speech protected by the First Amendment of the United States Constitution.
', b'3. No parent of a child victim shall be held liable under this section.
', b'191.1735. 1. Public funds shall not be directly or indirectly used, granted, paid, or distributed to any individual, entity, or organization that provides gender transition procedures to an individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'2. Health care services furnished in the following situations shall not include gender transition procedures to an individual under eighteen years of age:
', b'(1) By or in a facility owned by the state or a county or local government; or
', b'(2) By a physician or other health care professional employed by the state or a county or local government.
', b'3. Any amount paid by an individual or an entity during a tax year for the provision of gender transition procedures or as premiums for health care coverage that includes coverage for gender transition procedures shall not be tax deductible.
', b'4. The MO HealthNet program shall not reimburse or provide coverage for gender transition procedures to an individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'HB 419 4
', b'
', b'HB 419 5
', b'191.1740. Any referral for or provision of gender transition procedures to an
', b'2 individual under eighteen years of age is unprofessional conduct and shall be subject to
', b'3 discipline by the appropriate licensing entity or disciplinary review board with
', b'4 competent jurisdiction in this state.
', b'191.1745. 1. (1) Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an individual
', b'2 under eighteen years of age may bring an action under sections 191.1725 to 191.1745
', b"3 throughout the individual's minority through a parent or next friend and may bring an
", b"4 action under sections 191.1725 to 191.1745 in the individual's own name upon reaching
", b'5 the age of majority at any time from that point until thirty years after reaching the age
', b'6 of majority.
', b'7 (2) If at the time the individual abused attains the age of eighteen years he or she
', b'8 is under other legal disability, the limitation period under subdivision (1) of this
', b'9 subsection shall not begin to run until the removal of the disability.
', b'10 (3) The limitation period in subdivision (1) of this subsection shall not run
', b'11 during a time period when the individual is subject to threats, intimidation,
', b'12 manipulation, fraudulent concealment, or fraud perpetrated by the physician or other
', b'13 health care professional who prescribed or otherwise provided gender transition
', b'14 procedures or by any person acting in the interest of the physician or other health care
', b'15 professional.
', b'16 2. (1) An individual may assert an actual or threatened violation of sections
', b'17 191.1725 to 191.1745 as a claim or defense in a judicial or administrative proceeding.
', b'18 (2) The following damages may be awarded to a claimant described in
', b'19 subdivision (1) of this subsection:
', b'20 (a) Compensatory damages including, but not limited to:
', b'21 a. Pain and suffering;
', b'22 b. Loss of reputation;
', b'23 c. Loss of income; and
', b'24 d. Loss of consortium including, but not limited to, the loss of expectation of
', b'25 sharing parenthood;
', b'26 (b) Injunctive relief;
', b'27 (c) Declaratory relief;
', b'28 (d) Punitive damages; and
', b'29 (e) Any other appropriate relief.
', b'30 (3) A prevailing party who establishes a violation of sections 191.1725 to
', b"31 191.1745 shall recover reasonable attorney's fees.
", b'32 3. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an action under sections 191.1725
', b'33 to 191.1745 may be commenced, and relief may be granted, in a judicial proceeding

', b'without regard to whether the individual commencing the action has sought or exhausted available administrative remedies.
', b'4. (1) The attorney general may bring an action to enforce compliance with sections 191.1725 to 191.1745.
', b'(2) Sections 191.1725 to 191.1745 do not deny, impair, or otherwise affect any right or authority of the attorney general, the state, or any agency, officer, or employee of the state, acting under any law other than sections 191.1725 to 191.1745, to institute or intervene in any proceeding.
', b'376.1280. 1. For purposes of this section, the following terms mean:
', b'(1) "Gender transition procedure", the same meaning given to the term in section 191.1725;
', b'(2) "Health benefit plan", the same meaning given to the term in section 376.1350;
', b'(3) "Health carrier", the same meaning given to the term in section 376.1350.
', b'2. A health carrier or health benefit plan that offers or issues health benefit plans that are delivered, issued for delivery, continued, or renewed in this state on or after the effective date of this section shall not include reimbursement for gender transition procedures for an individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'3. A health carrier or health benefit plan that offers or issues health benefit plans that are delivered, issued for delivery, continued, or renewed in this state on or after the effective date of this section shall not be required to provide coverage for gender transition procedures.
', b'4. A federal health benefit plan under an insurance policy or other plan providing health care coverage, such as TriCare or Veterans Administration health care, shall not include reimbursement for gender transition procedures for an individual under eighteen years of age in this state.
', b'Section B. The enactment of sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 and section 376.1280 of this act shall become effective:
', b'(1) August 28, 2023, upon signature of the governor before March 1, 2023;
', b"(2) Six months from the date of the governor's signature if signed by the governor on or after March 1, 2023;
", b'(3) January 15, 2024, if the bill is not signed and returned by the governor within the constitutional time limits; or
', b"(4) March 23, 2024, if the governor vetoes the bill and the general assembly overrides the governor's veto.
", b'\xe2\x9c\x94']

title: Gender transition procedures for minors.
description: Gender transition procedures for minors. Prohibits specified health care professionals from providing gender transition procedures to a minor that are intended to alter the gender of the minor or delay puberty. Provides for certain medical exceptions. Prohibits public funds, Medicaid, or a health carrier from providing reimbursement or coverage for gender transition procedures to a minor. Creates a civil cause of action. Makes conforming changes.

text:
[b' 
', b'Introduced Version
', b'HOUSE BILL No. 1231
', b'_____
', b'DIGEST OF  INTRODUCED B ILL
', b'Citations Affected:  IC 12-15-1-23; IC 16-18-2; IC 16-35-12;
', b'IC 27-2-28; IC 34-18-1-1.
', b'Synopsis:  Gender transition procedures for minors. Prohibits specified
', b'health care professionals from providing gender transition procedures
', b'to a minor that are intended to alter the gender of the minor or delay
', b'puberty. Provides for certain medical exceptions. Prohibits public
', b'funds, Medicaid, or a health carrier from providing reimbursement or
', b'coverage for gender transition procedur es to a minor. Creates a civil
', b'cause of action. Makes conforming changes.
', b'Effective:  July 1, 2023.
', b'Lauer
', b'January 10, 2023, read first time and referred to Commi ttee on Public Health.
', b'2023 IN 1231\xe2\x80\x94LS 7276/DI 147
', b'Introduced
', b'First Reg ular Sessio n of the 123rd General A ssem bly (2023)
', b'PRINTING CODE. Amendments: Whenever an existing statute (or a section of the Indiana
', b'Constitution) is being amended, the text of the existing provision will appear in this style type,
', b'additions will appear in this sty le type, and deletions will appear in this style type.
', b'  Additions: Whenever a new statutory provision is being enacted (or a new constitutional
', b'provision adopted), the text of the new provision will appear in  this  style  type. Also, the
', b'word NEW will appear in that style type in the introductory clause of each SECTION that adds
', b'a new provision to the Indiana Code or the Indiana Constitution.
', b'  Conflict reconciliation: Text in a statute in this style type or this style type reconciles conflicts
', b'between statutes enacted by the 2022 Regular Session of the General Assembly.
', b'HOUSE BILL No. 1231
', b'A BILL FOR AN ACT to amend the Indiana Code concerning
', b'health.
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Indiana:
', b'1 SECTION 1. IC 12-15-1-23 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA CODE
', b'2 AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE JULY
', b'3 1, 2023]: Sec. 23. The office may not use federal or state funds
', b'4 under the Medicaid program to pay or provide coverage for
', b'5 gender transition procedures (as defined by IC 16-35-12-6) to an
', b'6 individual who is less than eighteen (18) years of age.
', b'7 SECTION 2. IC 16-18-2-36.1 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
', b'8 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
', b'9 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 36.1. "Biological sex", for
', b'10 purposes of IC 16-35-12, has the meaning set forth in
', b'11 IC 16-35-12-1.
', b'12 SECTION 3. IC 16-18-2-88.7 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
', b'13 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
', b'14 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 88.7. "Cross sex hormones", for
', b'15 purposes of IC 16-35-12, has the meaning set forth in
', b'16 IC 16-35-12-2.
', b'17 SECTION 4. IC 16-18-2-144.2 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
', b'2023 IN 1231\xe2\x80\x94LS 7276/DI 147
', b'2
', b'1 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
', b'2 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 144.2. "Gender", for purposes of
', b'3 IC 16-35-12, has the meaning set forth in IC 16-35-12-3.
', b'4 SECTION 5. IC 16-18-2-144.3 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
', b'5 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
', b'6 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 144.3. "Gender reassignment
', b'7 surgery", for purposes of IC 16-35-12, has the meaning set forth in
', b'8 IC 16-35-12-4.
', b'9 SECTION 6. IC 16-18-2-144.4 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
', b'10 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
', b'11 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 144.4. "Gender transition", for
', b'12 purposes of IC 16-35-12, has the meaning set forth in
', b'13 IC 16-35-12-5.
', b'14 SECTION 7. IC 16-18-2-144.5 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
', b'15 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
', b'16 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 144.5. "Gender transition
', b'17 procedures", for purposes of IC 16-35-12, has the meaning set
', b'18 forth in IC 16-35-12-6.
', b'19 SECTION 8. IC 16-18-2-148.2 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
', b'20 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
', b'21 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 148.2. "Genital gender
', b'22 reassignment surgery", for purposes of IC 16-35-12, has the
', b'23 meaning set forth in IC 16-35-12-7.
', b'24 SECTION 9. IC 16-18-2-157.2 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
', b'25 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
', b'26 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 157.2. "Harm", for purposes of
', b'27 IC 16-35-12, has the meaning set forth in IC 16-35-12-8.
', b'28 SECTION 10. IC 16-18-2-162, AS AMENDED BY P.L.212-2005,
', b'29 SECTION 5, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
', b'30 JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 162. (a) "Health care professional", for purposes
', b'31 of IC 16-27-1 and IC 16-27-4, has the meaning set forth in
', b'32 IC 16-27-1-1.
', b'33 (b) "Health care professional", for purposes of IC 16-27-2, has the
', b'34 meaning set forth in IC 16-27-2-1.
', b'35 (c) "Health care professional", for purposes of IC 16-35-12, has
', b'36 the meaning set forth in IC 16-35-12-9.
', b'37 SECTION 11. IC 16-18-2-250.5 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
', b'38 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
', b'39 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 250.5. "Nongenital gender
', b'40 reassignment surgery", for purposes of IC 16-35-12, has the
', b'41 meaning set forth in IC 16-35-12-11.
', b'42 SECTION 12. IC 16-18-2-296.7 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
', b'2023 IN 1231\xe2\x80\x94LS 7276/DI 147
', b'3
', b'1 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
', b'2 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 296.7. "Puberty blocking drugs",
', b'3 for purposes of IC 16-35-12, has the meaning set forth in
', b'4 IC 16-35-12-12.
', b'5 SECTION 13. IC 16-18-2-297.2 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
', b'6 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
', b'7 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 297.2. "Public funds", for
', b'8 purposes of IC 16-35-12, has the meaning set forth in
', b'9 IC 16-35-12-13.
', b'10 SECTION 14. IC 16-35-12 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA CODE
', b'11 AS A NEW CHAPTER TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
', b'12 JULY 1, 2023]:
', b'13 Chapter 12. Gender Transition Procedures for Minors
', b'14 Sec. 1. As used in this chapter, "biological sex" means the
', b'15 biological indication of male and female in the context of
', b'16 reproductive potential or capacity, including sex chromosomes,
', b'17 naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous
', b'18 internal and external genitalia present at birth, without regard to
', b"19 an individual's psychological, chosen, or subjective experience of
", b'20 gender.
', b'21 Sec. 2. As used in this chapter, "cross sex hormones" means the
', b'22 following:
', b'23 (1) Testosterone or other androgens given to biological sex
', b'24 females in amounts that are larger or more potent than would
', b'25 normally occur naturally in healthy biological sex females.
', b'26 (2) Estrogen given to biological sex males in amounts that are
', b'27 larger or more potent than would normally occur naturally in
', b'28 healthy biological sex males.
', b'29 Sec. 3. As used in this chapter, "gender" means the
', b'30 psychological, behavioral, social, and cultural aspects of being male
', b'31 or female.
', b'32 Sec. 4. As used in this chapter, "gender reassignment surgery"
', b'33 means any medical or surgical service that seeks to surgically alter
', b'34 or remove healthy physical or anatomical characteristics or
', b"35 features that are typical for the individual's biological sex, in order
", b'36 to instill or create physiological or anatomical characteristics that
', b"37 resemble a sex different from the individual's biological sex,
", b'38 including genital gender reassignment surgery or nongenital
', b'39 gender reassignment surgery performed for the purpose of
', b'40 assisting an individual with a gender transition.
', b'41 Sec. 5. As used in this chapter, "gender transition" means the
', b'42 process in which an individual shifts from identifying with and
', b'2023 IN 1231\xe2\x80\x94LS 7276/DI 147
', b'4
', b'1 living as a gender that corresponds to his or her biological sex to
', b'2 identifying with and living as a gender different from his or her
', b'3 biological sex, and may involve social, legal, or physical changes.
', b'4 Sec. 6. (a) As used in this chapter, "gender transition
', b'5 procedures" means any medical or surgical service, including
', b"6 physician's services, inpatient and outpatient hospital services, or
", b'7 prescribed drugs related to gender transition that seeks to:
', b'8 (1) alter or remove physical or anatomical characteristics or
', b"9 features that are typical for the individual's biological sex; or
", b'10 (2) instill or create physiological or anatomical characteristics
', b"11 that resemble a sex different from the individual's biological
", b'12 sex, including medical services that provide puberty blocking
', b'13 drugs, cross sex hormones, or other mechanisms to promote
', b'14 the development of feminizing or masculinizing features in the
', b'15 opposite biological sex, or genital gender reassignment
', b'16 surgery or nongenital gender reassignment surgery
', b'17 performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a
', b'18 gender transition.
', b'19 (b) The term does not include the following:
', b'20 (1) Services to an individual born with a medically verifiable
', b'21 disorder of sex development, including an individual with:
', b'22 (A) external biological sex characteristics that are
', b'23 irresolvably ambiguous;
', b'24 (B) forty-six (46) XX chromosomes with virilization;
', b'25 (C) forty-six (46) XY chromosomes with undervirilization;
', b'26 or
', b'27 (D) both ovarian and testicular tissue.
', b'28 (2) Services provided when a physician has diagnosed  a
', b'29 disorder of sexual development that the physician has
', b'30 determined through genetic or biochemical testing that the
', b'31 individual does not have normal sex chromosome structure,
', b'32 sex steroid hormone production, or sex steroid hormone
', b'33 action.
', b'34 (3) The treatment of any infection, injury, disease, or disorder
', b'35 that has been caused by or exacerbated by the performance of
', b'36 gender transition procedures.
', b'37 (4) Any procedure undertaken because the individual suffers
', b'38 from a physical disorder, physical injury, or physical illness
', b'39 that would, as certified by a physician, place the individual in
', b'40 imminent danger of death or impairment of major bodily
', b'41 function unless surgery is performed.
', b'42 Sec. 7. As used in this chapter, "genital gender reassignment
', b'2023 IN 1231\xe2\x80\x94LS 7276/DI 147
', b'5
', b'1 surgery" means a medical procedure performed for the purpose of
', b'2 assisting an individual with a gender transition, including the
', b'3 following:
', b'4 (1) Surgical procedures, including a penectomy, orchiectomy,
', b'5 vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, or vulvoplasty for biological sex
', b'6 male patients or hysterectomy or ovariectomy for biological
', b'7 sex female patients.
', b'8 (2) Reconstruction of the fixed part of the urethra with or
', b'9 without a metoidioplasty.
', b'10 (3) Phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, or implantation
', b'11 of erection or testicular prostheses for biological sex female
', b'12 patients.
', b'13 Sec. 8. As used in this chapter, "harm" includes the following:
', b'14 (1) Physical injury.
', b'15 (2) Psychological harm or impairment.
', b'16 (3) Emotional distress.
', b'17 Sec. 9. As used in this chapter, "health care professional" refers
', b'18 to the following:
', b'19 (1) A physician licensed under IC 25-22.5.
', b'20 (2) A nurse, including an advanced practice registered nurse,
', b'21 licensed under IC 25-23.
', b'22 (3) Any of the behavioral health or human services
', b'23 professionals licensed under IC 25-23.6.
', b'24 (4) A physician assistant licensed under IC 25-27.5.
', b'25 (5) A psychologist licensed under IC 25-33.
', b'26 Sec. 10. As used in this chapter, "minor" means an individual
', b'27 who is less than eighteen (18) years of age.
', b'28 Sec. 11. As used in this chapter, "nongenital gender
', b'29 reassignment surgery" means medical procedures performed for
', b'30 the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition,
', b'31 including the following:
', b'32 (1) Surgical procedures for biological sex male patients,
', b'33 including augmentation mammoplasty, facial feminization
', b'34 surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, voice surgery, thyroid
', b'35 cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation, hair
', b'36 reconstruction, or associated aesthetic procedures.
', b'37 (2) Surgical procedures for biological sex female patients,
', b'38 including subcutaneous mastectomy, voice surgery,
', b'39 liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, or associated
', b'40 aesthetic procedures.
', b'41 Sec. 12. As used in this chapter, "puberty blocking drugs"
', b'42 means:
', b'2023 IN 1231\xe2\x80\x94LS 7276/DI 147
', b'6
', b'1 (1) gonadotropin releasing hormone analogs or other
', b'2 synthetic drugs used in biological sex males to stop luteinizing
', b'3 hormone secretion and testosterone secretion; or
', b'4 (2) synthetic drugs used in biological sex females that stop the
', b'5 production of estrogens and progesterone;
', b'6 when used to delay or suppress pubertal development in a minor
', b'7 for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition.
', b'8 Sec. 13. As used in this chapter, "public funds" means state,
', b'9 county, or local government funds, in addition to any department,
', b'10 agency, or instrumentality authorized or appropriated funds under
', b'11 state law or derived from any fund in which the funds are
', b'12 deposited.
', b'13 Sec. 14. (a) Except as provided in subsection (c), a health care
', b'14 professional may not provide gender transition procedures to a
', b'15 minor.
', b'16 (b) Except as provided in subsection (c), a health care
', b'17 professional may not refer a minor to any practitioner for gender
', b'18 transition procedures.
', b'19 (c) This section does not prohibit a health care professional from
', b'20 providing any of the following procedures to a minor:
', b'21 (1) Services to individuals born with a medically verifiable
', b'22 disorder of sex development, including individuals having:
', b'23 (A) both ovarian and testicular tissue; or
', b'24 (B) external biological characteristics that are ambiguous
', b'25 resulting from having a 46,XX karyotype with virilization
', b'26 or 46,XY karyotype with undervirilization.
', b'27 (2) Services provided to a minor who has an abnormal sex
', b'28 chromosome structure that has been diagnosed using genetic
', b'29 testing by a physician licensed under IC 25-22.5.
', b'30 (3) The treatment of any infection, injury, disease, or disorder
', b'31 that has been caused by or exacerbated by the performance of
', b'32 gender transition procedures.
', b'33 (4) Any procedure undertaken because the individual suffers
', b'34 from a physical disorder, physical injury, or physical illness
', b'35 that would, as certified by a physician, place the individual in
', b'36 imminent danger of death or impairment of major bodily
', b'37 function unless surgery is performed.
', b'38 Sec. 15. Public funds may not be directly or indirectly used,
', b'39 granted, paid, or distributed to any entity, organization, or
', b'40 individual that provides gender transition procedures to a minor.
', b'41 Sec. 16. Health care services furnished in the following
', b'42 situations may not include gender transition procedures to a
', b'2023 IN 1231\xe2\x80\x94LS 7276/DI 147
', b'7
', b'1 minor:
', b'2 (1) By or in a health care facility owned by the state, a county,
', b'3 or a municipality.
', b'4 (2) By a physician or other practitioner employed  by state,
', b'5 county, or local government.
', b"6 Sec. 17. (a) An individual, or the individual's parent or guardian
", b'7 if the individual is a minor, who suffers harm as a result of a
', b'8 gender transition procedure provided in violation of this chapter
', b'9 may bring a cause of action against the health care professional
', b'10 who provided the procedure.
', b'11 (b) An action described in subsection (a) must be commenced
', b'12 not later than fifteen (15) years after the individual becomes
', b'13 eighteen (18) years of age.
', b"14 (c) A court may award reasonable attorney's fees, litigation
", b'15 expenses, and costs to a person who prevails in an action under
', b'16 subsection (a).
', b'17 SECTION 15. IC 27-2-28 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA CODE
', b'18 AS A NEW CHAPTER TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
', b'19 JULY 1, 2023]:
', b'20 Chapter 28. Gender Transition Procedures
', b'21 Sec. 1. As used in this chapter, "coverage" means the right of an
', b'22 individual to receive:
', b'23 (1) health care services; or
', b'24 (2) payment or reimbursement for health care services;
', b'25 from a health carrier.
', b'26 Sec. 2. As used in this section, "gender transition procedures"
', b'27 has the meaning set forth in IC 16-35-12-6.
', b'28 Sec. 3. (a) As used in this chapter, "health carrier" means an
', b'29 entity:
', b'30 (1) that is subject to this title and the administrative rules
', b'31 adopted under this title; and
', b'32 (2) that enters into a contract to:
', b'33 (A) provide health care services;
', b'34 (B) deliver health care services;
', b'35 (C) arrange for health care services; or
', b'36 (D) pay for or reimburse any of the costs of health care
', b'37 services.
', b'38 (b) The term includes the following:
', b'39 (1) An insurer, as defined in IC 27-1-2-3(x), that issues a
', b'40 policy of accident and sickness insurance, as defined in
', b'41 IC 27-8-5-1(a).
', b'42 (2) A health maintenance organization, as defined in
', b'2023 IN 1231\xe2\x80\x94LS 7276/DI 147
', b'8
', b'1 IC 27-13-1-19.
', b'2 (3) An administrator (as defined in IC 27-1-25-1(a)) that is
', b'3 licensed under IC 27-1-25.
', b'4 (4) A state employee health plan offered under IC 5-10-8.
', b'5 (5) A short term insurance plan (as defined by IC 27-8-5.9-3).
', b'6 (6) Any other entity that provides a plan of health insurance,
', b'7 health benefits, or health care services.
', b'8 (c) The term does not include:
', b'9 (1) an insurer that issues a policy of accident and sickness
', b'10 insurance;
', b'11 (2) a limited service health maintenance organization (as
', b'12 defined in IC 27-13-34-4); or
', b'13 (3) an administrator;
', b'14 that only provides coverage for, or processes claims for, dental or
', b'15 vision care services.
', b'16 Sec. 4. (a) A health plan may not include coverage  or
', b'17 reimbursement for gender transition procedures for an individual
', b'18 who is less than eighteen (18) years of age.
', b'19 (b) A health plan is not required to provide coverage for gender
', b'20 transition procedures.
', b'21 SECTION 16. IC 34-18-1-1 IS AMENDED TO READ AS
', b'22 FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 1. This article does not
', b'23 apply to:
', b'24 (1) an act of malpractice that occurred before July 1, 1975; or
', b'25 (2) an action brought under IC 16-35-12 (gender transition
', b'26 procedures for minors).
', b'2023 IN 1231\xe2\x80\x94LS 7276/DI 147
']

text:
[b' 
', b'FIRST REGULAR SESSION  
', b'SENATE BILL NO. 236  
', b'102ND GENERAL ASSEMBLY   
', b'INTRODUCED BY SENATOR HOSKINS.  
', b'0356S.01I  KRISTINA MARTIN, Secretary   
', b'AN ACT  
', b'To amend chapter 191, RSMo, by adding thereto one new section relating to gender transition 
', b'procedures.  
', b' 
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Missouri, as follows:  
', b'     Section A.  Chapter 191, RSMo, is amended by adding theret o 1 
', b'one new section, to be known as section 191.1720, to read as 2 
', b'follows: 3 
', b'     191.1720.   1.  This section shall be known and may be  1 
', b'cited as the "Missouri Save Adolescents from Experimentation  2 
', b'(SAFE) Act".  3 
', b'     2.  For purposes of this section, the follo wing terms  4 
', b'mean: 5 
', b'     (1)  "Biological sex", the biological indication of  6 
', b'male or female in the context of reproductive potential or  7 
', b'capacity, such as sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex  8 
', b'hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous internal and external  9 
', b'genitalia present at birth, without regard to an  10 
', b"individual's psychological, chosen, or subjective experience  11 
", b'of gender;  12 
', b'     (2)  "Cross-sex hormones":  13 
', b'     (a)  Testosterone or other androgens given to  14 
', b'biological sex females in amounts that are larger o r more  15 
', b'potent than would normally occur naturally in healthy  16 
', b'biological sex females; and  17 
', b'     (b)  Estrogen given to biological sex males in amounts  18 
', b'that are larger or more potent than would normally occur  19 
', b'naturally in healthy biological sex males;  20  SB 236  2 
', b'     (3)  "Gender", the psychological, behavioral, social,  21 
', b'and cultural aspects of being male or female;  22 
', b'     (4)  "Gender reassignment surgery", any medical or  23 
', b'surgical service that seeks to surgically alter or remove  24 
', b'healthy physical or anatomical charac teristics or features  25 
', b"that are typical for the individual's biological sex in  26 
", b'order to instill or create physiological or anatomical    27 
', b'characteristics that resemble a sex different from the  28 
', b"individual's biological sex, including, but not limited to,  29 
", b'genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery performed  30 
', b'for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender  31 
', b'transition;  32 
', b'     (5)  "Gender transition", the process in which an  33 
', b'individual transitions from identifying with and living as a  34 
', b'gender th at corresponds to his or her biological sex to  35 
', b'identifying and living as a gender different from his or her  36 
', b'biological sex, and may involve social, legal, or physical  37 
', b'changes;  38 
', b'     (6)  "Gender transition procedures":  39 
', b'     (a)  Any medical or surgical s ervice, including, but  40 
', b"not limited to, physician's services, inpatient and  41 
", b'outpatient hospital services, or prescribed drugs, related  42 
', b'to gender transition that seeks to:  43 
', b'     a.  Alter or remove physical or anatomical  44 
', b'characteristics or features that a re typical for the  45 
', b"individual's biological sex; or  46 
", b'     b.  Instill or create physiological or anatomical  47 
', b'characteristics that resemble a sex different from the  48 
', b"individual's biological sex, including, but not limited to:  49 
", b'     (i)  Medical services that provide puberty -blocking  50 
', b'drugs, cross -sex hormones, or other mechanisms to promote  51  SB 236  3 
', b'the development of feminizing or masculinizing features in  52 
', b'the opposite biological sex; or  53 
', b'     (ii)  Genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery  54 
', b'performed for the  purpose of assisting an individual with a  55 
', b'gender transition;  56 
', b'     (b)  The term "gender transition procedures" shall not  57 
', b'include:  58 
', b'     a.  Services to individuals born with a medically - 59 
', b'verifiable disorder of sex development, including, but not  60 
', b'limited to, an individual with external biological sex  61 
', b'characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous, such as  62 
', b'those born with forty -six XX chromosomes with virilization,  63 
', b'forty-six XY chromosomes with undervirilization, or having  64 
', b'both ovarian and testicular tissue; 65 
', b'     b.  Services provided when a physician has otherwise  66 
', b'diagnosed an individual with a disorder of sexual  67 
', b'development and determined through genetic or biochemical  68 
', b'testing that the individual does not have normal sex  69 
', b'chromosome structure, sex  steroid hormone production, or sex  70 
', b'steroid hormone action;  71 
', b'     c.  The treatment of any infection, injury, disease, or  72 
', b'disorder that has been caused by or exacerbated by the  73 
', b'performance of gender transition procedures regardless of  74 
', b'whether the gender  transition procedure was performed in  75 
', b'accordance with state and federal law; or  76 
', b'     d.  Any procedure undertaken because the individual  77 
', b'suffers from a physical disorder, physical injury, or  78 
', b'physical illness that would, as certified by a physician,  79 
', b'place the individual in imminent danger of death or  80 
', b'impairment of a major bodily function unless surgery is    81 
', b'performed;  82  SB 236  4 
', b'     (7)  "Genital gender reassignment surgery", a medical  83 
', b'procedure performed for the purpose of assisting an  84 
', b'individual with a gende r transition, including, but not  85 
', b'limited to:  86 
', b'     (a)  Surgical procedures such as penectomy,  87 
', b'orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, or vulvoplasty for  88 
', b'biologically male patients or hysterectomy or ovariectomy  89 
', b'for biologically female patients;  90 
', b'     (b)  Reconstruction of the fixed part of the urethra  91 
', b'with or without a metoidioplasty; or  92 
', b'     (c)  Phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, or  93 
', b'implantation of erection or testicular prostheses for  94 
', b'biologically female patients;  95 
', b'     (8)  "Health care pr ovider", an individual who is  96 
', b'licensed, certified, or otherwise authorized by the laws of  97 
', b'this state to administer health care in the ordinary course  98 
', b'of the practice of his or her profession;  99 
', b'     (9)  "Nongenital gender reassignment surgery", medical  100 
', b'procedures performed for the purpose of assisting an  101 
', b'individual with a gender transition, including, but not  102 
', b'limited to:  103 
', b'     (a)  Surgical procedures for biologically male  104 
', b'patients, such as augmentation mammoplasty, facial  105 
', b'feminization surgery, liposu ction, lipofilling, voice  106 
', b'surgery, thyroid cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation,  107 
', b'hair reconstruction, or various aesthetic procedures; or  108 
', b'     (b)  Surgical procedures for biologically female  109 
', b'patients, such as subcutaneous mastectomy, voice surgery ,  110 
', b'liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, or various  111 
', b'aesthetic procedures;  112 
', b'     (10)  "Physician", an individual who is licensed under  113 
', b'chapter 334;  114  SB 236  5 
', b'     (11)  "Puberty -blocking drugs", gonadotropin -releasing  115 
', b'hormone analogues or other synthetic dr ugs used in  116 
', b'biological sex males to stop luteinizing hormone secretion  117 
', b'and therefore testosterone secretion, or synthetic drugs  118 
', b'used in biological sex females that stop the production of  119 
', b'estrogens and progesterone, when used to delay or suppress  120 
', b'pubertal development in children for the purpose of  121 
', b'assisting an individual with a gender transition.  122 
', b'     3.  A physician or other health care provider shall not  123 
', b'provide gender transition procedures to any individual under  124 
', b'eighteen years of age and shall no t refer any individual  125 
', b'under eighteen years of age to any health care provider for  126 
', b'gender transition procedures.  127 
', b'     4.  Any referral for or provision of gender transition  128 
', b'procedures to an individual under eighteen years of age  129 
', b'shall be considered unp rofessional conduct and any health  130 
', b'care provider doing so may be subject to discipline by the  131 
', b'appropriate licensing entity or disciplinary review board  132 
', b'with competent jurisdiction in this state.  133 
', b'     5.  The provision of gender transition procedures to an  134 
', b'individual under eighteen years of age in violation of the  135 
', b'provisions of this section shall be considered grounds for a  136 
', b'cause of action against the health care provider for  137 
', b'personal injury or death under chapter 538 and such cause of  138 
', b'action shall b e governed by the provisions of such chapter.    139 
', b'An individual under eighteen years of age upon whom gender  140 
', b'transition procedures were performed in violation of this  141 
', b'section may bring the cause of action either through a next  142 
', b'friend or his or her own nam e, subject to the provisions of  143 
', b'section 516.105.  144

title: Health care; creating the Oklahoma Save Adolescents from Experimentation (SAFE) Act; prohibiting gender transition procedures; providing for administrative and civil enforcement. Emergency.

', b'AS INTRODUCED  
', b' 
', b'An Act relating to health care; creating the  Oklahoma 
', b'Save Adolescents fro m Experimentatio n (SAFE) Act ; 
', b'providing short title;  defining terms ; prohibiting 
', b'provision of or referral for gender transition 
', b'procedures ; providing exceptions; pro hibiting certain 
', b'uses of public funds, public facilities , public 
', b'employees , and state M edicaid program ; providing for 
', b'administrative  and civil enforce ment; au thorizing 
', b'certain civil actions  and relief ; providing certain 
', b'construction; providing for codification; and 
', b'declaring an emergency .

', b'BE IT ENACTED BY THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA:  
', b'SECTION 1.     NEW LAW     A new s ection of  law to be codified 
', b'in the Oklahoma Statutes as Section 2607.1 of Title 63, unless there 
', b'is created a duplication in numbering, reads as follows:  
', b'This act shall be known and may be cited as the \xe2\x80\x9cOklahoma S ave 
', b'Adolescents fro m Experimentation (SAFE) Act \xe2\x80\x9d. 
', b'SECTION 2.     NEW LAW     A new section of law to be codified

', b'1.  \xe2\x80\x9cBiological sex \xe2\x80\x9d means the biological indication of male  and 
', b'female in the context of reproductive potential or capacity, such as

', b'or her biological sex to identifying w ith and living as a gender 
', b'different from  his or he r biological sex, and may inv olve social,

', b'(4) any procedure undertaken because the individual 
', b'suffers from a physical disorder, physical

', b'7.  \xe2\x80\x9cGenital gender reassignment surgery \xe2\x80\x9d means a medical

', b'procedures perf ormed for the purpose of assisting an indiv idual wi th 
', b'a gender transition includ ing but not limited to:
