', b'24  SECTION 3.     NEW LAW     A new  section of law to be codified 
', b'in the Oklahoma Statutes as Section 2607. 3 of Title 63, unless there 
', b'is created a duplication in numbering, reads as follows:  
', b'A.  A physician or other healthcare professional shall not 
', b'provide gen der transition procedures to any individual under 
', b'eighteen (18)  years of age.  
', b'B.  A physician or other healthcare professional shall not refer 
', b'any individual under eighteen (18)  years of ag e to any healthc are 
', b'professional for gender transition procedures.  
', b'C.  A physician or other healthcare professional is not 
', b'prohibited from providing any of the following procedures which are 
', b'not gender transition procedures to an individual under eighteen 
', b'(18) years of ag e:

', b'disorder of sexual development that the physician has determined 
', b'through genetic or biochemical testing that the  person does not have 
', b'normal sex chro mosome struc ture, sex steroid hormone  production, or 
', b'sex steroid hormone action;

', b'that has been caused by or exacerbated by the performance  of gender

', b'SECTION 4.     NEW LAW     A new sect ion of law to be codifi ed 
', b'in the Oklahoma Statutes as Section 2607.4 of Title 63, unless there

', b'B.  Healthcare services furnished in the following situations 
', b'shall not include gen der transition procedures to an indivi dual 
', b'under eighteen (18)  years of age: 
', b'1.  By or in a healthcare facility o wned by the state or a 
', b'county or local government; or

', b'SECTION 5.     NEW LAW     A new section of law to be codified 
', b'in the Oklahoma Statutes as Section 26 07.5 of Title 63, unless there 
', b'is created a duplication in numbering, reads as follows:  
', b'A.  Any referral for or provision of gender transiti on 
', b'procedures to an individual u nder eighteen (18)  years of age is  
', b'unprofessional conduct and shall , upon an adverse ruling by the 
', b'appropriate licensing board,  result in immediate revocation of the 
', b'license or certificate of the physician or othe r healthcare 
', b'professional . 
', b'B.  1.  A person may assert a n actual or threatene d violation of 
', b'this act as a claim or defense in a j udicial or admi nistrative 
', b'proceeding and obtain compensatory damages, injunctive relief, 
', b'declaratory relief, or any other appropriate relief.  
', b'2.  A person shall bring a claim for a vi olation of this act no 
', b'later than two (2) years after the day the cause of action accrue s. 
', b'3.  An individual under eighteen (18) years of age may bring an 
', b'action throughout their minority through a parent or next friend , 
', b'and may bring an action in their o wn name upon reaching majority at

', b'4.  Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an action under

text:
[b'LEGISLATURE OF NEBRASKA
', b'ONE HUNDRED EIGHTH LEGISLATURE
', b'FIRST SESSION
', b'LEGISLATIVE BILL 574
', b'\xc2\xa0
', b'Introduced by Kauth, 31; Aguilar, 35; Albrecht, 17; Bostelman, 23;
', b'Brewer, 43; Clements, 2; DeKay, 40; Dorn, 30; Dover, 19;
', b'Erdman, 47; Halloran, 33; Hardin, 48; Holdcroft, 36;
', b'Hughes, 24; Ibach, 44; Jacobson, 42; Linehan, 39;
', b'Lippincott, 34; Lowe, 37; McDonnell, 5; Murman, 38;
', b'Sanders, 45; von Gillern, 4.
', b'Read first time January 17, 2023
', b'Committee:
', b'A BILL FOR AN ACT relating to public health and welfare; to amend section 1
', b'38-179, Revised Statutes Cumulative Supplement, 2022; to adopt the 2
', b'Let Them Grow Act; to harmonize provisions; to provide an operative 3
', b'date; to provide severability; and to repeal the original section. 4
', b'Be it enacted by the people of the State of Nebraska, 5LB574
', b'2023LB574
', b'2023
', b'-1-Section 1. Section 38-179, Revised Statutes Cumulative Supplement, 1
', b'2022, is amended to read: 2
', b'38-179 For purposes of section 38-178, unprofessional conduct means 3
', b'any departure from or failure to conform to the standards of acceptable 4
', b'and prevailing practice of a profession or the ethics of the profession, 5
', b'regardless of whether a person, consumer, or entity is injured, or 6
', b'conduct that is likely to deceive or defraud the public or is detrimental 7
', b'to the public interest, including, but not limited to: 8
', b'(1) Receipt of fees on the assurance that an incurable disease can 9
', b'be permanently cured; 10
', b'(2) Division of fees, or agreeing to split or divide the fees, 11
', b'received for professional services with any person for bringing or 12
', b'referring a consumer other than (a) with a partner or employee of the 13
', b'applicant or credential holder or his or her office or clinic, (b) with a 14
', b'landlord of the applicant or credential holder pursuant to a written 15
', b'agreement that provides for payment of rent based on gross receipts, or 16
', b'(c) with a former partner or employee of the applicant or credential 17
', b'holder based on a retirement plan or separation agreement; 18
', b'(3) Obtaining any fee for professional services by fraud, deceit, or 19
', b'misrepresentation, including, but not limited to, falsification of third- 20
', b'party claim documents; 21
', b'(4) Cheating on or attempting to subvert the credentialing 22
', b'examination; 23
', b'(5) Assisting in the care or treatment of a consumer without the 24
', b'consent of such consumer or his or her legal representative; 25
', b'(6) Use of any letters, words, or terms, either as a prefix, affix, 26
', b'or suffix, on stationery, in advertisements, or otherwise, indicating 27
', b'that such person is entitled to practice a profession for which he or she 28
', b'is not credentialed; 29
', b'(7) Performing, procuring, or aiding and abetting in the performance 30
', b'or procurement of a criminal abortion; 31LB574
', b'2023LB574
', b'2023
', b'-2-(8) Knowingly disclosing confidential information except as 1
', b'otherwise permitted by law; 2
', b'(9) Commission of any act of sexual abuse, misconduct, or 3
', b'exploitation related to the practice of the profession of the applicant 4
', b'or credential holder; 5
', b'(10) Failure to keep and maintain adequate records of treatment or 6
', b'service; 7
', b'(11) Prescribing, administering, distributing, dispensing, giving, 8
', b'or selling any controlled substance or other drug recognized as addictive 9
', b'or dangerous for other than a medically accepted therapeutic purpose; 10
', b'(12) Prescribing any controlled substance to (a) oneself or (b) 11
', b"except in the case of a medical emergency (i) one's spouse, (ii) one's 12
", b"child, (iii) one's parent, (iv) one's sibling, or (v) any other person 13
", b'living in the same household as the prescriber; 14
', b'(13) Failure to comply with any federal, state, or municipal law, 15
', b'ordinance, rule, or regulation that pertains to the applicable 16
', b'profession; 17
', b'(14) Disruptive behavior, whether verbal or physical, which 18
', b'interferes with consumer care or could reasonably be expected to 19
', b'interfere with such care;  and 20
', b'(15) Performing gender altering procedures for an individual younger 21
', b'than nineteen years of age in violation of section 5 of this act; and 22
', b'(16)  (15)  Such other acts as may be defined in rules and 23
', b'regulations. 24
', b'Nothing in this section shall be construed to exclude determination 25
', b'of additional conduct that is unprofessional by adjudication in 26
', b'individual contested cases. 27
', b'Sec. 2.  Sections 2 to 7 of this act shall be known and may be cited 28
', b'as the Let Them Grow Act. 29
', b'Sec. 3. \xc2\xa0 The Legislature finds that: 30
', b'(1) The state has a compelling government interest in protecting the 31LB574
', b'2023LB574
', b'2023
', b'-3-health and safety of its citizens, especially vulnerable children; 1
', b'(2) Genital and nongenital gender altering surgeries are generally 2
', b'not recommended for children, although evidence indicates referral for 3
', b'children to have such surgeries are becoming more frequent; and 4
', b'(3) Genital and nongenital gender altering surgery includes several 5
', b'irreversible and invasive procedures for biological males and biological 6
', b'females and involves the alteration of biologically healthy and 7
', b'functional body parts. 8
', b'Sec. 4. \xc2\xa0 For purposes of the Let Them Grow Act: 9
', b'(1) Biological sex means the biological indication of male and 10
', b'female in the context of reproductive potential or capacity, such as sex 11
', b'chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous 12
', b'internal and external genitalia present at birth, without regard to an 13
', b"individual's psychological, chosen, or subjective experience of gender; 14
", b'(2) Cross-sex hormones means testosterone or other androgens given 15
', b'to biological females in amounts that are larger or more potent than 16
', b'would normally occur naturally in healthy biological sex females and 17
', b'estrogen given to biological males in amounts that are larger or more 18
', b'potent than would normally occur naturally in healthy biological sex 19
', b'males; 20
', b'(3) Gender means the psychological, behavioral, social, and cultural 21
', b'aspects of being male or female; 22
', b'(4) Gender altering surgery means any medical or surgical service 23
', b'that seeks to surgically alter or remove healthy physical or anatomical 24
', b"characteristics or features that are typical for the individual's 25
", b'biological sex in order to instill or create physiological or anatomical 26
', b"characteristics that resemble a sex different from the individual's 27
", b'biological sex, including without limitation, genital or nongenital 28
', b'gender altering surgery performed for the purpose of assisting an 29
', b'individual with a gender alteration; 30
', b'(5) Gender alteration means the process in which a person goes from 31LB574
', b'2023LB574
', b'2023
', b'-4-identifying with and living as a gender that corresponds to his or her 1
', b'biological sex to identifying with and living as a gender different from 2
', b'his or her biological sex and may involve social, legal, or physical 3
', b'changes; 4
', b'(6)(a) Gender altering procedures includes any medical or surgical 5
', b"service, including without limitation physician's services, inpatient and 6
", b'outpatient hospital services, or prescribed drugs related to gender 7
', b'alteration, that seeks to: 8
', b'(i) Alter or remove physical or anatomical characteristics or 9
', b"features that are typical for the individual's biological sex; or 10
", b'(ii) Instill or create physiological or anatomical characteristics 11
', b"that resemble a sex different from the individual's biological sex, 12
", b'including without limitation medical services that provide puberty- 13
', b'blocking drugs, cross-sex hormones, or other mechanisms to promote the 14
', b'development of feminizing or masculinizing features in the opposite 15
', b'biological sex, or genital or nongenital gender altering surgery 16
', b'performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender 17
', b'alteration; 18
', b'(b) Gender altering procedures does not include: 19
', b'(i) Services to persons born with a medically verifiable disorder of 20
', b'sex development, including a person with external biological sex 21
', b'characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous, such as those born with 22
', b'46 XX chromosomes with virilization, 46 XY chromosomes with 23
', b'undervirilization, or having both ovarian and testicular tissue; 24
', b'(ii) Services provided when a health care practitioner has otherwise 25
', b'diagnosed a disorder of sexual development that the health care 26
', b'practitioner has determined, through genetic or biochemical testing, that 27
', b'the person does not have normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid 28
', b'production, or sex steroid hormone action; 29
', b'(iii) The acute and chronic treatment of any infection, injury, 30
', b'disease, or disorder that has been caused by or exacerbated by the 31LB574
', b'2023LB574
', b'2023
', b'-5-performance of gender altering procedures, whether or not the gender 1
', b'altering procedure was performed in accordance with state and federal 2
', b'law; or 3
', b'(iv) Any procedure undertaken because the individual suffers from a 4
', b'physical disorder, physical injury, or physical illness that would, as 5
', b'certified by the health care practitioner, place the individual in 6
', b'imminent danger of death or impairment of major bodily function unless 7
', b'surgery is performed; 8
', b'(7) Genital gender altering surgery means a medical procedure 9
', b'performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender 10
', b'alteration, including without limitation: 11
', b'(a) Surgical procedures such as penectomy, orchiectomy, 12
', b'vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, or vulvoplasty for biologically male 13
', b'patients or hysterectomy or ovariectomy for biologically female patients; 14
', b'(b) Reconstruction of the fixed part of the urethra with or without 15
', b'a metoidioplasty; or 16
', b'(c) Phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, or implantation of 17
', b'erection or testicular prostheses for biologically female patients; 18
', b'(8) Health care practitioner means a person licensed or certified 19
', b'under the Uniform Credentialing Act; 20
', b'(9) Puberty-blocking drugs means gonadotropin-releasing hormone 21
', b'analogues or other synthetic drugs used in biological males to stop 22
', b'luteinizing hormone secretion and therefore testosterone secretion, or 23
', b'synthetic drugs used in biological females which stop the production of 24
', b'estrogens and progesterone, when used to delay or suppress pubertal 25
', b'development in children for the purpose of assisting an individual with a 26
', b'gender alteration; and 27
', b'(10) Nongenital gender altering surgery means medical procedures 28
', b'performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender 29
', b'alteration, including without limitation: 30
', b'(a) Surgical procedures for biologically male patients, such as 31LB574
', b'2023LB574
', b'2023
', b'-6-augmentation mammoplasty, facial feminization surgery, liposuction, 1
', b'lipofilling, voice surgery, thyroid cartilage reduction, gluteal 2
', b'augmentation, hair reconstruction, or various aesthetic procedures; or 3
', b'(b) Surgical procedures for biologically female patients, such as 4
', b'subcutaneous mastectomy, voice surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, 5
', b'pectoral implants, or various aesthetic procedures. 6
', b'Sec. 5.  (1) No health care practitioner shall (a) perform gender 7
', b'altering procedures in this state for an individual younger than nineteen 8
', b'years of age or (b) refer an individual younger than nineteen years of 9
', b'age for gender altering procedures. 10
', b'(2) The intentional and knowing performance of or referral for 11
', b'gender altering procedures by a health care practitioner for an 12
', b'individual younger than nineteen years of age in violation of subsection 13
', b'(1) of this section shall be considered unprofessional conduct as defined 14
', b'in section 38-179. 15
', b'Sec. 6.  State funds shall not be directly or indirectly used, 16
', b'granted, paid, or distributed to any entity, organization, or individual 17
', b'that provides gender altering procedures to an individual younger than 18
', b'nineteen years of age. 19
', b'Sec. 7.  An individual that received a gender altering procedure 20
', b'while such individual was younger than nineteen years of age, or the 21
', b'parent or guardian of such an individual, may bring a civil action for 22
', b'appropriate relief against the health care practitioner who performed the 23
', b'gender altering procedure or referred the individual under nineteen years 24
', b'of age for the gender altering procedure. Appropriate relief in an action 25
', b"under this section includes actual damages and reasonable attorney's 26
", b'fees. An action under this section shall be brought within 2 years from 27
', b'discovery of damages. 28
', b'Sec. 8. \xc2\xa0This act becomes operative on October 1, 2023. 29
', b'Sec. 9.  If any section in this act or any part of any section is 30
', b'declared invalid or unconstitutional, the declaration shall not affect 31LB574
', b'2023LB574
', b'2023
', b'-7-the validity or constitutionality of the remaining portions. 1
', b'Sec. 10.  Original section 38-179, Revised Statutes Cumulative 2
', b'Supplement, 2022, is repealed. 3LB574
', b'2023LB574
', b'2023
', b'-8-']

title: Establishes the "Missouri Child and Adolescent Protection Act"
description: Establishes the "Missouri Child and Adolescent Protection Act"

supplements: [{'supplement_id': 301315, 'date': '0000-00-00', 'type': 'Analysis', 'type_id': 2, 'title': 'Analysis', 'description': 'Summary: Introduced', 'mime': 'text/html', 'mime_id': 1, 'url': 'https://legiscan.com/MO/supplement/SB598/id/301315', 'state_link': 'https://www.senate.mo.gov/23info/BTS_Web/Summary.aspx?SessionType=R&SummaryID=1891326&BillID=2967412', 'supplement_size': 1525, 'supplement_hash': '33d92cdf6c08418109bc6a35a1bc34be'}]
text:
[b' 
', b'FIRST REGULAR SESSION  
', b'SENATE BILL NO. 598  
', b'102ND GENERAL ASSEMBLY   
', b'INTRODUCED BY SENATOR BRATTIN.  
', b'2176S.01I  KRISTINA MARTIN, Secretary   
', b'AN ACT  
', b'To amend chapter 191, RSMo, by adding thereto seven new sections relating to gender transition 
', b'procedures, with a delayed effective date.  
', b' 
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Missouri, as follows:  
', b'     Section A.  Chapter 191,  RSMo, is amended by adding thereto 1 
', b'seven new sections, to be known as sections 191.1720, 191.1725, 2 
', b'191.1730, 191.1735, 191.1740, 191.1742, and 191.1745, to read 3 
', b'as follows: 4 
', b'     191.1720.   Sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 shall be known  1 
', b'and may be cited as  the "Missouri Child and Adolescent  2 
', b'Protection (MCAP) Act".  3 
', b'     191.1725.   For purposes of sections 191.1720 to  1 
', b'191.1745, the following terms mean:  2 
', b'     (1)  "Biological sex", the biological indication of  3 
', b'male or female in the context of reproductive potential or  4 
', b'capacity, such as sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex  5 
', b'hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous internal and external  6 
', b'genitalia present at birth, without regard to an  7 
', b"individual's psychological, chosen, or subjective experience  8 
", b'of gender;  9 
', b'     (2)  "Cross-sex hormones":  10 
', b'     (a)  Testosterone or other androgens given to  11 
', b'biological sex females in amounts that are larger or more  12 
', b'potent than would normally occur naturally in healthy  13 
', b'biological sex females; and  14  SB 598  2 
', b'     (b)  Estrogen  given to biological sex males in amounts  15 
', b'that are larger or more potent than would normally occur  16 
', b'naturally in healthy biological sex males;  17 
', b'     (3)  "Gender", the psychological, behavioral, social,  18 
', b'and cultural aspects of being male or female;  19 
', b'     (4)  "Gender transition", the process in which an  20 
', b'individual transitions from identifying with and living as a  21 
', b'gender that corresponds to his or her biological sex to  22 
', b'identifying with and living as a gender different from his  23 
', b'or her biological sex and m ay involve social, legal, or  24 
', b'physical changes;  25 
', b'     (5)  "Gender transition procedure":  26 
', b'     (a)  Any medical or surgical service, including, but  27 
', b"not limited to, physician's services, inpatient and  28 
", b'outpatient hospital services, or prescribed drugs, rela ted  29 
', b'to gender transition that seeks to:  30 
', b'     a.  Alter or remove physical or anatomical  31 
', b'characteristics or features that are typical for the  32 
', b"individual's biological sex; or  33 
", b'     b.  Instill or create physiological or anatomical  34 
', b'characteristics that res emble a sex different from the  35 
', b"individual's biological sex, including, but not limited to:  36 
", b'     (i)  Medical services that provide puberty -blocking  37 
', b'drugs, cross -sex hormones, or other mechanisms to promote  38 
', b'the development of features commonly associated  with members  39 
', b'of the opposite sex; or  40 
', b'     (ii)  Genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery  41 
', b'performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a  42 
', b'gender transition;  43 
', b'     (b)  The term "gender transition procedure" shall not  44 
', b'include:  45  SB 598  3 
', b'     a.  Services to individuals born with a medically  46 
', b'verifiable disorder of sex development, including, but not  47 
', b'limited to, an individual with external biological sex  48 
', b'characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous, such as  49 
', b'those born with 46,XX chromosome s with virilization, 46,XY  50 
', b'chromosomes with undervirilization, or having both ovarian  51 
', b'and testicular tissue;  52 
', b'     b.  Services provided when a physician has otherwise  53 
', b'diagnosed an individual with a disorder of sex development  54 
', b'and determined through gen etic or biochemical testing that  55 
', b'the individual does not have normal sex chromosome  56 
', b'structure, sex steroid hormone production, or sex steroid  57 
', b'hormone action;  58 
', b'     c.  The treatment of any infection, injury, disease, or  59 
', b'disorder that has been caused by or exacerbated by the  60 
', b'performance of gender transition procedures regardless of  61 
', b'whether the gender transition procedure was performed in  62 
', b'accordance with state and federal law; or  63 
', b'     d.  Any procedure undertaken because the individual  64 
', b'suffers from a p hysical disorder, physical injury, or  65 
', b'physical illness that would, as certified by a physician,  66 
', b'place the individual in imminent danger of death or  67 
', b'impairment of a major bodily function unless surgery is  68 
', b'performed;  69 
', b'     (6)  "Genital gender reassignmen t surgery", a medical  70 
', b'procedure performed for the purpose of assisting an  71 
', b'individual with a gender transition, including, but not  72 
', b'limited to:  73 
', b'     (a)  Surgical procedures such as penectomy,  74 
', b'orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, or vulvoplasty for  75 
', b'biologically male patients or hysterectomy or ovariectomy  76 
', b'for biologically female patients;  77  SB 598  4 
', b'     (b)  Reconstruction of the fixed part of the urethra  78 
', b'with or without a metoidioplasty; or  79 
', b'     (c)  Phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, or  80 
', b'implantatio n of erection or testicular prostheses for  81 
', b'biologically female patients;  82 
', b'     (7)  "Health care provider", an individual who is  83 
', b'licensed, certified, or otherwise authorized by the laws of  84 
', b'this state to administer health care in the ordinary course  85 
', b'of the practice of his or her profession, including mental  86 
', b'health care providers;  87 
', b'     (8)  "Nongenital gender reassignment surgery", a  88 
', b'medical procedure performed for the purpose of assisting an  89 
', b'individual with a gender transition, including, but not  90 
', b'limited to: 91 
', b'     (a)  Surgical procedures for biologically male  92 
', b'patients, such as augmentation mammoplasty, facial  93 
', b'feminization surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, voice  94 
', b'surgery, thyroid cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation,  95 
', b'hair reconstruction, or var ious aesthetic procedures; or  96 
', b'     (b)  Surgical procedures for biologically female  97 
', b'patients, such as subcutaneous mastectomy, voice surgery,  98 
', b'liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, or various  99 
', b'aesthetic procedures;  100 
', b'     (9)  "Physician", an individ ual who is licensed as a  101 
', b'physician under chapter 334;  102 
', b'     (10)  "Puberty -blocking drugs", gonadotropin -releasing  103 
', b'hormone analogues or other synthetic drugs used in  104 
', b'biological sex males to stop luteinizing hormone secretion  105 
', b'and therefore testosterone s ecretion, or synthetic drugs  106 
', b'used in biological sex females that stop the production of  107 
', b'estrogens and progesterone, when used to delay or suppress  108  SB 598  5 
', b'pubertal development in children for the purpose of  109 
', b'assisting an individual with a gender transition;  110 
', b'     (11)  "Public funds", any funds received or controlled  111 
', b'by this state or any agency or political subdivision  112 
', b'thereof, including, but not limited to, funds derived from  113 
', b'federal, state or local taxes, gifts or grants from any  114 
', b'source, public or private, federal grants or payments, or  115 
', b'intergovernmental transfers.  116 
', b'     191.1730.   A physician  or other health care provider   1 
', b'shall not knowingly  provide gender transition  procedures  to  2 
', b'any individual  under eighteen  years of age and shall not  3 
', b'refer any individual  under eighteen  years of age to any  4 
', b'health care provider  for gender transition  procedures.  5 
', b'     191.1735.   1.  Public funds shall not be directly or  1 
', b'indirectly used, granted, paid, or distributed to any  2 
', b'individual, entity,  or organization that provides gender  3 
', b'transition procedures to an individual under eighteen years  4 
', b'of age. 5 
', b'     2.  The MO HealthNet program shall not reimburse or  6 
', b'provide coverage for gender transition procedures to an  7 
', b'individual under eighteen years o f age. 8 
', b'     3.  The provisions of this section shall not apply to  9 
', b'any speech protected by the First Amendment of the United  10 
', b'States Constitution.  11 
', b'     191.1740.   Any referral  for or provision  of gender  1 
', b'transition  procedures  to an individual  under eighteen  years  2 
', b'of age shall be considered  unprofessional  conduct and any  3 
', b'health care provider  doing so may be subject to discipline   4 
', b'by the appropriate  licensing  entity or disciplinary  review  5 
', b'board with competent  jurisdiction  in this state. 6 
', b'     191.1742.   Sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 shall not  1 
', b'apply to the provision of cross -sex hormones to any  2  SB 598  6 
', b'individual under eighteen years of age who was prescribed  3 
', b'cross-sex hormones before January 1, 2024, to treat an  4 
', b"inconsistency be tween the individual's biological sex and  5 
", b"the individual's perceived gender or perceived sex.  6 
", b'     191.1745.   1.  The provision of a gender transition  1 
', b'procedure to an individual under eighteen years of age in  2 
', b'violation of sections 191.1720  to 191.1745 shall be  3 
', b'considered grounds for a cause of action against the  4 
', b'physician or health care provider.  5 
', b'     2.  The provisions of chapter 538 shall not apply to  6 
', b'any action brought under this section.  7 
', b'     3.  (1)  An individual under eighteen yea rs of age may  8 
', b'bring an action under this section throughout the  9 
', b"individual's minority through a parent or next friend and  10 
", b"may bring an action under this section in the individual's  11 
", b'own name upon reaching the age of majority at any time from  12 
', b'that point  until twenty years after reaching the age of  13 
', b'majority or four years from the time of discovery by the  14 
', b'injured party of both the injury and the causal relationship  15 
', b'between the treatment and the injury, whichever date is  16 
', b'later. 17 
', b'     (2)  If, at the time  the individual described in  18 
', b'subsection 1 of this section attains eighteen years of age,  19 
', b'he or she is under a legal disability, the limitation period  20 
', b'under subdivision (1) of this subsection shall not begin to  21 
', b'run until the removal of the disability.  22 
', b'     (3)  The limitation period in subdivision (1) of this  23 
', b'subsection shall not run during a time period when the  24 
', b'individual is subject to threats, intimidation,  25 
', b'manipulation, fraudulent concealment, or fraud perpetrated  26 
', b'by the physician or other health  care professional who  27 
', b'prescribed or otherwise provided gender transition  28  SB 598  7 
', b'procedures or by any person acting in the interest of the  29 
', b'physician or other health care professional.  30 
', b'     4.  (1)  An individual may assert an actual or  31 
', b'threatened violation of  sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 as a  32 
', b'claim or defense in a judicial proceeding.  33 
', b'     (2)  The following damages may be awarded to a claimant  34 
', b'described in subdivision (1) of this subsection:  35 
', b'     (a)  Compensatory damages including, but not limited to:  36 
', b'     a.  Pain and suffering;  37 
', b'     b.  Loss of reputation;  38 
', b'     c.  Loss of income; and  39 
', b'     d.  Loss of consortium including, but not limited to,  40 
', b'the loss of expectation of sharing parenthood;  41 
', b'     (b)  Injunctive relief;  42 
', b'     (c)  Declaratory judgment;  43 
', b'     (d)  Punitive damages; and  44 
', b'     (e)  Any other appropriate relief.  45 
', b'     (3)  A prevailing party who establishes a violation of  46 
', b'sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 shall recover reasonable  47 
', b"attorney's fees.  48 
", b'     5.  Notwithstanding any other provision of law to  the  49 
', b'contrary, an action under this section may be commenced, and  50 
', b'relief may be granted, in a judicial proceeding without  51 
', b'regard to whether the individual commencing the action has  52 
', b'sought or exhausted available administrative remedies.  53 
', b'     6.  The attorney general may bring an action to enforce  54 
', b'compliance with sections 191.1720 to 191.1745.  55 
', b'     7.  Sections 191.1720 to 191.1745 do not deny, impair,  56 
', b'or otherwise affect any right or authority of the attorney  57 
', b'general, the state, or any agency, officer , or employee of  58 
', b'the state, acting under any law other than sections 191.1720  59 
', b'to 191.1745, to institute or intervene in any proceeding.  60  SB 598  8 
', b'     Section B.   The enactment of sections 191.1720 to  1 
', b'191.1745 of this act shall become effective on J anuary 1,  2 
', b'2024. 3

title: Prohibiting certain medical practices
description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit certain medical practices.

', b'WEST virginia legislature
', b'2021 SECOND EXTRAORDINARY session
', b'Introduced
', b'Senate Bill 2007
', b'By Senators Blair (Mr. President) and Baldwin
', b'(By Request of the Executive)
', b'[Introduced June 24, 2021]
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'A BILL supplementing and amending the appropriations of
', b'public moneys out of the Treasury from the balance of moneys remaining as an
', b'unappropriated balance in the State Fund, General Revenue, to the Department of
', b'Arts, Culture, and History, Division of Culture and History, fund 0293, fiscal
', b'year 2021, organization 0432, by supplementing and amending the appropriations
', b'for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2021.
', b'Whereas, The Governor submitted to the Legislature the
', b'Executive Budget Document, dated February 10, 2021, which included a Statement
', b'of the State Fund, General Revenue, setting forth therein the cash balance as
', b'of July 1, 2020, and further included an estimate of revenues for the fiscal
', b'year 2021, less net appropriation balances forwarded and regular appropriations
', b'for the fiscal year 2021; and
', b'Whereas, The Governor submitted to the Legislature an
', b'Executive Message dated June 7, 2021, which included a revised estimate of
', b'revenues for the State Fund, General Revenue, and a Statement of the State
', b'Fund, General Revenue, for the fiscal year 2021; and 
', b'Whereas, The Governor submitted to the Legislature an
', b'Executive Message dated June 24, 2021, which included a revised estimate of
', b'revenues for the State Fund, General Revenue, and a Statement of the State Fund,
', b'General Revenue, for the fiscal year 2021; and
', b'Whereas, It appears from the Statement of the State Fund,
', b'General Revenue, and Executive messages, there remains an unappropriated
', b'balance in the State Treasury which is available for appropriation during the
', b'fiscal year ending June 30, 2021; therefore
', b'Be it enacted by the Legislature of West Virginia:
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'
', b'That the total appropriation for the fiscal year ending

title: Public health and safety; defining terms; health care professionals; gender transition procedures; referrals; exceptions; public funds; Medicaid program reimbursements; felony penalties; statute of limitations; unprofessional conduct; license revocation; statute of limitations; claims or defenses; civil actions; administrative remedies; attorney fees; Attorney General; codification; effective date.

[b'

', b'Req. No. 5096  Page 1

', b'24  STATE OF OKLAHOMA  
', b' 
', b'1st Session of the 59th L egislature (2023)  
', b' 
', b'HOUSE BILL  1011 By: Olsen 
', b' 
', b' 
', b' 
', b' 
', b' 
', b'AS INTRODUCED  
', b' 
', b'An Act relating to public health and safety ; defining 
', b'terms; prohibiting  certain healt h care professionals 
', b'from performing or attemp ting to perform  gender 
', b'transition procedures to certa in individuals ; 
', b'prohibiting  certain health  care professionals from 
', b'making certain referrals ; providing exceptions ; 
', b'prohibiting use of public funds for gender transitio n 
', b'procedures ; prohibiting gender tra nsition procedures 
', b'under certain circumstances; prohibiting state 
', b'Medicaid program reimbursements ; providing for felony 
', b'penalties ; authorizing fine or confinement or both; 
', b'prescribing  statute of lim itations ; defining certain 
', b'conduct as unprofessional ; requiring revocation of 
', b'license or certificate ; prescribing statute of 
', b'limitation s for disciplinary proce edings; authorizing 
', b'certain claims or defenses ; prescri bing statute of 
', b'limitations ; authorizing civil actions by minors; 
', b'authorizing civil actions after ma jority; authorizing 
', b'certain actions without exhaustion of administrative 
', b'remedies; authorizing attorney fees; authorizing 
', b'Attorney General to bring enforcement actions; 
', b'providing for constr uction of act;  providing for 
', b'codification ; and providing an effecti ve date. 
', b' 
', b' 
', b' 
', b' 
', b' 
', b'BE IT ENACTED BY THE PEOPLE  OF THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA:  
', b'SECTION 1.     NEW LAW     A new section of law to be codified 
', b'in the Oklahoma Statutes as Section 2607.1 of Title 63, unless there 
', b'is created a duplication in numbe ring, reads as follo ws:  
', b' 
', b'Req. No. 5096  Page 2 
', b' 1 
', b'2 
', b'3 
', b'4 
', b'5 
', b'6 
', b'7 
', b'8 
', b'9 
', b'10 
', b'11 
', b'12 
', b'13 
', b'14 
', b'15 
', b'16 
', b'17 
', b'18 
', b'19 
', b'20 
', b'21 
', b'22 
', b'23 
', b'24  As used in this act:  
', b'1.  "Biological sex " means the biological indication of male and 
', b'female in the context of reproductive potential or capacity, such as 
', b'sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads, and 
', b'nonambiguous i nternal and external  genitalia present at birth, 
', b"without regard to an individual 's psychological, chosen, or 
", b'subjective experience of gender;  
', b'2.  "Cross-sex hormones " means: 
', b'a. testosterone or other androgens given to biological 
', b'females in amounts that are  larger or more pote nt than 
', b'would normally occur naturally in healthy biological 
', b'sex females , and 
', b'b. estrogen given to biological males in amounts that are 
', b'larger or more potent than would normally occur 
', b'naturally in healthy biological sex males;  
', b'3.  "Gender" means the psycho logical, behavioral, social, and 
', b'cultural aspects of being male or female;  
', b'4.  "Gender reassignment surgery " means any medical or surgical 
', b'service that seeks to surgically alter or remove healthy physical or 
', b'anatomical characteristics o r features that are typical for the 
', b"individual 's biological sex, in order to instill or create 
", b'physiological or anatomical characteristics that resemble a sex 
', b"different from the individual 's biological sex, including but not 
", b'limited to genital or nongenita l gender reassignmen t surgery  
', b' 
', b'Req. No. 5096  Page 3 
', b' 1 
', b'2 
', b'3 
', b'4 
', b'5 
', b'6 
', b'7 
', b'8 
', b'9 
', b'10 
', b'11 
', b'12 
', b'13 
', b'14 
', b'15 
', b'16 
', b'17 
', b'18 
', b'19 
', b'20 
', b'21 
', b'22 
', b'23 
', b'24  performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender 
', b'transition;  
', b'5.  "Gender transition " means the process in which a person goes 
', b'from identifying with and living as a gender that corresponds to his 
', b'or her biolog ical sex to identify ing with and living as a gender 
', b'different from his or her biological sex, and may involve social, 
', b'legal, or physical changes;  
', b'6. a. "Gender transition procedures " means any medical or 
', b'surgical service, including but not limited to 
', b"physician's services, inp atient and outpatient 
", b'hospital services, or prescribed drugs related to 
', b'gender transition , that seeks to:  
', b'(1) alter or remove physica l or anatomical 
', b'characteristics or features that are typical for 
', b"the individual 's biological sex, or  
", b'(2) instill or create physiological or anatomical 
', b'characteristics that resemble a sex different

title: Children Deserve Help Not Harm Act established, health benefit plans, etc.
description: Children Deserve Help Not Harm Act established; health benefit plans; coverage for gender transition procedures. Creates the Children Deserve Help Not Harm Act (the Act), which prohibits gender transition procedures, defined in the bill, for individuals under 18 years of age and prohibits the use of public funds for gender transition procedures for individuals under 18 years of age. The bill establishes enforcement procedures for violation of the Act. The bill provides that a health benefit plan providing health care coverage in the Commonwealth is prohibited from providing coverage for gender transition procedures for individuals younger than 18 years of age and is not required to provide coverage for gender transition procedures for individuals 18 years of age or older.

text:
[b'23103055D
', b'SENATE BILL NO. 1203
', b'
', b'
', b'Offered January 11, 2023
', b'
', b'
', b'Prefiled January 10, 2023
', b'
', b'A BILL to amend the Code of Virginia by adding in Title 32.1 a 
', b' chapter numbered 21, consisting of sections numbered 32.1-376 through 32.1-379, 
', b' and by adding a section numbered 38.2-3449.2, relating to establishment of the 
', b' Children Deserve Help Not Harm Act; health benefit 
', b' plans; coverage for gender transition procedures.
', b'----------
', b'
', b'Patron-- Reeves
', b'
', b'----------
', b'
', b'Referred to Committee on Education and Health
', b'
', b'----------
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Virginia:
', b'1. That the Code of Virginia is amended by adding in Title 
', b' 32.1 a chapter numbered 21, consisting of sections numbered 32.1-376 through 
', b' 32.1-379, and by adding a section numbered 38.2-3449.2 as 
', b' follows:
', b'CHAPTER 
', b' 21.
', b'CHILDREN DESERVE HELP 
', b' NOT HARM ACT.
', b'\xc2\xa732.1-376. 
', b' Definitions.
', b'As used in this 
', b' chapter, unless the context requires a different meaning:
', b'"Biological 
', b' sex" means the biological indication of male and female in the context of 
', b' reproductive potential or capacity, such as sex chromosomes, naturally 
', b' occurring sex hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous internal and external genitalia 
', b" present at birth, without regard to an individual's 
", b' psychological, chosen, or subjective experience of gender.
', b'"Cross-sex 
', b' hormones" means:
', b'1. Testosterone or 
', b' other androgens given to biological females in amounts that are larger or more 
', b' potent than would normally occur naturally in healthy biological sex females; 
', b' and
', b'2. Estrogen given to 
', b' biological males in amounts that are larger or more potent than would normally 
', b' occur naturally in healthy biological sex males.
', b'"Gender" 
', b' means the psychological, behavioral, social, and cultural aspects of being male 
', b' or female.
', b'"Gender 
', b' reassignment surgery" means any medical or surgical service that seeks to 
', b' surgically alter or remove healthy physical or anatomical characteristics or 
', b" features that are typical for the individual's 
", b' biological sex in order to instill or create physiological or anatomical 
', b" characteristics that resemble a sex different from the individual's 
", b' biological sex, including without limitation genital or nongenital gender 
', b' reassignment surgery performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with 
', b' a gender transition.
', b'"Gender 
', b' transition" means the process in which an individual 
', b' goes from identifying with and living as a gender that corresponds to the 
', b" individual's biological sex to identifying with and living as a 
", b' gender different from his or her biological sex, which process may 
', b' involve social, legal, or physical changes.
', b'"Gender 
', b' transition procedure" means any medical or surgical service, including 
', b" without limitation physician's services, inpatient and outpatient hospital 
", b' services, or prescribed drugs related to gender transition, 
', b' that seeks to:
', b'1. Alter or remove 
', b' physical or anatomical characteristics or features that are typical for an 
', b" individual's biological sex; or
", b'2. Instill or create 
', b' physiological or anatomical characteristics that resemble a sex different from 
', b" an individual's biological sex, 
", b' including without limitation (i) 
', b' medical services that provide puberty-blocking drugs, cross-sex hormones, or 
', b' other mechanisms to promote the development of feminizing or masculinizing 
', b' features in the opposite biological sex or (ii) 
', b' genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery performed for the purpose of 
', b' assisting an individual with a gender transition.
', b'"Gender transition 
', b' procedure" does not include:
', b'1. Services to individuals 
', b' born with a medically verifiable disorder of sex development, including an 
', b' individual with external biological sex characteristics that are irresolvably 
', b' ambiguous, such as a person 
', b' born with 46, XX 
', b' karotype with virilization, with 46, XY 
', b' karotype with undervirilization, or having both ovarian and 
', b' testicular tissue;
', b'2. Services provided 
', b' when a physician has otherwise diagnosed a disorder of sexual development or the 
', b' physician has determined through genetic or biochemical testing that an 
', b' individual does not have normal sex chromosome structure, sex 
', b' steroid hormone production, or sex steroid hormone action;
', b'3. The treatment of 
', b' any infection, injury, disease, or disorder that has been caused by or 
', b' exacerbated by the performance of gender transition procedures, whether or not 
', b' the gender transition procedure was performed in accordance with state and 
', b' federal law or whether or not funding for the 
', b' gender transition procedure is permissible under this chapter; or
', b'4. Any procedure 
', b' undertaken because the individual suffers from a physical disorder, physical 
', b' injury, or physical illness that would, as certified by a physician, place the 
', b' individual in imminent danger of death or impairment of major bodily function 
', b' unless surgery is performed.
', b'"Genital gender 
', b' reassignment surgery" means a medical procedure performed for the purpose 
', b' of assisting an individual with a gender transition, including without 
', b' limitation:
', b'1. Surgical procedures 
', b' such as penectomy, orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, or vulvoplasty for 
', b' biologically male patients or hysterectomy or oophorectomy 
', b' for biologically female patients;
', b'2. Reconstruction of the 
', b' fixed part of the urethra with or without a metoidioplasty; or
', b'3. Phalloplasty, 
', b' vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, or implantation of erection or testicular prostheses 
', b' for biologically female patients.
', b'"Health care 
', b' professional" means an 
', b' individual who is licensed, certified, or otherwise 
', b' authorized by the laws of the Commonwealth to 
', b' administer health care in the ordinary course of the practice of his 
', b' profession.
', b'"Nongenital 
', b' gender reassignment surgery" means medical procedures performed for the 
', b' purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition, 
', b' including without limitation:
', b'1. Surgical procedures 
', b' for biologically male patients such as augmentation mammoplasty, facial 
', b' feminization surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, voice surgery, thyroid 
', b' cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation, hair reconstruction, or various 
', b' aesthetic procedures; or
', b'2. Surgical procedures 
', b' for biologically female patients such as subcutaneous mastectomy, voice 
', b' surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, or various aesthetic procedures.
', b'"Physician" 
', b' means a person who is licensed to practice medicine in the Commonwealth.
', b'"Puberty-blocking 
', b' drugs" means gonadotropin-releasing hormone analogues or other synthetic 
', b' drugs used in biological males to stop luteinizing hormone secretion and 
', b' therefore testosterone secretion, or synthetic drugs used in biological females 
', b' which stop the production of estrogens and progesterone, when used to delay or 
', b' suppress pubertal development in minors for the purpose of assisting an 
', b' individual with a gender transition.
', b'"Public 
', b' funds" means state, county, or local government moneys, 
', b' in addition to any department, agency, or instrumentality 
', b' moneys authorized or appropriated under state law or 
', b' derived from any fund in which such moneys are deposited.
', b'\xc2\xa732.1-377. 
', b' Prohibition of gender transition procedures for minors.
', b'A. A physician or 
', b' other health care professional 
', b' shall not provide gender transition procedures to any individual younger 
', b' than 18 years of age.
', b'B. A physician or 
', b' other health care professional shall 
', b' not refer any individual younger than 18 
', b' years of age to any health care 
', b' professional for gender transition procedures.
', b'C. A physician or 
', b' other health care professional may 
', b' provide any of the following procedures that are 
', b' not gender transition procedures to an individual younger than 18 years of age:
', b'1. Services to 
', b' individuals born with a medically verifiable disorder of sex development, 
', b' including an individual with external biological sex characteristics that are 
', b' irresolvably ambiguous, such as those born with 46,XX 
', b' karotype with virilization, with 
', b' 46,XY karotype with 
', b' undervirilization, or having both ovarian and testicular tissue;
', b'2. Services provided 
', b' when a physician has otherwise diagnosed a disorder of sexual development or 
', b' the physician has determined through genetic or biochemical testing that the 
', b' person does not have normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone 
', b' production, or sex steroid hormone action;
', b'3. The treatment of 
', b' any infection, injury, disease, or disorder that has been caused by or 
', b' exacerbated by the performance of gender transition procedures, whether or not 
', b' the gender transition procedure was performed in accordance with state and 
', b' federal law or whether or not funding for the 
', b' gender transition procedure is permissible under this chapter; or
', b'4. Any procedure 
', b' undertaken because the individual suffers from a physical disorder, physical 
', b' injury, or physical illness that would, as certified by a physician, place the 
', b' individual in imminent danger of death or impairment of major bodily function 
', b' unless surgery is performed.
', b'\xc2\xa732.1-378. 
', b' Prohibition on use of public funds for gender transition procedures.
', b'A. Public funds shall 
', b' not be directly or indirectly used, granted, paid, or distributed to any 
', b' entity, organization, or individual that provides gender transition procedures 
', b' to an individual younger than 18 years of age.
', b'B. Health care 
', b' services furnished in the following situations shall not include gender 
', b' transition procedures to an individual younger than 18 years of age:
', b'1. By or in a health care 
', b' facility owned by the state or a county or local government; or
', b'2. By a physician or 
', b' other health care professional who 
', b' is an employee of the Commonwealth.
', b'C. Any amount paid by an 
', b' individual or an entity during a taxable year for provision of gender 
', b' transition procedures or as premiums for health care coverage that includes 
', b' coverage for gender transition procedures is not tax-deductible.
', b'D. The State 
', b' Plan for Medical Assistance Services shall not reimburse 
', b' or provide coverage for gender transition procedures to an individual younger 
', b' than 18 years of age.
', b'\xc2\xa732.1-379. 
', b' Enforcement.
', b'A. Any referral for or 
', b' provision of gender transition procedures to an individual younger 
', b' than 18 years of 
', b' age is unprofessional conduct and is subject to discipline by the appropriate 
', b' licensing entity or disciplinary review board with competent jurisdiction in the Commonwealth.
', b'B. An 
', b' individual may assert an actual or threatened violation of 
', b' this chapter as a claim or defense in a judicial or administrative proceeding 
', b' and obtain compensatory damages, injunctive relief, declaratory relief, or any 
', b' other appropriate relief.
', b'C. An 
', b' individual shall bring a claim for a violation of this 
', b' chapter no later than two years after the date the cause of action accrues.
', b'D. An individual 
', b' younger than 18 years of age may bring an action under this 
', b" chapter throughout the individual's minority through a 
", b' parent or next friend and may bring an action in his own 
', b' name upon reaching majority at any time from that point until 20 years after 
', b' reaching 18 years of age.
', b'E. Notwithstanding any 
', b' other provision of law, an action under this chapter may be commenced, and relief 
', b' may be granted, in a judicial proceeding without regard to whether the 
', b' individual commencing the action has sought or exhausted available 
', b' administrative remedies.
', b'F. In any action or 
', b' proceeding to enforce a provision of this chapter, a prevailing party who 
', b' establishes a violation of this chapter shall recover reasonable attorney fees.
', b'G. The Attorney 
', b' General may bring an action to enforce compliance with this chapter.
', b'H. This chapter does 
', b' not deny, impair, or otherwise affect any right or authority of the Attorney 
', b' General, the Commonwealth, or any agency, officer, or employee of the state, 
', b' acting under any law other than this chapter, to institute or intervene in any 
', b' proceeding.
', b'\xc2\xa738.2-3449.2. Insurance 
', b' coverage of gender transition procedures for minors prohibited.
', b'A. As used in this section, 
', b' "gender transition procedure" means the same as defined in \xc2\xa7
', b' 32.1-376.
', b'B. Notwithstanding the 
', b' provisions of \xc2\xa738.2-3449.1, no health carrier 
', b' shall (i) provide 
', b' coverage for any gender transition procedure for 
', b' any individual 
', b' younger than 18 years of age or (ii) 
', b' be required to provide coverage for any gender 
', b' transition procedure for any 
', b' individual 18 years of age or older.']

title: Save Adolescents from Experimentation (SAFE) Act; established, health benefit plans, etc.
description: Establishment of the Save Adolescents from Experimentation (SAFE) Act; health benefit plans; coverage for gender transition procedures. Creates the Save Adolescents from Experimentation (SAFE) Act, which prohibits gender transition procedures, defined in the bill, for individuals under 18 years of age and prohibits the use of public funds for gender transition procedures for individuals under 18 years of age. The bill establishes enforcement procedures for violation of the SAFE Act. The bill provides that a health benefit plan providing health care coverage in the Commonwealth is prohibited from providing coverage for gender transition procedures for individuals younger than 18 years of age and is not required to provide coverage for gender transition procedures for individuals 18 years of age or older.

text:
[b'23100911D
', b'SENATE BILL NO. 791
', b'
', b'
', b'Offered January 11, 2023
', b'
', b'
', b'Prefiled November 29, 2022
', b'
', b'A BILL to amend the Code of Virginia by adding in Title 32.1 a 
', b' chapter numbered 21, consisting of sections numbered 32.1-376 through 32.1-379, 
', b' and by adding a section numbered 38.2-3449.2, relating to establishment of the 
', b' Save Adolescents from Experimentation (SAFE) Act; 
', b' health benefit plans; coverage for gender transition procedures.
', b'----------
', b'
', b'Patron-- Chase
', b'
', b'----------
', b'
', b'Referred to Committee on Education and Health
', b'
', b'----------
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Virginia:
', b'1. That the Code of Virginia is amended by adding in Title 
', b' 32.1 a chapter numbered 21, consisting of sections numbered 32.1-376 through 
', b' 32.1-379, and by adding a section numbered 38.2-3449.2 as 
', b' follows:
', b'CHAPTER 
', b' 21.
', b'SAVE ADOLESCENTS FROM 
', b' EXPERIMENTATION (SAFE) ACT.
', b'\xc2\xa732.1-376. 
', b' Definitions.
', b'As used in this 
', b' chapter, unless the context requires a different meaning:
', b'"Biological 
', b' sex" means the biological indication of male and female in the context of 
', b' reproductive potential or capacity, such as sex chromosomes, naturally 
', b' occurring sex hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous internal and external 
', b" genitalia present at birth, without regard to an individual's 
", b' psychological, chosen, or subjective experience of gender.
', b'"Cross-sex 
', b' hormones" means:
', b'1. Testosterone or 
', b' other androgens given to biological females in amounts that are larger or more 
', b' potent than would normally occur naturally in healthy biological sex females; 
', b' and
', b'2. Estrogen given to 
', b' biological males in amounts that are larger or more potent than would normally 
', b' occur naturally in healthy biological sex males.
', b'"Gender" means 
', b' the psychological, behavioral, social, and cultural aspects of being male or 
', b' female.
', b'"Gender 
', b' reassignment surgery" means any medical or surgical service that seeks to 
', b' surgically alter or remove healthy physical or anatomical characteristics or 
', b" features that are typical for the individual's 
", b' biological sex in order to instill or create physiological or anatomical 
', b" characteristics that resemble a sex different from the individual's 
", b' biological sex, including without limitation genital or nongenital gender reassignment 
', b' surgery performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender 
', b' transition.
', b'"Gender 
', b' transition" means the process in which an individual 
', b' goes from identifying with and living as a gender that corresponds to the 
', b" individual's biological sex to identifying with and living as a 
", b' gender different from his or her biological sex, which process may 
', b' involve social, legal, or physical changes.
', b'"Gender 
', b' transition procedure" means any medical or surgical service, including without 
', b" limitation physician's services, inpatient and outpatient hospital services, or 
", b' prescribed drugs related to gender transition, 
', b' that seeks to:
', b'1. Alter or remove 
', b' physical or anatomical characteristics or features that are typical for an 
', b" individual's biological sex; or
", b'2. Instill or create 
', b' physiological or anatomical characteristics that resemble a sex different from 
', b" an individual's biological sex, 
", b' including without limitation (i) 
', b' medical services that provide puberty-blocking drugs, cross-sex hormones, or 
', b' other mechanisms to promote the development of feminizing or masculinizing 
', b' features in the opposite biological sex or (ii) 
', b' genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery performed for the purpose of 
', b' assisting an individual with a gender transition.
', b'"Gender 
', b' transition procedure" does not 
', b' include:
', b'1. Services to individuals 
', b' born with a medically verifiable disorder of sex development, including an 
', b' individual with external biological sex characteristics that are irresolvably 
', b' ambiguous, such as a person 
', b' born with 46, XX with virilization, with 46, XY 
', b' with undervirilization, or having both ovarian and testicular tissue;
', b'2. Services provided 
', b' when a physician has otherwise diagnosed a disorder of sexual development or the 
', b' physician has determined through genetic or biochemical testing that an 
', b' individual does not have normal sex chromosome structure, sex 
', b' steroid hormone production, or sex steroid hormone action;
', b'3. The treatment of 
', b' any infection, injury, disease, or disorder that has been caused by or exacerbated 
', b' by the performance of gender transition procedures, whether or not the gender 
', b' transition procedure was performed in accordance with state and federal law or 
', b' whether or not funding for the 
', b' gender transition procedure is permissible under this chapter; or
', b'4. Any procedure 
', b' undertaken because the individual suffers from a physical disorder, physical 
', b' injury, or physical illness that would, as certified by a physician, place the 
', b' individual in imminent danger of death or impairment of major bodily function unless 
', b' surgery is performed.
', b'"Genital gender 
', b' reassignment surgery" means a medical procedure performed for the purpose 
', b' of assisting an individual with a gender transition, including without 
', b' limitation:
', b'1. Surgical procedures 
', b' such as penectomy, orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, or vulvoplasty for 
', b' biologically male patients or hysterectomy or oophorectomy 
', b' for biologically female patients;
', b'2. Reconstruction of the 
', b' fixed part of the urethra with or without a metoidioplasty; or
', b'3. Phalloplasty, 
', b' vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, or implantation of erection or testicular prostheses 
', b' for biologically female patients.
', b'"Health care 
', b' professional" means an 
', b' individual who is licensed, certified, or otherwise 
', b' authorized by the laws of the Commonwealth to 
', b' administer health care in the ordinary course of the practice of his 
', b' profession.
', b'"Nongenital 
', b' gender reassignment surgery" means medical procedures performed for the 
', b' purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition, including without 
', b' limitation:
', b'1. Surgical procedures 
', b' for biologically male patients such as augmentation mammoplasty, facial 
', b' feminization surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, voice surgery, thyroid 
', b' cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation, hair reconstruction, or various 
', b' aesthetic procedures; or
', b'2. Surgical procedures 
', b' for biologically female patients such as subcutaneous mastectomy, voice 
', b' surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, or various aesthetic procedures.
', b'"Physician" 
', b' means a person who is licensed to practice medicine in the Commonwealth.
', b'"Puberty-blocking 
', b' drugs" means gonadotropin-releasing hormone analogues or other synthetic 
', b' drugs used in biological males to stop luteinizing hormone secretion and 
', b' therefore testosterone secretion, or synthetic drugs used in biological females 
', b' which stop the production of estrogens and progesterone, when used to delay or 
', b' suppress pubertal development in minors for the purpose of assisting an 
', b' individual with a gender transition.
', b'"Public 
', b' funds" means state, county, or local government moneys, 
', b' in addition to any department, agency, or instrumentality 
', b' moneys authorized or appropriated under state law or 
', b' derived from any fund in which such moneys are deposited.
', b'\xc2\xa732.1-377. 
', b' Prohibition of gender transition procedures for minors.
', b'A. A physician or 
', b' other health care professional 
', b' shall not provide gender transition procedures to any individual younger 
', b' than 18 years of age.
', b'B. A physician or 
', b' other health care professional shall 
', b' not refer any individual younger than 18 
', b' years of age to any health care 
', b' professional for gender transition procedures.
', b'C. A physician or 
', b' other health care professional may 
', b' provide any of the following procedures that are 
', b' not gender transition procedures to an individual younger than 18 years of age:
', b'1. Services to 
', b' individuals born with a medically verifiable disorder of sex development, 
', b' including an individual with external biological sex characteristics that are 
', b' irresolvably ambiguous, such as those born with 46,XX with virilization, with 
', b' 46,XY with undervirilization, or having both ovarian and testicular tissue;
', b'2. Services provided 
', b' when a physician has otherwise diagnosed a disorder of sexual development or 
', b' the physician has determined through genetic or biochemical testing that the 
', b' person does not have normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone 
', b' production, or sex steroid hormone action;
', b'3. The treatment of 
', b' any infection, injury, disease, or disorder that has been caused by or 
', b' exacerbated by the performance of gender transition procedures, whether or not 
', b' the gender transition procedure was performed in accordance with state and 
', b' federal law or whether or not funding for the 
', b' gender transition procedure is permissible under this chapter; or
', b'4. Any procedure 
', b' undertaken because the individual suffers from a physical disorder, physical 
', b' injury, or physical illness that would, as certified by a physician, place the 
', b' individual in imminent danger of death or impairment of major bodily function 
', b' unless surgery is performed.
', b'\xc2\xa732.1-378. 
', b' Prohibition on use of public funds for gender transition procedures.
', b'A. Public funds shall 
', b' not be directly or indirectly used, granted, paid, or distributed to any 
', b' entity, organization, or individual that provides gender transition procedures 
', b' to an individual younger than 18 years of age.
', b'B. Health care 
', b' services furnished in the following situations shall not include gender 
', b' transition procedures to an individual younger than 18 years of age:
', b'1. By or in a health care 
', b' facility owned by the state or a county or local government; or
', b'2. By a physician or 
', b' other health care professional who 
', b' is an employee of the Commonwealth.
', b'C. Any amount paid by 
', b' an individual or an entity during a taxable year for provision of gender 
', b' transition procedures or as premiums for health care coverage that includes 
', b' coverage for gender transition procedures is not tax-deductible.
', b'D. The State 
', b' Plan for Medical Assistance Services shall not reimburse 
', b' or provide coverage for gender transition procedures to an individual younger 
', b' than 18 years of age.
', b'\xc2\xa732.1-379. 
', b' Enforcement.
', b'A. Any referral for or 
', b' provision of gender transition procedures to an individual younger 
', b' than 18 years of age 
', b' is unprofessional conduct and is subject to discipline by the appropriate 
', b' licensing entity or disciplinary review board with competent jurisdiction in the Commonwealth.
', b'B. An 
', b' individual may assert an actual or threatened violation of 
', b' this chapter as a claim or defense in a judicial or administrative proceeding 
', b' and obtain compensatory damages, injunctive relief, declaratory relief, or any 
', b' other appropriate relief.
', b'C. An 
', b' individual shall bring a claim for a violation of this 
', b' chapter no later than two years after the date the cause of action accrues.
', b'D. An individual 
', b' younger than 18 years of age may bring an action under this 
', b" chapter throughout the individual's minority through a 
", b' parent or next friend and may bring an action in his own 
', b' name upon reaching majority at any time from that point until 20 years after 
', b' reaching 18 years of age.
', b'E. Notwithstanding any 
', b' other provision of law, an action under this chapter may be commenced, and relief 
', b' may be granted, in a judicial proceeding without regard to whether the 
', b' individual commencing the action has sought or exhausted available 
', b' administrative remedies.
', b'F. In any action or 
', b' proceeding to enforce a provision of this chapter, a prevailing party who 
', b' establishes a violation of this chapter shall recover reasonable attorney fees.
', b'G. The Attorney 
', b' General may bring an action to enforce compliance with this chapter.
', b'H. This chapter does 
', b' not deny, impair, or otherwise affect any right or authority of the Attorney 
', b' General, the Commonwealth, or any agency, officer, or employee of the state, 
', b' acting under any law other than this chapter, to institute or intervene in any 
', b' proceeding.
', b'\xc2\xa738.2-3449.2. Insurance 
', b' coverage of gender transition procedures for minors prohibited.
', b'A. As used in this section, 
', b' "gender transition procedure" means the same as defined in \xc2\xa7
', b' 32.1-376.
', b'B. Notwithstanding the 
', b' provisions of \xc2\xa738.2-3449.1, no health carrier 
', b' shall (i) provide 
', b' coverage for any gender transition procedures for 
', b' individuals who are younger than 18 years 
', b' of age or (ii) be required to 
', b' provide coverage for any gender 
', b' transition procedures for individuals 18 years of age or older.']

title: Professions and Businesses; health care providers from performing specified practices on minors relating to altering a person's appearance relating to gender; prohibit
description: A BILL to be entitled an Act to amend Chapter 1 of Title 43 of the O.C.G.A., relating to general provisions relative to professions and businesses, so as to prohibit health care providers from performing specified practices on minors relating to altering a person's appearance relating to gender; to prohibit health care providers from aiding or abetting such practices for minors; to amend Part 3 of Article 16 of Chapter 2 of Title 20 of the O.C.G.A., relating to student health, so as to prohibit school nurses and other employees and officials from engaging in certain conduct relating to a minor's perception of his or her gender; to provide for legislative findings; to provide for related matters; to provide for an effective date; to repeal conflicting laws; and for other purposes.
