text:
[b'23.508.12  98th Legislative Session  1080 
', b' 
', b' 
', b'2023 South Dakota Legislature  
', b'House Bill 1080  
', b'  
', b' 
', b'  
', b'  
', b' 
', b' 
', b'Introduced by: Representative  Soye 
', b' 
', b'  Underscores  indicate new language.  
', b'  Overstrikes  indicate deleted language.  
', b'An Act to  prohibit certain medical and surgical interventions on minor patients.  1 
', b'BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA : 2 
', b'Section 1. That chapter 34-24 be amended with a NEW SECTION:  3 
', b'Terms used in sections 2 to 6, inclusive, of this Act, mean:  4 
', b'(1) "Minor," any person under the age of eighteen; and  5 
', b'(2) "Sex,\xe2\x80\x9d means the biological indication of male and female, as evidenced by sex 6 
', b'chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous 7 
', b'internal and external genitalia present at bir th. 8 
', b'Section 2. That chapter 34-24 be amended with a NEW SECTION:  9 
', b'Except as provided in section 3 of this Act, a he althcare professional may not, for 10 
', b"the purpose of attempting to alter the appearance of, or to validate a minor's perception 11 
", b"of, the minor\xe2\x80\x99s sex, if that appearance or perception is inconsistent with the minor's sex, 12 
", b'knowingly:  13 
', b'(1) Prescribe or administer to a minor, any drug to delay or stop normal puberty;  14 
', b'(2) Prescribe or administer supraphysiologic doses of testosterone or other androgens 15 
', b'to a female;  16 
', b'(3) Prescribe or administer supraphysiologic doses of estrogen to a male;  17 
', b'(4) Perform any sterilizing s urgery, including castration, hysterectomy, oophorectomy, 18 
', b'orchiectomy, penectomy, and vasectomy;  19 
', b'(5) Perform any surgery that artificially constructs tissue having the appearance of 20 
', b"genitalia differing from the minor's sex, including metoidioplasty, phallo plasty, and 21 
", b'vaginoplasty; or  22 
', b'(6) Remove any healthy or non -diseased body part or tissue.  23 
', b'Section 3. That chapter 34-24 be amended with a NEW SECTION:  24 23.508.12  2 1080 
', b'  Underscores  indicate new language.  
', b'  Overstrikes  indicate deleted language.  The prohibitions of section 2 of this Act do not  limit or restrict the provision of  1 
', b'services to:  2 
', b'(1) A minor born with  a medically verifiable disorder of sex development, including 3 
', b'external biological sex characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous;  4 
', b'(2) A minor diagnosed with a disorder of sexual development, if a healthcare provider 5 
', b'has determined, through genetic or  biochemical testing, that the minor does not 6 
', b'have a sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone production, or sex steroid 7 
', b'hormone action, that is normal for a biological male or biological female; or  8 
', b'(3) A minor needing treatment for an infection, inju ry, disease, or disorder that has 9 
', b'been caused or exacerbated by any action or procedure prohibited by section 2 of 10 
', b'this Act.  11 
', b'Section 4. That chapter 34-24 be amended with a NEW SECTION:  12 
', b'If a professional or occupational licensing board finds, by a preponderance of the 13 
', b'evidence and in compliance with chap ter 1-26, that a healthcare professional licensed or 14 
', b'certified by the board has violated section 2 of this Act, the board must revoke any 15 
', b'professional or o ccupational license or certificate held by the healthcare professional.  16 
', b'Section 5. That chapter 34-24 be amended w ith a NEW SECTION:  17 
', b'Any civil action to recover damages for injury suffered as a result of a violation of 18 
', b'section 2 of this Act must be commenced before the later of:  19 
', b'(1) The date on which the person reaches age twenty -five; or  20 
', b'(2) Within three years from t he time the person discovered or reasonably should have 21 
', b'discovered that the injury or damages were caused by the violation.  22 
', b'Section 6. That chapter 34-24 be amended with a NEW SECTION:  23 
', b'If, prior to July 1, 2023, a healthcare professional has initiated a course of 24 
', b'treatment, for a minor, which includes the prescription or administration of any drug or 25 
', b'hormone prohibite d by section 2 of this Act, and if the healthcare professional determines 26 
', b"and documents in the minor's medical record that immediately terminating the minor's 27 
", b'use of the drug or hormone would cause harm to the minor, the healthcare professional 28 
', b"may institu te a period during which the minor's use of the drug or hormone is 29 
", b'systematically reduced. That period may not extend beyond December 31, 2023.  30 ']

title: Establishing the women's bill of rights to provide a meaning of biological sex for purposes of statutory construction.
description: Establishing the women's bill of rights to provide a meaning of biological sex for purposes of statutory construction.

text:
[b'Session of 2023
', b'SENATE BILL No. 180
', b'By Committee on Public Health and Welfare
', b'2-7
', b"AN ACT establishing the women's bill of rights; providing a meaning of  
", b'biological sex for purposes of statutory construction.
', b'WHEREAS,  Male  and  female  individuals  possess  unique  and  
', b'immutable biological differences that manifest prior to birth and increase  
', b'as such individuals age and experience puberty; and
', b'WHEREAS, Biological differences between the sexes mean that only  
', b'female individuals are able to become pregnant, give birth and breastfeed  
', b'children; and
', b'WHEREAS, Biological differences between the sexes mean that male  
', b'individuals  are,  on  average,  bigger,  stronger  and  faster  than  female  
', b'individuals; and
', b'WHEREAS,  Biological  differences  between  the  sexes  leave  female  
', b'individuals more physically vulnerable than male individuals to specific  
', b'forms of violence, including sexual violence; and
', b'WHEREAS,  Female  individuals  have  historically  suffered  from  
', b'discrimination in education, athletics and employment; and
', b'WHEREAS, Biological differences between the sexes are enduring and  
', b'may,  in  some  circumstances,  warrant  the  creation  of  separate  social,  
', b'educational, athletics or other spaces in order to ensure safety and to allow  
', b'members of each sex to succeed and thrive; and
', b'WHEREAS, Inconsistencies in court rulings and policy initiatives with  
', b'respect to the definitions of "sex," "male," "female," "man" and "woman"  
', b'have led to the endangerment of single-sex spaces and resources thereby  
', b'necessitating the clarification of certain terms.
', b'Now, therefore:
', b'Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of Kansas:
', b'Section  1.\xe2\x80\x83(a)  Notwithstanding  any  provision  of  state  law  to  the  
', b"contrary, with respect to the application of an individual's biological sex  
", b'pursuant to any state law or rules and regulations, the following shall  
', b'apply:
', b'(1)\xe2\x80\x83An  individual's  "sex"  means  such  individual's  biological  sex,  
', b'either male or female, at birth;
', b'(2)\xe2\x80\x83a "female" is an individual whose biological reproductive system  
', b'is  developed  to  produce  ova,  and  a  "male"  is  an  individual  whose  
', b'biological  reproductive  system  is  developed  to  fertilize  the  ova  of  a  1
', b'2
', b'3
', b'4
', b'5
', b'6
', b'7
', b'8
', b'9
', b'10
', b'11
', b'12
', b'13
', b'14
', b'15
', b'16
', b'17
', b'18
', b'19
', b'20
', b'21
', b'22
', b'23
', b'24
', b'25

', b'28
', b'29
', b'30
', b'31
', b'32
', b'33
', b'34
', b'35
', b'36SB 180 2
', b'female;
', b'(3)\xe2\x80\x83the terms "woman" and "girl" refer to human females, and the  
', b'terms "man" and "boy" refer to human males;
', b'(4)\xe2\x80\x83the term "mother" means a parent of the female sex, and the term  
', b'"father" means a parent of the male sex;
', b'(5)\xe2\x80\x83with respect to biological sex, the term "equal" does not mean  
', b'"same" or "identical"; and
', b'(6)\xe2\x80\x83with respect to biological sex, separate accommodations are not  
', b'inherently unequal.
', b'(b)\xe2\x80\x83Laws and rules and regulations that distinguish between the sexes  
', b'are  subject  to  intermediate  constitutional  scrutiny.  Intermediate  
', b'constitutional  scrutiny  forbids  unfair  discrimination  against  similarly  
', b'situated male and female individuals but allows the law to distinguish  
', b'between  the  sexes  where  such  distinctions  are  substantially related  to  
', b'important governmental objectives. Notwithstanding any provision of state  
', b'law to the contrary, distinctions between the sexes with respect to athletics,  
', b'prisons or other detention facilities, domestic violence shelters, rape crisis  
', b'centers, locker rooms, restrooms and other areas where biology, safety or  
', b'privacy  are  implicated  that  result  in  separate  accommodations  are  
', b'substantially  related  to  the  important  governmental  objectives  of  
', b'protecting  the  health,  safety  and  privacy  of  individuals  in  such  
', b'circumstances.
', b'(c)\xe2\x80\x83Any school district, or public school thereof, and any state agency,  
', b'department or office or political subdivision that collects vital statistics for  
', b'the purpose of complying with anti-discrimination laws or for the purpose  
', b'of gathering accurate public health, crime, economic or other data shall  
', b'identify each individual who is part of the collected data set as either male  
', b'or female at birth.
', b'Sec. 2.\xe2\x80\x83This act shall take effect and be in force from and after its  
', b'publication in the statute book.1

', b'AS INTRODUCED  
', b' 
', b'An Act relating to public health  and safe ty; defining 
', b'terms; prohibiting certain health  care professionals 
', b'from performing o r attempting to perfor m gender 
', b'transition procedur es; providing exceptions; 
', b'prohibiting use of public funds for gender transition 
', b'procedures; pro hibiting  certain gender transition 
', b'procedures; defining certain conduct as 
', b'unprofessio nal; requiring revocation of lic ense or 
', b'certificate ; prescribing  statute of limitations  for 
', b'disciplin ary proceedings; authorizing certain claims 
', b'or defenses; prescribing statute of limitations; 
', b'authorizing civil acti ons by minors; authorizing 
', b'civil actions  after majority; authorizing cer tain 
', b'actions withou t exhaustion of admini strative 
', b'remedies; authorizi ng attorney fees; authorizing 
', b'Attorney General to bring enforcement actions; 
', b'prohibit ing state  insurance program reimbursements; 
', b'providing for construction of act;  providing for 
', b'codificat ion; and providing a n effective date. 
', b' 
', b' 
', b' 
', b' 
', b' 
', b'BE IT ENACTED BY THE P EOPLE OF THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA:  
', b'SECTION 1.     NEW LAW     A new section of law to be codified 
', b'in the Oklahoma Statutes as Section 2607 of Title 63, unless there 
', b'is created a duplication in numbering, reads as follows:  
', b'A.  As used in this act:  
', b' 
', b'Req. No. 5112  Page 2 
', b' 1 
', b'2

', b'24  1.  "Biological sex " means the biological indication of male and 
', b'female in the con text of reprod uctive potential or capacity, su ch as 
', b'sex chromosomes, naturally occur ring sex hormo nes, gonads, and 
', b'nonambig uous internal and ext ernal genitalia present  at birth, 
', b"without regard to  an individual's psychological, chosen, or 
", b'subjective experience of gender ; 
', b'2.  "Gender" means the psychological, behavioral, social , and 
', b'cultural aspects of b eing male or fem ale; 
', b'3.  "Health care professional " means a pers on who is licensed, 
', b'certified , or otherwise authorized b y the laws of this state to  
', b'administ er health care in the ordinary course of the p ractice of hi s 
', b'or her profession ; 
', b'4.  "Physician" means a person who is licensed in t his stat e to 
', b'practice medicine; and 
', b'5.  "Public fund s" means state, c ounty, or local government 
', b'monies, in addition to any department, agency , or instrumenta lity 
', b'authorized or appropr iated under stat e law or derived from any fund 
', b'in which such mon ies are deposit ed.  
', b'B.  A physician , mental health professiona l, or other health 
', b'care professional shall no t knowingly engage in or cause a ny of the 
', b'following  practices to be performed upon any person under eighteen

text:
[b'FIRST REGULAR SESSION
', b'HOUSE BILL NO. 540 102ND GENERAL ASSEMBLY
', b'INTRODUCED BY REPRESENTATIVE SPARKS.
', b'DANA RADEMAN MILLER, Chief Clerk
', b'AN ACT
', b'    2 3
', b'2
', b'2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9
', b'10 11 12 13 14
', b'To amend chapters 191 and 376, RSMo, by adding thereto ten new sections relating to gender transition procedures, with a delayed effective date.
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the state of Missouri, as follows:
', b'Section A. Chapters 191 and 376, RSMo, are amended by adding thereto ten new sections, to be known as sections 191.1720, 191.1725, 191.1730, 191.1732, 191.1735, 191.1740, 191.1745, 191.1748, 191.1749, and 376.1280, to read as follows:
', b'191.1720. Sections 191.1720 to 191.1749 and section 376.1280 shall be known and may be cited as the "Missouri's Children Deserve Help Not Harm Act".
', b'191.1725. For purposes of sections 191.1725 to 191.1749, the following terms
', b'mean:
', b'(1) "Biological sex", the biological indication of male or female in the context of
', b'reproductive potential or capacity, such as sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads, and nonambiguous internal and external genitalia present at birth, including secondary sex characteristics;
', b'(2) "Cross-sex hormones":
', b'(a) Testosterone or other androgens given to biological females in amounts that create serum levels greater than would normally occur naturally in healthy biological females, which may include, but are not limited to, the following risks:
', b'a. Irreversible infertility;
', b'b. Severe liver dysfunction;
', b'c. Coronary artery disease, including heart attacks;
', b'd. Increased risk of breast, cervical, and uterine cancers;
', b'EXPLANATION \xe2\x80\x94 Matter enclosed in bold-faced brackets [thus] in the above bill is not enacted and is intended to be omitted from the law. Matter in bold-face type in the above bill is proposed language.
', b'HB 540
', b'2
', b'15
', b'16
', b'17
', b'18
', b'19
', b'20
', b'21
', b'22
', b'23 greater than would normally occur naturally in healthy biological males, which may
', b'24 include, but are not limited to, the following risks:
', b'e. Cerebrovascular disease, including strokes;
', b'f. Hypertension;
', b'g. Erythrocytosis, which is an increase in red blood cells;
', b'h. Sleep apnea;
', b'i. Type 2 diabetes;
', b'j. Loss of bone density; and
', b'k. Destabilization of psychiatric disorders; and
', b'(b) Estrogen given to biological males in amounts that create serum levels
', b'25 a. Irreversible infertility;
', b'26 b. Thromboembolic disease, including blood clots;
', b'27 c. Cholelithiasis, including gallstones;
', b'28 d. Coronary artery disease, including heart attacks;
', b'29 e. Type 2 diabetes;
', b'30 f. Breast cancer;
', b'31 g. Macroprolactinoma, which is a tumor of the pituitary gland;
', b'32 h. Cerebrovascular disease, including strokes; and
', b'33 i. Hypertriglyceridemia, which is an elevated level of triglycerides in the blood;
', b'34 (3) "Gender", the psychological, behavioral, social, and cultural aspects of being
', b'35 male or female;
', b'36 (4) "Gender reassignment surgery", any surgical service that seeks to surgically
', b'37 alter or remove healthy physical or anatomical characteristics or features that are
', b"38 typical for the individual's biological sex in order to instill or create physiological or
", b"39 anatomical characteristics that resemble a sex different from the individual's biological
", b'40 sex including, but not limited to, genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery
', b'41 performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition;
', b'42 (5) "Gender transition", the process in which an individual goes from
', b'43 identifying with and living as a gender that corresponds to his or her biological sex to
', b'44 identifying with and living as a gender different from his or her biological sex, and may
', b'45 involve social, legal, or physical changes;
', b'46 (6) "Gender transition procedure":
', b"47 (a) Any medical or surgical service, including, but not limited to, physician's
", b'48 services, inpatient and outpatient hospital services, puberty-blocking drugs, cross-sex
', b'49 hormones, or genital or nongenital gender reassignment surgery, that is provided or
', b'50 performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a physical gender transition;
', b'51 (b) The term "gender transition procedure" shall not include:
', b'
', b'HB 540 3
', b'52
', b'53
', b'54
', b'55
', b'56
', b'57
', b'58
', b'59
', b'60
', b'61
', b'62
', b'63
', b'64
', b'65
', b'66
', b'67
', b'68
', b'69

', b'71
', b'72
', b'73
', b'74

', b'76
', b'77
', b'78
', b'79

', b'81
', b'82
', b'83
', b'84
', b'85
', b'86
', b'87
', b'88
', b'a. Services to individuals born with a medically verifiable disorder of sex development including, but not limited to, an individual with external biological sex characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous, such as those born with 46,XX chromosomes with virilization, 46,XY chromosomes with undervirilization, or having both ovarian and testicular tissue;
', b'b. Services provided when a physician has otherwise diagnosed an individual with a disorder of sexual development and determined through genetic or biochemical testing that the individual does not have normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid production, or sex steroid hormone action;
', b'c. The acute or chronic treatment of any infection, injury, disease, or disorder that has been caused by or exacerbated by the performance of gender transition procedures regardless of whether the gender transition procedure was performed in accordance with state and federal law or whether funding for the gender transition procedure is permissible under section 191.1735; or
', b'd. Any procedure undertaken because the individual suffers from a physical disorder, physical injury, or physical illness that would, as certified by a physician, place the individual in imminent danger of death or impairment of a major bodily function unless surgery is performed;
', b'(7) "Genital gender reassignment surgery", a surgical procedure performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a physical gender transition including, but not limited to:
', b'(a) Surgical procedures such as penectomy, orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, or vulvoplasty for biologically male patients; or
', b'(b) Surgical procedures such as hysterectomy, oophorectomy, reconstruction of the urethra, metoidioplasty or phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, implantation of erection prostheses, or implantation of testicular prostheses for biologically female patients;
', b'(8) "Health care professional", an individual who is licensed, certified, or otherwise authorized by the laws of this state to administer health care in the ordinary course of the practice of his or her profession, including mental health care providers;
', b'(9) "Nongenital gender reassignment surgery", surgical procedures performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a physical gender transition including, but not limited to:
', b'(a) Surgical procedures for biologically male patients, such as augmentation mammoplasty, facial feminization surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, voice feminization surgery, thyroid cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation, hair reconstruction, or various aesthetic procedures; or
', b'
', b' 89
', b' 90
', b' 91
', b' 92
', b' 93
', b' 94
', b' 95
', b' 96
', b' 97
', b' 98
', b' 99
', b'100 101
', b'2 3 4
', b'2 3 4 5 6 7
', b'2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9
', b'10 11 12 13
', b'(b) Surgical procedures for biologically female patients, such as subcutaneous mastectomy, voice masculinization surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, or various aesthetic procedures;
', b'(10) "Physician", an individual who is licensed to practice medicine in this state;
', b'(11) "Puberty-blocking drugs", gonadotropin-releasing hormone analogues or other synthetic drugs used in biological males to stop luteinizing hormone secretion and therefore testosterone production, or synthetic drugs used in biological females that stop the production of estrogen and progesterone, when used to delay or suppress pubertal development in children for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition;
', b'(12) "Public funds", state, county, or local government moneys, including any such moneys deposited with or derived from any department, agency, or instrumentality authorized or appropriated under state law.
', b'191.1730. 1. A physician or other health care professional shall not provide gender transition procedures to any individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'2. A health care institution or entity shall not facilitate the provision of gender transition procedures to any individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'191.1732. 1. A person or entity, including employees of other state governments, the federal government, or foreign governments, shall not knowingly engage in conduct that aids or abets the performance or inducement of gender transition procedures on any individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'2. The provisions of this section shall not apply to any speech protected by the First Amendment of the United States Constitution.
', b'3. No parent of a child victim shall be held liable under this section.
', b'191.1735. 1. Public funds shall not be directly or indirectly used, granted, paid, or distributed to any individual, entity, or organization that provides gender transition procedures to an individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'2. Health care services furnished in the following situations shall not include gender transition procedures to an individual under eighteen years of age:
', b'(1) By or in a facility owned by the state or a county or local government; or
', b'(2) By a physician or other health care professional employed by the state or a county or local government.
', b'3. Any amount paid by an individual or an entity during a tax year for the provision of gender transition procedures or as premiums for health care coverage that includes coverage for gender transition procedures shall not be tax deductible.
', b'4. The MO HealthNet program shall not reimburse or provide coverage for gender transition procedures to an individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'HB 540 4
', b'
', b'HB 540 5
', b'191.1740. Any referral for or provision of gender transition procedures to an
', b'2 individual under eighteen years of age is unprofessional conduct and shall be subject to
', b'3 discipline by the appropriate licensing entity or disciplinary review board with
', b'4 competent jurisdiction in this state.
', b'191.1745. 1. (1) Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an individual
', b'2 under eighteen years of age may bring an action under sections 191.1725 to 191.1749
', b"3 throughout the individual's minority through a parent or next friend and may bring an
", b"4 action under sections 191.1725 to 191.1749 in the individual's own name upon reaching
", b'5 the age of majority at any time from that point until thirty years after reaching the age
', b'6 of majority.
', b'7 (2) If at the time the individual abused attains the age of eighteen years he or she
', b'8 is under other legal disability, the limitation period under subdivision (1) of this
', b'9 subsection shall not begin to run until the removal of the disability.
', b'10 (3) The limitation period in subdivision (1) of this subsection shall not run
', b'11 during a time period when the individual is subject to threats, intimidation,
', b'12 manipulation, fraudulent concealment, or fraud perpetrated by the physician or other
', b'13 health care professional who prescribed or otherwise provided gender transition
', b'14 procedures or by any person acting in the interest of the physician or other health care
', b'15 professional.
', b'16 2. (1) An individual may assert an actual or threatened violation of sections
', b'17 191.1725 to 191.1749 as a claim or defense in a judicial or administrative proceeding.
', b'18 (2) The following damages may be awarded to a claimant described in
', b'19 subdivision (1) of this subsection:
', b'20 (a) Compensatory damages including, but not limited to:
', b'21 a. Pain and suffering;
', b'22 b. Loss of reputation;
', b'23 c. Loss of income; and
', b'24 d. Loss of consortium including, but not limited to, the loss of expectation of
', b'25 sharing parenthood;
', b'26 (b) Injunctive relief;
', b'27 (c) Declaratory relief;
', b'28 (d) Punitive damages; and
', b'29 (e) Any other appropriate relief.
', b'30 (3) A prevailing party who establishes a violation of sections 191.1725 to
', b"31 191.1749 shall recover reasonable attorney's fees.
", b'32 3. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an action under sections 191.1725
', b'33 to 191.1749 may be commenced, and relief may be granted, in a judicial proceeding
', b'
', b'HB 540 6
', b'34 without regard to whether the individual commencing the action has sought or
', b'35 exhausted available administrative remedies.
', b'36 4. (1) The attorney general may bring an action to enforce compliance with
', b'37 sections 191.1725 to 191.1749.
', b'38 (2) Sections 191.1725 to 191.1749 do not deny, impair, or otherwise affect any
', b'39 right or authority of the attorney general, the state, or any agency, officer, or employee
', b'40 of the state, acting under any law other than sections 191.1725 to 191.1749, to institute
', b'41 or intervene in any proceeding.
', b'191.1748. The general assembly, by joint resolution, may appoint one or more of
', b'2 its members who sponsored or cosponsored the legislation enacting sections 191.1720 to
', b'3 191.1749 and section 376.1280 in his or her official capacity to intervene or defend such
', b'4 legislation as a matter of right in any case in which the constitutionality or enforceability
', b'5 of the legislation, any portion thereof, or any rule or regulation adopted thereunder is
', b'6 challenged.
', b'191.1749. Any provision of sections 191.1720 to 191.1749 or section 376.1280
', b'2 held to be invalid or unenforceable by its terms, or as applied to any person or
', b'3 circumstance, shall be construed so as to give it the maximum effect permitted by law,
', b'4 unless such holding shall be one of utter invalidity or unenforceability, in which event
', b'5 such provision shall be deemed severable herefrom and shall not affect the remainder
', b'6 hereof or the application of such provision to other persons not similarly situated or to
', b'7 other dissimilar circumstances.
', b'376.1280. 1. For purposes of this section, the following terms mean:
', b'2 (1) "Gender transition procedure", the same meaning given to the term in
', b'3 section 191.1725;
', b'4 (2) "Health benefit plan", the same meaning given to the term in section
', b'5 376.1350;
', b'6 (3) "Health carrier", the same meaning given to the term in section 376.1350.
', b'7 2. A health carrier or health benefit plan that offers or issues health benefit
', b'8 plans that are delivered, issued for delivery, continued, or renewed in this state on or
', b'9 after January 1, 2024, shall not include reimbursement for gender transition procedures
', b'10 for an individual under eighteen years of age.
', b'11 3. A health carrier or health benefit plan that offers or issues health benefit
', b'12 plans that are delivered, issued for delivery, continued, or renewed in this state on or
', b'13 after January 1, 2024, shall not be required to provide coverage for gender transition
', b'14 procedures.
', b'15 4. A federal health benefit plan under an insurance policy or other plan
', b'16 providing health care coverage, such as TriCare or Veterans Administration health care,
', b'
', b'HB 540 7
', b'17 shall not include reimbursement for gender transition procedures for an individual 18 under eighteen years of age in this state.
', b'Section B. The enactment of sections 191.1720 to 191.1749 and section 376.1280 of 2 this act shall become effective on January 1, 2024.
', b'\xe2\x9c\x94']

[b'H.B. 132LEGISLATIVE GENERAL  COUNSEL
', b'6  Approved for F iling: C. W illiams  6
', b'6    12-29-22  9:14 AM    6H.B. 1 32
', b'1 PROHI BITING SEX TRANSI TIONI NG PROCEDURES ON
', b'2 MINORS
', b'3 2023 GENERAL  SESSI ON
', b'4 STATE OF  UTAH
', b'5 Chief Spo nsor:  Rex  P. Shi pp
', b'6 Senate Sponsor:  ____________
', b'7  
', b'8 LONG  TITLE
', b'9 General Description:
', b'10 This bill prohibits a health care provider from performing  a medical procedure on a
', b'11 minor for the purpose of attempted sex  transitioning  or attempted sex  chang e.
', b'12 Highlighted P rovisions:
', b'13 This bill:
', b'14 <defines terms;
', b'15 <makes it unprofessional conduct for a health care provider to perform a medical
', b'16 procedure on a minor for the purpose of attempted sex  transitioning  or attempted
', b'17 sex chang e; and
', b'18 <makes technical chang es. 
', b'19 Money Appropriated in this Bill:
', b'20 None
', b'21 Other Special Clauses:
', b'22 None
', b'23 Utah Code Sections Af fected:
', b'24 AMENDS:
', b'25 58-31b-502 , as last amended by  Laws of Utah 2022, Chapter 290
', b'26 58-67-102 , as last amended by  Laws of Utah 2022, Chapter 233
', b'27 58-67-502 , as last amended by  Laws of Utah 2021, Chapter 337
', b'*HB0132*H.B. 1 32 12-29-22  9:14 AM
', b'- 2 -28 58-68-102 , as last amended by  Laws of Utah 2022, Chapter 233
', b'29 58-68-502 , as last amended by  Laws of Utah 2021, Chapter 337
', b'30 58-70a-503 , as last amended by  Laws of Utah 2022, Chapter 290
', b'31 ENACTS:
', b'32 58-1-511 , Utah Code Annotated 1953
', b'33  
', b'34 Be it enacted by the Legislature of the state of Utah:
', b'35 Section 1.  Section 58-1-511  is enacted to read:
', b'36 58-1-511.   Prohibition on horm onal transgender procedures on m inors.
', b'37 (1)  As used in this section:
', b'38 (a)  " Administration of cross-sex  hormones"  means administering  or supply ing:
', b'39 (i)  to an individual whose biolog ical sex  at birth is female, a dose of testosterone or
', b'40 other androg ens at levels above those normally  found in an individual whose biolog ical sex  at
', b'41 birth is female; or
', b'42 (ii)  to an individual whose biolog ical sex  at birth is male, a dose of estrog en or a
', b'43 synthetic compound with estrog enic activity  or effect at levels above those normally  found in
', b'44 an individual whose biolog ical sex  at birth is male.
', b'45 (b)  " Health care provider"  means:
', b'46 (i)  a phy sician licensed under:
', b'47 (A)  Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; or
', b'48 (B)  Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act;
', b'49 (ii)  a phy sician assistant licensed under Chapter 70a, Utah Phy sician Assistant Act; or
', b'50 (iii)  an advanced practice reg istered nurse licensed under Subsection 58-31b-301 (2)(e).
', b'51 (c)  " Hormonal transg ender procedure"  means:
', b'52 (i)  administration of cross-sex  hormones; or
', b'53 (ii)  performing  a puberty  inhibition procedure.
', b'54 (d)  " Minor"  means an individual who:
', b'55 (i)  is less than 18 y ears old; and
', b'56 (ii)  is not emancipated under Title 80, Chapter 7, Emancipation.
', b'57 (e) (i)  " Puberty  inhibition procedure"  means administering  or supply ing, alone or in
', b'58 combination with aromatase inhibitors:12-29-22  9:14 AM H.B. 1 32
', b'- 3 -59 (A)  g onadotropin-releasing  hormone ag onists;
', b'60 (B)  prog estins; or
', b'61 (C)  androg en receptor inhibitors.
', b'62 (ii)  " Puberty  inhibition procedure"  does not include administering  or supply ing a
', b'63 treatment described in Subsection (1)(e)(i) to an individual if the treatment is medically
', b'64 necessary  as a treatment for:
', b'65 (A)  precocious puberty ;
', b'66 (B)  idiopathic short stature;
', b'67 (C)  endometriosis; or
', b'68 (D)  a sex  hormone-stimulated cancer.
', b'69 (2)  A health care provider may  not perform a hormonal transg ender procedure on a
', b'70 minor.
', b'71 Section 2.  Section 58-31b-502  is amended to read:
', b'72 58-31b-502.    Unprof essional conduct.
', b'73 (1)  " Unprofessional conduct"  includes:
', b"74 (a)  failure to safeg uard a patient' s right to privacy  as to the patient' s person, condition,
", b'75 diagnosis, personal effects, or any  other matter about which the licensee is privileg ed to know
', b"76 because of the licensee' s or person with a certification' s position or practice as a nurse or
", b'77 practice as a medication aide certified;
', b'78 (b)  failure to provide nursing  service or service as a medication aide certified in a
', b"79 manner that demonstrates respect for the patient' s human dig nity and unique personal character
", b"80 and needs without reg ard to the patient' s race, relig ion, ethnic backg round, socioeconomic
", b"81 status, ag e, sex , or the nature of the patient' s health problem;
", b'82 (c)  eng aging in sex ual relations with a patient during  any:
', b'83 (i)  period when a g enerally  recog nized professional relationship ex ists between the
', b'84 person licensed or certified under this chapter and the patient; or
', b'85 (ii)  ex tended period when a patient has reasonable cause to believe a professional
', b'86 relationship ex ists between the person licensed or certified under the provisions of this chapter
', b'87 and the patient;
', b'88 (d) (i)  as a result of any  circumstance under Subsection (1)(c), ex ploiting  or using
', b"89 information about a patient or ex ploiting  the licensee' s or the person with a certification' sH.B. 1 32 12-29-22  9:14 AM
", b'- 4 -90 professional relationship between the licensee or holder of a certification under this chapter and
', b'91 the patient; or
', b"92 (ii)  ex ploiting  the patient by  use of the licensee' s or person with a certification' s
", b'93 knowledg e of the patient obtained while acting  as a nurse or a medication aide certified;
', b'94 (e)  unlawfully  obtaining , possessing , or using  any prescription drug  or illicit drug ;
', b'95 (f)  unauthoriz ed taking  or personal use of nursing  supplies from an employ er;
', b"96 (g)  unauthoriz ed taking  or personal use of a patient' s personal property ;
", b'97 (h)  unlawful or inappropriate deleg ation of nursing  care;
', b'98 (i)  failure to ex ercise appropriate supervision of persons providing  patient care services
', b'99 under supervision of the licensed nurse;
', b'100 (j)  employ ing or aiding  and abetting  the employ ment of an unqualified or unlicensed
', b'101 person to practice as a nurse;
', b'102 (k)  failure to file or record any  medical report as required by  law, impeding  or
', b'103 obstructing  the filing  or recording  of such a report, or inducing  another to fail to file or record
', b'104 such a report;
', b'105 (l)  breach of a statutory , common law, reg ulatory , or ethical requirement of
', b'106 confidentiality  with respect to a person who is a patient, unless ordered by  a court;
', b'107 (m)  failure to pay  a penalty  imposed by  the division;
', b'108 (n)  prescribing  a Schedule I I controlled substance without comply ing with the
', b'109 requirements in Section 58-31b-803 , if applicable;
', b'110 (o)  violating  Section 58-31b-801 ;
', b'111 (p)  violating  the dispensing  requirements of Section 58-17b-309  or Chapter 17b, Part
', b'112 8, Dispensing  Medical Practitioner and Dispensing  Medical Practitioner Clinic Pharmacy , if
', b'113 applicable;
', b'114 (q)  falsely  making  an entry  in, or altering , a medical record with the intent to conceal:
', b'115 (i)  a wrong ful or neg ligent act or omission of an individual licensed under this chapter
', b'116 or an individual under the direction or control of an individual licensed under this chapter; or
', b'117 (ii)  conduct described in Subsections (1)(a) throug h (o) or Subsection 58-1-501 (1); [ or]
', b'118 (r)  violating  the requirements of Title 26, Chapter 61a, Utah Medical Cannabis Act[ .];
', b'119 or
', b'120 (s)  performing , or causing  to be performed,  a hormonal transg ender procedure in12-29-22  9:14 AM H.B. 1 32
', b'- 5 -121 violation of Section 58-1-511 .
', b'122 (2)  " Unprofessional conduct"  does not include, in accordance with Title 26, Chapter
', b'123 61a, Utah Medical Cannabis Act, when reg istered as a qualified medical provider, or acting  as
', b'124 a limited medical provider, as those terms are defined in Section 26-61a-102 , recommending
', b'125 the use of medical cannabis.
', b'126 (3)  Notwithstanding  Subsection (2), the division, in consultation with the board and in
', b'127 accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking  Act, shall define
', b'128 unprofessional conduct for an advanced practice reg istered nurse described in Subsection (2).
', b'129 Section 3.  Section 58-67-102  is amended to read:
', b'130 58-67-102.    Definitions.
', b'131 In addition to the definitions in Section 58-1-102 , as used in this chapter:
', b'132 (1) (a)  " Ablative procedure"  means a procedure that is ex pected to ex cise, vaporiz e,
', b'133 disinteg rate, or remove living  tissue, including  the use of carbon diox ide lasers and erbium:
', b'134 YAG lasers.
', b'135 (b)  " Ablative procedure"  does not include hair removal.
', b'136 (2)  " ACGME"  means the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education of the
', b'137 American Medical Association.
', b'138 (3)  " Administrative penalty " means a monetary  fine or citation imposed by  the division
', b'139 for acts or omissions determined to constitute unprofessional or unlawful conduct, in
', b'140 accordance with a fine schedule established by  the division in collaboration with the board, as a
', b'141 result of an adjudicative proceeding  conducted in accordance with Title 63G, Chapter 4,
', b'142 Administrative Procedures Act.
', b'143 (4)  " Associate phy sician"  means an individual licensed under Section 58-67-302.8 .
', b'144 (5)  " Attempted sex  chang e" means an attempt or effort to chang e an individual' s body
', b"145 to present that individual as being  of a sex  or gender that is different from the individual' s
", b'146 biolog ical sex  at birth.
', b'147 (6)  " Biolog ical sex  at birth"  means an individual' s sex , as being  male or female,
', b'148 according  to distinct reproductive roles as manifested by  sex and reproductive org an anatomy ,
', b'149 chromosomal makeup, and endog enous hormone profiles.
', b'150 [(5)] (7)  "Board"  means the Phy sicians L icensing  Board created in Section 58-67-201 .
', b'151 [(6)] (8)  "Collaborating  physician"  means an individual licensed under SectionH.B. 1 32 12-29-22  9:14 AM
', b'- 6 -152 58-67-302  who enters into a collaborative practice arrang ement with an associate phy sician.
', b'153 [(7)] (9)  "Collaborative practice arrang ement"  means the arrang ement described in
', b'154 Section 58-67-807 .
', b'155 (10)  " Cosmetic breast surg ical procedure"  means a breast reduction surg ery or a breast
', b'156 augmentation surg ery that is performed for a purpose other than:
', b'157 (a)  medical necessity ; or
', b'158 (b)  to address a musculoskeletal problem.
', b'159 [(8)] (11) (a)  " Cosmetic medical device"  means tissue altering  energ y based devices
', b'160 that have the potential for altering  living  tissue and that are used to perform ablative or
', b'161 nonablative procedures, such as American National Standards I nstitute (ANSI ) desig nated
', b'162 Class I IIb and Class I V lasers, intense pulsed lig ht, radio frequency  devices, and lipoly tic
', b'163 devices, and ex cludes ANSI  desig nated Class I IIa and lower powered devices.
', b'164 (b)  Notwithstanding  Subsection [ (8)(a),]  (11)(a), if an ANSI  desig nated Class I IIa and
', b'165 lower powered device is being  used to perform an ablative procedure, the device is included in
', b'166 the definition of cosmetic medical device under Subsection [ (8)(a).]  (11)(a).
', b'167 [(9)] (12)  " Cosmetic medical procedure" :
', b'168 (a)  includes the use of cosmetic medical devices to perform ablative or nonablative
', b'169 procedures; and
', b'170 (b)  does not include a treatment of the ocular g lobe such as refractive surg ery.
', b'171 [(10)]  (13)  " Diag nose"  means:
', b"172 (a)  to ex amine in any  manner another person, parts of a person' s body , substances,
", b"173 fluids, or materials ex creted, taken, or removed from a person' s body , or produced by  a person' s
", b'174 body , to determine the source, nature, kind, or ex tent of a disease or other phy sical or mental
', b'175 condition;
', b'176 (b)  to attempt to conduct an ex amination or determination described under Subsection
', b'177 [(10)(a);]  (13)(a);
', b'178 (c)  to hold oneself out as making  or to represent that one is making  an ex amination or
', b'179 determination as described in Subsection [ (10)(a);]  (13)(a); or
', b'180 (d)  to make an ex amination or determination as described in Subsection [ (10)(a)]
', b'181 (13)(a) upon or from information supplied directly  or indirectly  by another person, whether or
', b'182 not in the presence of the person making  or attempting  the diag nosis or ex amination.12-29-22  9:14 AM H.B. 1 32
', b'- 7 -183 [(11)]  (14)  " LCME"  means the L iaison Committee on Medical Education of the
', b'184 American Medical Association.
', b'185 [(12)]  (15)  " Medical assistant"  means an unlicensed individual who may  perform tasks
', b'186 as described in Subsection 58-67-305 (6).
', b'187 [(13)]  (16)  " Medically  underserved area"  means a g eographic area in which there is a
', b'188 shortag e of primary  care health services for residents, as determined by  the Department of
', b'189 Health.
', b'190 [(14)]  (17)  " Medically  underserved population"  means a specified g roup of people
', b'191 living  in a defined g eographic area with a shortag e of primary  care health services, as
', b'192 determined by  the Department of Health.
', b'193 [(15)]  (18) (a) (i)  " Nonablative procedure"  means a procedure that is ex pected or
', b'194 intended to alter living  tissue, but is not intended or ex pected to ex cise, vaporiz e, disinteg rate,
', b'195 or remove living  tissue.
', b'196 (ii)  Notwithstanding  Subsection [ (15)(a)(i)]  (18)(a)(i), nonablative procedure includes
', b'197 hair removal.
', b'198 (b)  " Nonablative procedure"  does not include:
', b'199 (i)  a superficial procedure as defined in Section 58-1-102 ;
', b'200 (ii)  the application of permanent make-up; or
', b'201 (iii)  the use of photo therapy  and lasers for neuromusculoskeletal treatments that are
', b"202 performed by  an individual licensed under this title who is acting  within the individual' s scope
", b'203 of practice.
', b'204 [(16)]  (19)  " Physician"  means both phy sicians and surg eons licensed under Section
', b'205 58-67-301 , Utah Medical Practice Act, and osteopathic phy sicians and surg eons licensed under
', b'206 Section 58-68-301 , Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act.
', b'207 [(17)]  (20) (a)  " Practice of medicine"  means:
', b'208 (i)  to diag nose, treat, correct, administer anesthesia, or prescribe for any  human
', b'209 disease, ailment, injury , infirmity , deformity , pain or other condition, phy sical or mental, real
', b'210 or imag inary , including  to perform cosmetic medical procedures, or to attempt to do so, by  any
', b'211 means or instrumentality , and by  an individual in Utah or outside the state upon or for any
', b'212 human within the state;
', b'213 (ii)  when a person not licensed as a phy sician directs a licensee under this chapter toH.B. 1 32 12-29-22  9:14 AM
', b'- 8 -214 withhold or alter the health care services that the licensee has ordered;
', b'215 (iii)  to maintain an office or place of business for the purpose of doing  any of the acts
', b'216 described in Subsection [ (17)(a)]  (20)(a) whether or not for compensation; or
', b'217 (iv)  to use, in the conduct of any  occupation or profession pertaining  to the diag nosis or
', b'218 treatment of human diseases or conditions in any  printed material, stationery , letterhead,
', b'219 envelopes, sig ns, or advertisements, the desig nation " doctor,"  "doctor of medicine,"
', b'220 "physician,"  "surgeon,"  "physician and surg eon,"  "Dr.,"  "M.D.,"  or any  combination of these
', b'221 desig nations in any  manner which mig ht cause a reasonable person to believe the individual
', b'222 using  the desig nation is a licensed phy sician and surg eon, and if the party  using  the desig nation
', b'223 is not a licensed phy sician and surg eon, the desig nation must additionally  contain the
', b'224 description of the branch of the healing  arts for which the person has a license, provided that an
', b'225 individual who has received an earned deg ree of doctor of medicine deg ree but is not a licensed

', b'227 Licensed"  or "Not Licensed in Utah"  in the same siz e and sty le of lettering .
', b'228 (b)  The practice of medicine does not include:
', b'229 (i)  ex cept for an ablative medical procedure as provided in Subsection [ (17)(b)(ii)]
', b'230 (20)(b)(ii), the conduct described in Subsection [ (17)(a)(i)]  (20)(a)(i)that is performed in
', b'231 accordance with a license issued under another chapter of this title;
', b'232 (ii)  an ablative cosmetic medical procedure if the scope of practice for the person
', b'233 performing  the ablative cosmetic medical procedure includes the authority  to operate or
', b'234 perform a surg ical procedure; or
', b'235 (iii)  conduct under Subsection 58-67-501 (2).
', b'236 [(18)]  (21)  " Prescription device"  means an instrument, apparatus, implement, machine,
', b'237 contrivance, implant, in vitro reag ent, or other similar or related article, and any  component
', b'238 part or accessory , which is required under federal or state law to be prescribed by  a practitioner
', b'239 and dispensed by  or throug h a person or entity  licensed under this chapter or ex empt from

', b'241 [(19)]  (22)  " Prescription drug " means a drug  that is required by  federal or state law or
', b'242 rule to be dispensed only  by prescription or is restricted to administration only  by practitioners.
', b'243 (23) (a)  " Sex characteristic-altering  surg ical procedure"  means, for the purpose of
', b"244 effectuating  or facilitating  an individual' s attempted sex  chang e:12-29-22  9:14 AM H.B. 1 32
", b'- 9 -245 (i)  castration, orchiectomy , penectomy , vaginoplasty , vulvoplasty , breast aug mentation
', b'246 surgery, or facial feminiz ation surg ery on an individual whose biolog ical sex  at birth is male;
', b'247 (ii)  mastectomy , hysterectomy , oophorectomy , metoidioplasty , phalloplasty , or chest or

', b'249 (iii)  any  surg ical procedure that is related to or necessary  for a procedure described in

', b'253 (b)  " Sex characteristic-altering  surg ical procedure"  does not include:
', b'254 (i)  surg ery or other procedures or treatments performed on an individual who:
', b'255 (A)  is born with ex ternal biolog ical sex  characteristics that are irresolvably  ambig uous;
', b'256 (B)  is born with 46, XX chromosomes with viriliz ation;

', b'258 (D)  has both ovarian and testicular tissue; or

', b'263 (A)  because the body  part is cancerous or diseased; or
', b'264 (B)  for a reason that is medically  necessary , other than to effectuate or facilitate an
', b"265 individual' s attempted sex  chang e.
", b'266 [(20)]  (24)  " SPEX"  means the Special Purpose Ex amination of the F ederation of State

', b'272 Section 4.  Section 58-67-502  is amended to read:
', b'273 58-67-502.    Unprof essional conduct.
', b'274 (1)  " Unprofessional conduct"  includes, in addition to the definition in Section

title: K-12 schools/higher ed. institution; designation of interscholastic, etc., sports based on sex, etc.
description: K-12 schools and institutions of higher education; designation of interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, and club athletic teams and sports based on biological sex; student participation in female teams or sports; civil cause of action. Requires each interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport sponsored by a public elementary or secondary school or by a public institution of higher education to be expressly designated as one of the following based on biological sex: (i) males, men, or boys; (ii) females, women, or girls; or (iii) coed or mixed if participation on such team or sport is open to both (a) males, men, or boys and (b) females, women, or girls. The bill requires identification of the student's biological sex on an athletics eligibility form signed by a licensed physician, nurse practitioner, or physician assistant to be submitted by any such student who desires to try out for or participate in an interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport. The bill prohibits any such team or sport that is expressly designated for females, women, or girls from being open to students whose biological sex is male. The bill further prohibits any interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport sponsored by a public elementary or secondary school or a public institution of higher education from competing against any interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport sponsored by a private elementary or secondary school or private institution of higher education in the Commonwealth unless such private school or institution complies with the applicable provisions of the bill.  K-12 schools and institutions of higher education; designation of interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, and club athletic teams and sports based on biological sex; student participation in female teams or sports; civil cause of action. Requires each interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport sponsored by a public elementary or secondary school or by a public institution of higher education to be expressly designated as one of the following based on biological sex: (i) males, men, or boys; (ii) females, women, or girls; or (iii) coed or mixed if participation on such team or sport is open to both (a) males, men, or boys and (b) females, women, or girls. The bill requires identification of the student's biological sex on an athletics eligibility form signed by a licensed physician, nurse practitioner, or physician assistant to be submitted by any such student who desires to try out for or participate in an interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport. The bill prohibits any such team or sport that is expressly designated for females, women, or girls from being open to students whose biological sex is male. The bill further prohibits any interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport sponsored by a public elementary or secondary school or a public institution of higher education from competing against any interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport sponsored by a private elementary or secondary school or private institution of higher education in the Commonwealth unless such private school or institution complies with the applicable provisions of the bill.  The bill prohibits any government entity, licensing or accrediting organization, or athletic association or organization from entertaining a complaint, opening an investigation, or taking any other adverse action against public school or institution of higher education based on a violation of the provisions of the bill and creates a cause of action for any school or institution of higher education that suffers harm as a result of a violation of the bill. Finally, the bill creates a civil cause of action for any student that suffers harm as a result of a knowing violation of a provision of the bill by a school or institution or as a result of the student's reporting a violation of a provision of the bill by a school, institution, athletic association, or organization.

text:
[b'23100643D
', b'HOUSE BILL NO. 1387
', b'Offered January 11, 2023
', b'Prefiled November 15, 2022
', b"A BILL to amend and reenact \xc2\xa722.1-271.7 of the Code of Virginia and to amend the Code of Virginia by adding sections numbered 22.1-271.9 and 23.1-408.2, relating to K-12 schools and institutions of higher education; designation of interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, and club athletic teams and sports based on biological sex; identification of student's biological sex on athletic eligibility form; student participation in female teams or sports; civil cause of action.
", b'----------
', b'Patron-- Greenhalgh
', b'----------
', b'Committee Referral Pending
', b'----------
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Virginia:
', b'
', b'1. That \xc2\xa722.1-271.7 of the Code of Virginia is amended and reenacted and that the Code of Virginia is amended by adding sections numbered 22.1-271.9 and 23.1-408.2 as follows:
', b'
', b'\xc2\xa722.1-271.7. Public school student-athletes; pre-participation physical examination; athletics eligibility form.
', b'
', b"No public middle elementary or secondary school student shall be a participant on or try out for any school interscholastic, intramural, or club athletic team or squad sport with a predetermined roster, regular practices, and scheduled competitions with other middle schools sponsored by a public school unless such student has submitted to the school principal a signed report an athletics eligibility form signed from by a licensed physician, a licensed nurse practitioner practicing in accordance with the provisions of \xc2\xa7 54.1-2957, or a licensed physician assistant acting under the supervision of a licensed physician attesting: (i) that such student has been examined, within the preceding 12 months, and (ii) that such student was found to be physically fit for athletic competition, and (iii) to such student's biological sex.
", b'
', b'\xc2\xa722.1-271.9. Interscholastic, intramural, and club athletic teams and sports; designation of teams; student participation.
', b'
', b'A. Each interscholastic, intramural, or club athletic team or sport sponsored by a public school shall be expressly designated as one of the following based on biological sex:
', b'
', b'1. For "males," "men," or "boys";
', b'
', b'2. For "females," "women," or "girls"; or
', b'
', b'3. For "coed" or "mixed" if participation on such team or in such sport is open to both (i) males, men, or boys and (ii) females, women, or girls.
', b'
', b'B. Each interscholastic, intramural, or club athletic team or sport sponsored by a public school that is expressly designated for "females," "women," or "girls," pursuant to subsection A shall not be open to any student whose biological sex is male.
', b'
', b'C. Nothing in this section shall be construed to restrict the eligibility of any student to participate in any interscholastic, intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is expressly designated for "males," "men," or "boys" or as "coed" or "mixed."
', b'
', b'D. The eligibility of a public school student to participate on any interscholastic, intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is expressly designated for (i) "males," "men," or "boys," or (ii) "females," "women," or "girls" shall be based on the student's biological sex as identified on such student's signed athletics eligibility form, required pursuant to \xc2\xa722.1-271.7.
', b'
', b'E. No interscholastic, intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public school shall compete against any interscholastic, intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a private school unless such private school complies with the applicable provisions of this section, mutatis mutandis.
', b'
', b'F. No government entity, licensing or accrediting organization, or athletic association or organization shall entertain a complaint, open an investigation, or take any other adverse action against a school for explicitly designating or maintaining separate interscholastic, intramural, or club athletic teams or sports for "females," "women," or "girls," pursuant to subsections A, B, and E. Any school that suffers any direct or direct harm as a result of a violation of this section shall have a private cause of action for injunctive relief, damages, and any other relief available under law against such government entity, licensing or accrediting organization, or athletic association or organization.
', b'
', b'G. Any student who is (i) deprived of an athletic opportunity or suffers any direct or indirect harm as a result of a school knowingly violating this section or (ii) subject to retaliation or other adverse action by a school, athletic association, or organization as a result of reporting a violation of this section to an employee or representative of such school, athletic association, or organization, or to any state or federal agency with oversight of school in the Commonwealth, shall have a private cause of action for injunctive relief, damages, and any other relief available under law against such school, athletic association, or organization.
', b'
', b'H. All civil actions brought pursuant to subsection F or G must be initiated within two years after the harm occurred.
', b'
', b'I. The provisions of this section shall be construed liberally so as to effectuate its purposes to the fullest extent permitted by law. If any one or more provisions, subsections, sentences, clauses, phrases, or words of this section or their application to any individual, entity, or circumstance is found to be unconstitutional, it shall be deemed severable, and the remainder of this section and its applicability to other individuals, entities, or circumstances not similarly situated shall remain effective.
', b'
', b'\xc2\xa723.1-408.2. Intercollegiate, intramural, and club athletic teams and sports; designation of teams; student participation.
', b'
', b'A. Each intercollegiate, intramural, and club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public institution of higher education shall be expressly designated as one of the following based on biological sex:
', b'
', b'1. For "males," "men," or "boys";
', b'
', b'2. For "females," "women," or "girls"; or
', b'
', b'3. For "coed" or "mixed," if participation on such team or sport is open to both both (i) males, men, or boys and (ii) females, women, or girls.
', b'
', b'B. Each intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public institution of higher education and that is expressly designated for "females," "women," or "girls" pursuant to subsection A shall not be open to any student whose biological sex is male. This section shall not be construed to restrict the eligibility of any student to try out for or compete in any intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport sponsored by such institution of higher education that is expressly designated for "males," "men," or "boys" or as "coed" or "mixed."
', b'
', b"C. No student enrolled at a public institution of higher education shall be a participant on or try out for any intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport sponsored by a public institution of higher education unless such student has submitted to the appropriate department or individual of the institution an athletics eligibility form signed by a licensed physician, a licensed nurse practitioner practicing in accordance with the provisions of \xc2\xa754.1-2957, or a licensed physician assistant acting under the supervision of a licensed physician verifying: (i) that such student has received a physical examination within the preceding 12 months, (ii) such student was found physically fit for athletic competition, and (iii) such student's biological sex.
", b'
', b'D. No intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public institution of higher education shall compete against any private institution of higher education unless such private institution of higher education complies with the applicable provisions of this section.
', b'
', b'E. No government entity, licensing or accrediting organization, or athletic association or organization shall entertain a complaint, open an investigation, or take any other adverse action against a school for explicitly designating or maintaining separate intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic teams or sports for "females, "women," or "girls" pursuant to subsections A, B, and C. Any institution of higher education that suffers any direct or indirect harm as a result of a violation of this section shall have a private cause of action for injunctive relief, damages, and any other relief available under law against such government entity, licensing or accrediting organization, or athletic association or organization.
', b'
', b'F. Any student who is (i) deprived of an athletic opportunity or suffers any direct or indirect harm as a result of a knowing violation of this section by a public institution of higher education or (ii) subject to retaliation or other adverse action by an institution of higher education, athletic association, or organization as a result of reporting a violation of this section to an employee or representative of such institution, athletic association, or organization, or to any state or federal agency with oversight of such institution in the Commonwealth, shall have a private cause of action for injunctive relief, damages, and any other relief available under law against such institution, athletic association, or organization.
', b'
', b'G. All civil actions brought pursuant to subsections E or F must be initiated within two years after the harm occurred.
', b'
', b'H. The provisions of this section shall be construed liberally so as to effectuate its purposes to the fullest extent permitted by law. If any one or more provisions, subsections, sentences, clauses, phrases, or words of this section or their application to any individual, entity, or circumstance is found to be unconstitutional, it shall be deemed severable, and the remainder of this section and its applicability to other individuals, entities, or circumstances not similarly situated shall remain effective.
', b'
', b'2. That the provisions of this act shall be effective beginning with the 2023\xe2\x80\x932024 school year.']

title: AN ACT relating to public school facilities and declaring an emergency.
description: Create new sections of KRS Chapter 158 to define terms; establish legislative findings; ensure that student privacy exists in school restrooms, locker rooms, and shower rooms; require students born male to use only those facilities designated to be used by males and students born female to use only those facilities designated to be used by females; require schools to provide the best available accommodation to students who assert that their gender is different from their biological sex; identify consequences for using facilities designated for the opposite biological sex; EMERGENCY.

[b'UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 384  
', b'Page 1 of 3 
', b'XXXX   12/9/2022 12:25 PM   Jacketed  AN ACT relating to public school facilities and declaring an emergency.  1 
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky:  2 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2SECTION 1.   A NEW SECTION OF KRS CHAPTER 158 IS CREATED TO 3 
', b'READ AS FOLLOWS:  4 
', b'As used in Sections 1 to 3 of this Act:  5 
', b'(1) "Biological sex" means the physical condition of being male or female, which is 6 
', b"determined by a person's chrom osomes, and is identified at birth by a person's 7 
", b'anatomy;  8 
', b'(2) "School" means a school under the control of a local board of education of a 9 
', b'local school district; and  10 
', b'(3) "Unisex restroom" means a restroom designed to be suitable for both sexes.  11 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2SECTION 2.   A NEW SECTION OF KRS CHAPTER 158 IS CREATED TO 12 
', b'READ AS FOLLOWS:  13 
', b'The General Assembly finds that:  14 
', b'(1) School personnel have a duty to p rotect the dignity, health, welfare, and privacy 15 
', b'rights of students in their care;  16 
', b'(2) Children and young adults have natural and normal concerns about privacy 17 
', b'while in various states of undress, and most wish for members of the opposite 18 
', b'biological sex no t to be present in those circumstances;  19 
', b'(3) Allowing students to use restrooms, locker rooms, or shower rooms that are 20 
', b'reserved for students of a different biological sex:  21 
', b'(a) Will create a significant potential for disruption of school activities and 22 
', b'unsa fe conditions; and  23 
', b'(b) Will create potential embarrassment, shame, and psychological injury to 24 
', b'students;  25 
', b'(4) Parents have a reasonable expectation that schools will not allow minor children 26 
', b'to be viewed in various states of undress by members of the opposi te biological 27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 384  
', b'Page 2 of 3 
', b'XXXX   12/9/2022 12:25 PM   Jacketed  sex, nor allow minor children to view members of the opposite sex in various 1 
', b'states of undress; and  2 
', b'(5) Schools have a duty to respect and protect the privacy rights of students, 3 
', b'including the right not to be compelled to undress or be unclot hed in the presence 4 
', b'of members of the opposite biological sex.  5 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2SECTION 3.   A NEW SECTION OF KRS CHAPTER 158 IS CREATED TO 6 
', b'READ AS FOLLOWS:  7 
', b'(1) Every school restroom, locker room, and shower room designated for student us e 8 
', b'accessible by multiple students at the same time shall be designated for and used 9 
', b'by male students only or female students only.  10 
', b'(2) In every school setting in which a student may be in a state of undress in the 11 
', b'presence of other students, school personn el shall provide separate, private areas 12 
', b'designated for use by students based on their biological sex.  13 
', b'(3) (a) A student who asserts to school officials that his or her gender is different 14 
', b'from his or her biological sex and whose parent or legal guardian provides 15 
', b'written consent to school officials shall be provided with the best available 16 
', b'accommodation, but that accommodation shall not include the use of school 17 
', b'restrooms, unisex restrooms, locker rooms, or shower rooms designated for 18 
', b'use by students of th e opposite biological sex while students of the opposite 19 
', b'biological sex are present or could be present.  20 
', b'(b) Acceptable accommodations may include but are not limited to access to 21 
', b'single -stall restrooms or controlled use of faculty bathrooms, locker rooms , 22 
', b'or shower rooms.  23 
', b'(4) (a) While accessing a restroom, locker room, or shower room designated for 24 
', b'use by his or her biological sex, a student encountering a person of the 25 
', b'opposite biological sex shall have a private cause of action against the 26 
', b'school if sc hool personnel:  27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 384  
', b'Page 3 of 3 
', b'XXXX   12/9/2022 12:25 PM   Jacketed  1. Gave the person encountered permission to use facilities of the 1 
', b'opposite biological sex; or  2 
', b'2. Failed to take reasonable steps to prohibit the person encountered 3 
', b'from using facilities designated for use by the opposite biological sex.  4 
', b'(b) Any claims arising pursuant to this subsection shall be brought in the 5 
', b'Circuit Court in whose jurisdiction the student resides or where the school 6 
', b'is located. All claims must be initiated within two (2) years of the violation.  7 
', b'(c) The offending school sh all be civilly liable to a student who is aggrieved 8 
', b'under this subsection and who prevails in a court of jurisdiction prescribed 9 
', b'by paragraph (b) of this subsection. The student shall be entitled to recover 10 
', b'from the offending school any costs, expenses, an d fees, including 11 
', b"attorney's fees, associated with the claim.  12 
", b'(d) Nothing in this subsection shall limit other remedies at law or equity 13 
', b'available to the aggrieved student.  14 
', b'(5) Any section or portion of Sections 1 to 3 of this Act declared invalid shall not 15 
', b'affect the validity of the remaining portions of Sections 1 to 3 of this Act.  16 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2Section 4.   Whereas situations currently exist in which the privacy rights of 17 
', b'students are violated, an emergency is declared to exist, and  this Act takes effect upon its 18 
', b'passage and approval by the Governor or upon its otherwise becoming a law.  19 ']

text:
[b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b'REFERENCE TITLE: gender transition; prohibitions; hormone therapies
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b'State of Arizona
', b'
', b'Senate
', b'
', b'Fifty-sixth Legislature
', b'
', b'First Regular Session
', b'
', b'2023
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b'SB 1702
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b'Introduced by
', b'
', b'Senator Wadsack: Representatives Jones, McGarr
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b'AN ACT
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b'AMENDING SECTION 32-3230, ARIZONA REVISED STATUTES; RELATING TO HEALTH PROFESSIONALS.
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b'(TEXT OF BILL BEGINS ON NEXT PAGE)
', b'
', b' 
', b'
', b'
', b'Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of Arizona:
', b'
', b'Section 1. Section 32-3230, Arizona Revised Statutes, is amended to read:
', b'
', b'32-3230. Prohibition of permanent gender reassignment surgery for minors; prohibition on referring for or providing hormone therapy for minors; definitions
', b'
', b'A. A physician may not provide irreversible PERMANENT gender reassignment surgery to any individual who is under eighteen years of age.  A HEALTH PROFESSIONAL MAY NOT MAKE A REFERRAL FOR OR PROVIDE CROSS-SEX HORMONES OR PUBERTY-BLOCKING DRUGS TO ANY INDIVIDUAL WHO IS UNDER EIGHTEEN YEARS OF AGE.
', b'
', b'B. A physician may provide any of the following to an individual who is under eighteen years of age:
', b'
', b'1. Services to an individual born with a medically verifiable disorder of sex development, including an individual with external biological sex characteristics that are irresolvably ambiguous, such as being born with forty-six XX chromosomes with virilization or forty-six XY chromosomes with undervirilization or having both ovarian and testicular tissue.
', b'
', b'2. Services provided when a physician has otherwise diagnosed a disorder of sexual development and has determined through genetic or biochemical testing that the individual does not have normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone production or sex steroid hormone action.
', b'
', b'3. The treatment of any infection, injury, disease or disorder that has been caused by or exacerbated by the performance of gender transition procedures, whether or not the gender transition procedure was performed in accordance with state and federal law.
', b'
', b'4. Any procedure undertaken because the individual suffers from a physical disorder, physical injury or physical illness that would, as certified by a physician, place the individual in imminent danger of death or impairment of major bodily function unless surgery is performed.
', b'
', b'C. For the purposes of this section:
', b'
', b'1. "Biological sex" means the biological indication of male and female in the context of reproductive potential or capacity, such as sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads and nonambiguous internal and external genitalia present at birth, without regard to an individual's psychological, chosen or subjective experience of gender.
', b'
', b'2. "CROSS-SEX HORMONES" MEANS EITHER OF THE FOLLOWING:
', b'
', b'(a) TESTOSTERONE OR OTHER ANDROGENS GIVEN TO BIOLOGICAL FEMALES IN AMOUNTS THAT ARE LARGER OR MORE POTENT THAN WOULD NORMALLY OCCUR NATURALLY IN HEALTHY BIOLOGICAL SEX FEMALES.
', b'
', b'(b) ESTROGEN GIVEN TO BIOLOGICAL MALES IN AMOUNTS THAT ARE LARGER OR MORE POTENT THAN WOULD NORMALLY OCCUR NATURALLY IN HEALTHY BIOLOGICAL SEX MALES.
', b'
', b'2. 3. "Gender" means the psychological, behavioral, social and cultural aspects of being male or female.
', b'
', b'3. 4. "Gender transition" means the process in which a person goes from identifying with and living as a gender that corresponds to the person's biological sex to identifying with and living as a gender different from the person's biological sex and may involve social, legal or physical changes.
', b'
', b'4. 5. "Irreversible PERMANENT gender reassignment surgery" means a medical procedure performed for the purpose of assisting an individual with a gender transition, including any of the following:
', b'
', b'(a) Penectomy, orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty or vulvoplasty for biologically male patients or hysterectomy or ovariectomy for biologically female patients.
', b'
', b'(b) Metoidioplasty, phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty or implantation of erection or testicular prostheses for biologically female patients.
', b'
', b'(c) Augmentation mammoplasty for biologically male patients and subcutaneous mastectomy for female patients.
', b'
', b'5. 6. "Physician" means a person who is licensed pursuant to chapter 13 or 17 of this title.
', b'
', b'7. "PUBERTY-BLOCKING DRUGS" MEANS EITHER OF THE FOLLOWING WHEN USED TO DELAY OR SUPPRESS PUBERTAL DEVELOPMENT IN CHILDREN FOR THE PURPOSE OF ASSISTING AN INDIVIDUAL WITH A GENDER TRANSITION: 
', b'
', b'(a) GONADOTROPIN-RELEASING HORMONE ANALOGUES OR OTHER SYNTHETIC DRUGS USED IN BIOLOGICAL SEX MALES TO STOP LUTEINIZING HORMONE SECRETION AND TESTOSTERONE SECRETION.
', b'
', b'(b) SYNTHETIC DRUGS USED IN BIOLOGICAL SEX FEMALES TO STOP THE PRODUCTION OF ESTROGENS AND PROGESTERONE.
', b'Sec. 2. Effective date; purpose
', b'
', b'A. This act is effective from and after March 31, 2024.
', b'
', b"B. The effective date of this act is delayed so that minors in this state who are currently using puberty-blocking drugs or cross-sex hormones have time for appropriate medication tapering and discontinuation under the care of the minor's physician or other health professional."]

title: No Tax Breaks for Radical Corporate Activism Act of 2023
description: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to deny the trade or business expense deduction for the reimbursement of employee costs of child gender transition procedure or travel to obtain an abortion.
history: [{'date': '2023-01-31', 'action': 'Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.', 'chamber': 'S', 'chamber_id': 115, 'importance': 1}]
subjects: [{'subject_id': 13338, 'subject_name': 'Taxation'}]

title: K-12 schools/higher ed. institutions; interscholastic, etc., sports, teams based on biological sex.
description: K-12 schools and institutions of higher education; K-12 schools and institutions of higher education; interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, and club athletic teams and sports; participation on teams based on biological sex; certain requirements; civil cause of action. Requires each public elementary or secondary school and each public institution of higher education to expressly designate all interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic teams and sports sponsored by such school based on biological sex as follows: (i) for "males," "men," or "boys"; (ii) for "females," "women," or "girls"; or (iii) as "coed" or "mixed" if such team or sport is open to participation by both (a) males, men, or boys and (b) females, women, or girls. The bill provides that a student's "biological sex" is the statement of such student's biological sex on such student's official birth certificate if the statement was filed at or near the time of the student's birth. The bill prohibits any student whose biological sex is female from participating on any interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club team or sport that is expressly designated for "males," "men," or "boys," unless such school or institution does not offer an equivalent team or sport that is expressly designated for "females," "women," or "girls," or as "coed" or "mixed." The bill also prohibits any student whose biological sex is male from participation on any interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club team or sport that is expressly designated for "females," "women," or "girls." Furthermore, the bill prohibits any interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public elementary or secondary school or sponsored by a public institution of higher education from competing against any interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a private elementary or secondary school or a private institution of higher education unless such private school or institution also complies with the provisions of the bill. Finally, the bill creates a civil cause of action for students that suffer any deprivation, harm, retaliation, or adverse action or for schools that suffer any harm as a result of a violation of the provisions of the bill, provided that such action is initiated within two years of such deprivation, harm, retaliation, or adverse action.
