text:
[b'23102088D
', b'SENATE BILL NO. 911
', b'
', b'
', b'Offered January 11, 2023
', b'
', b'
', b'Prefiled January 5, 2023
', b'
', b'A BILL to amend the Code of Virginia by adding sections 
', b' numbered 22.1-271.9 and 23.1-408.2, relating to K-12 schools and institutions 
', b' of higher education; interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, and club 
', b' athletic teams and sports; participation on teams based on biological sex; 
', b' certain requirements; civil cause of action.
', b'----------
', b'
', b'Patron-- Cosgrove
', b'
', b'----------
', b'
', b'Referred to Committee on Education and Health
', b'
', b'----------
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Virginia: 
', b'1. That the Code of Virginia is amended by adding sections 
', b' numbered 22.1-271.9 and 23.1-408.2 as follows: 
', b'\xc2\xa722.1-271.9. 
', b' Interscholastic, intramural, and club athletic teams and sports; student 
', b' participation; requirements.
', b'A. For the purposes of 
', b' this section, "biological sex" means the 
', b" statement of such student's biological sex on the student's 
", b' official birth certificate if the statement was filed at or near the time of 
', b" the student's birth.
", b'B. Each interscholastic, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport sponsored by a public 
', b' elementary or secondary school shall be expressly 
', b' designated as one of the following based on biological sex:
', b'1. For "males," 
', b' "men," or "boys";
', b'2. For 
', b' "females," "women," or "girls"; or
', b'3. For "coed" or 
', b' "mixed" if participation is open to both (i) males, men, or boys and 
', b' (ii) females, women, or girls.
', b'C. No interscholastic, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public elementary 
', b' or secondary school and that 
', b' is expressly designated for "males," "men," or 
', b' "boys" pursuant to subsection B shall be open to any student whose 
', b' biological sex at birth is female unless such school does 
', b' not sponsor an equivalent team or sport that is expressly designated for 
', b' "females," "women," or "girls" or as 
', b' "coed" or "mixed."
', b'D. No interscholastic, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public 
', b' elementary or secondary school and 
', b' that is expressly designated for "females," "women," or 
', b' "girls" pursuant to subsection B shall be open to any student whose 
', b' biological sex at birth is male.
', b'E. No interscholastic, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public 
', b' elementary or secondary school shall compete against any interscholastic, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by any private 
', b' elementary or secondary school unless such private school complies with the 
', b' applicable provisions of this section, mutatis mutandis.
', b'F. Any student who (i) 
', b' is deprived of an athletic opportunity or suffers any direct or indirect harm 
', b' as a result of a school knowingly violating any provision of this section or 
', b' (ii) is subject to retaliation or another adverse action by a school or 
', b' athletic association or organization as a result of reporting a violation of 
', b' any provision of this section to an employee or representative of a school or 
', b' athletic association or organization, or to any state or federal agency with 
', b' oversight of schools in the Commonwealth, shall have a cause of action against 
', b' the school or athletic association or organization, provided that such cause of 
', b' action is initiated within two years of such deprivation, harm, retaliation, or 
', b' adverse action.
', b'G. Any 
', b' public elementary or secondary school that suffers any direct or indirect harm 
', b' as a result of a violation of any provision of this 
', b' section by any governmental entity, licensing or 
', b' accrediting organization, or athletic association or organization may initiate 
', b' a cause of action against such entity, organization, or association, provided 
', b' that such cause of action is initiated within two years of such harm.
', b'\xc2\xa723.1-408.2. Intercollegiate, 
', b' intramural, and club athletic teams and sports; student participation; 
', b' requirements. 
', b'A. For the purposes of 
', b' this section, "biological sex" means the statement of 
', b" such student's biological sex on the student's official birth certificate if 
", b" the statement was filed at or near the time of the student's birth.
", b'B. Each intercollegiate, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored 
', b' by a public institution of higher education shall be expressly designated as 
', b' one of the following based on biological sex:
', b'1. For "males," 
', b' "men," or "boys";
', b'2. For 
', b' "females," "women," or "girls"; or
', b'3. For "coed" or 
', b' "mixed" if participation is open to both (i) males, men, or boys and 
', b' (ii) females, women, or girls.
', b'C. No intercollegiate, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is 
', b' sponsored by a public institution of higher education and that is expressly 
', b' designated for "males," "men," or "boys" pursuant 
', b' to subsection B shall be open to any student whose biological sex at 
', b' birth is female unless such institution does not sponsor an equivalent team or 
', b' sport that is expressly designated for "females," "women," 
', b' or "girls" or as "coed" or "mixed."
', b'D. No intercollegiate, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public 
', b' institution of higher education and that is expressly designated for 
', b' "females," "women," or "girls" pursuant to 
', b' subsection B shall be open to any student whose biological sex at birth is 
', b' male.
', b'E. No intercollegiate, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public 
', b' institution of higher education shall compete against any intercollegiate, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by any private 
', b' institution of higher education unless such private institution of higher 
', b' education complies with the applicable provisions of this section, mutatis 
', b' mutandis.
', b'F. Any student who (i) 
', b' is deprived of an athletic opportunity or suffers any direct or indirect harm 
', b' as a result of a school knowingly violating any provision of this section or 
', b' (ii) is subject to retaliation or another adverse action by a public 
', b' institution of higher education or athletic association or organization as a 
', b' result of reporting a violation of any provision of this section to an employee 
', b' or representative of the institution or athletic association or organization, 
', b' or to any state or federal agency with oversight over public institutions of 
', b' higher education in the Commonwealth, shall have a cause of action against the 
', b' institution or athletic association or organization, provided that such cause 
', b' of action is initiated within two years of such deprivation, harm, retaliation, 
', b' or adverse action.
', b'G. Any 
', b' public institution of higher education that suffers any direct or indirect harm 
', b' as a result of a violation of any provision of this section by any governmental 
', b' entity, licensing or accrediting organization, or athletic association or 
', b' organization may initiate a cause of action against such entity, organization, 
', b' or association, provided that such cause of action is initiated within two 
', b' years of such harm.']

title: AN ACT relating to education.
description: Create new sections of KRS Chapter 158 to define terms; make legislative findings and declarations on the rights of parents as it relates to public schools and establish a standard to protect those rights; require public schools to establish a process to receive complaints of violations; create a cause of action for violations and establish limitations; establish specific parental rights as related to public schools; require public schools to adopt policies to protect those rights; require the Kentucky Department of Education to eliminate administrative regulations in violation and develop recommended policies to public schools for compliance; make findings and declarations related to privacy of parents and children and require public schools to adopt policies to safeguard those rights; establish a cause of action for a child encountering a person of the opposite biological sex while in a location where there is a reasonable expectation of bodily privacy; create a cause of action for those who are forced by a public school to share private quarters with specific people of the opposite biological sex and provide exclusions; make findings and declarations relating to controversial subject matter in common schools; establish a parental right of not having a child indoctrinated into any political position or being involved in advocacy in a controversial subject matter; establish limitations on school personnel related to instruction and discussion on sexual orientation, sexual preference, or gender expression; establish limitations on school personnel advocacy in the scope of employment and actions based on the immutable characteristics of students; prohibit compelling school personnel to advocate for or against anything in opposition to sincerely held beliefs and convictions; require public schools to adopt enforcement policies; establish limitations; establish a parental right to expect a child not be exposed to or given access to harmful to minors, pervasively vulgar, or obscene matter or performance or obscene imagery representing minors; require that public schools adopt policies to protect that right by making those materials and performances inaccessible and prohibit matters and performances harmful to minors, drag performances, pervasively vulgar performances, obscene performances, and any performance involving sexual conduct, nudity, or stripping; provide that none of the materials identified shall be deemed to have educational value for minors; establish limitations; amend KRS 158.148 to establish a parental right to expect a child will not be bulled at school and require public schools adopt policies to ensure notification and support of bullying victims, require an order of reporting to staff, require specific time requirements for investigations; provide for an appeal and review of incidents; require identification of actions to prevent future acts of bullying or retaliation; require procedures for supporting victims; establish a short title of the Childhood Protection in Education Act.

[b'UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
', b'Page 1 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  AN ACT relating to education.  1 
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky:  2 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2SECTION 1.   A NEW SECTION OF KRS CHAPTER 158 IS CREATED TO 3 
', b'READ AS FOLLOWS:  4 
', b'As used in Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act:  5 
', b'(1) "Biological sex" means the physical condition of being male or female, as 6 
', b"determined by a person's unambiguous internal and external genit alia or, if 7 
", b'necessary, sex chromosomes present at birth, and formally recognized on the 8 
', b"person's original birth certificate or the child's school enrollment documentation;  9 
", b'(2) "Child" means a person who has not reached the age of eighteen (18);  10 
', b'(3) "Community standard state of dress" means the condition of being fully clothed, 11 
', b'or partially or fully unclothed in which the bodily coverage by opaque clothing is 12 
', b'appropriate as determined by the average adult citizen of the Commonwealth 13 
', b'applying contempor ary community standards of what is appropriate dress, given:  14 
', b'(a) The age, biological sex, and other demographic factors of the unclothed 15 
', b'person;  16 
', b'(b) The age, biological sex, familial relation, and other demographic factors of 17 
', b'persons able to view the perso n within the situational context; and  18 
', b'(c) The conditions of expectation of privacy within the situational context;  19 
', b'(4) "Parent" means any biological, foster, or adoptive parent, de facto custodian as 20 
', b'defined in KRS 403.270, legal guardian who has legal cu stody of a child, or any 21 
', b'adult caregiver authorized to make school -related decisions for a child under 22 
', b'KRS 158.144, whose custody of the child has not been suspended or terminated 23 
', b'by a court order;  24 
', b'(5) "Public school" means any school district or public ch arter school organization, 25 
', b'any public school operated by those entities, the governing boards of those 26 
', b'entities, and the employees, agents, and officers of those entities; and  27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
', b'Page 2 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  (6) "School enrollment documentation" means either:  1 
', b"(a) A certified copy of the child's birth certificate; or  2 
", b"(b) Other reliable proof of the child's identity, age, and biological sex and an 3 
", b'affidavit of the inability to produce a copy of the birth certificate as provided 4 
', b'upon enrollment of the child for the first time in any primary or secondary 5 
', b'school to fulfill the requirements of KRS 158.032.  6 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2SECTION 2.   A NEW SECTION OF KRS CHAPTER 158 IS CREATED TO 7 
', b'READ AS FOLLOWS:  8 
', b'(1) As it relates to public education, the General Assembly hereby finds and decl ares 9 
', b'that:  10 
', b'(a) A parent of a child shall have the fundamental right to make decisions 11 
', b"concerning the child's care, custody, and control without obstruction or 12 
", b'interference from a public school. As it relates to public schools, this shall 13 
', b'include the:  14 
', b"1. Right to make decisions concerning the child's education, including 15 
", b'the right to cause the child to be educated in any manner that meets 16 
', b'the compulsory attendance requirements and exemptions established 17 
', b'in KRS 159.010 and 159.030 and in any other manner esta blished by 18 
', b'statute or the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Kentucky; and  19 
', b"2. High duty and right to nurture and direct their children's destiny, 20 
", b'including their upbringing and education; mental, emotional, and 21 
', b'physical health care; and moral and religiou s development;  22 
', b'(b) The interests and role of parents in the care, custody, and control of their 23 
', b'children are implicit in the concept of ordered liberty, deeply embedded in 24 
', b"our nation's history and tradition, and among the unalienable rights 25 
", b'retained by the  people under the Ninth Amendment to the Constitution of 26 
', b'the United States;  27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
', b'Page 3 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  (c) A parent of a child in this Commonwealth has inalienable rights that are 1 
', b'more comprehensive than those listed in Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act, 2 
', b'unless such rights have been  lawfully waived or terminated;  3 
', b'(d) The Commonwealth has independent authority to protect the parental rights 4 
', b'of its citizens; and  5 
', b'(e) The rights recognized and the protections established in Sections 1 to 6 and 6 
', b'7 of this Act as they are related to public school are rooted in the right to 7 
', b'due process of law guaranteed pursuant to the Constitution of the United 8 
', b'States.  9 
', b"(2) The public schools of the Commonwealth shall not violate a parent's 10 
", b'fundamental rights identified in Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act. A ny restriction 11 
', b'of or interference with these rights shall not be upheld unless it is demonstrated 12 
', b'by clear and convincing evidence to be:  13 
', b'(a) Essential to further a compelling governmental interest; and  14 
', b'(b) The least restrictive means available for the fur thering of that compelling 15 
', b'governmental interest.  16 
', b'(3) To guard the rights established in Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act, each local 17 
', b'board of education and charter school board of directors shall establish a process 18 
', b'to receive complaints regarding violat ions of those rights that includes:  19 
', b'(a) A designated recipient of complaints for each school;  20 
', b'(b) The procedure for submission of the complaint;  21 
', b'(c) Written confirmation to the parent that the complaint has been received 22 
', b'within five (5) business days of re ceipt of the complaint;  23 
', b'(d) A written response to the complaint within thirty (30) business days of 24 
', b'receipt of the complaint that outlines how the school will resolve the 25 
', b'complaint or a written statement of the specific reasons for not resolving the 26 
', b'compla int; and  27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
', b'Page 4 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  (e) A final written determination of the merits  of the complaint and the actions 1 
', b'taken, if any, by the school to resolve the complaint within sixty (60) days 2 
', b'following the receipt of the complaint or the basis for taking no action.  3 
', b'(4) (a) After exhausting the complaint process established in subsectio n (3) of this 4 
', b'section without satisfactory resolution, or if the school does not issue the 5 
', b'final written determination within the time established under subsection (3) 6 
', b'of this section, a parent shall have a civil cause of action.  7 
', b"(b) The complaint shall be  filed within sixty (60) days of the school's failure to 8 
", b'comply within the time established under subsection (3) of this section or 9 
', b'within sixty (60) days of the final written determination, whichever occurs 10 
', b'last. 11 
', b'(c) The action shall be brought in the Cir cuit Court of the county in which the 12 
', b'school is located or the parent resides.  13 
', b'(d) Remedies available to a parent under this subsection shall include:  14 
', b'1. Declaratory relief;  15 
', b'2. Injunctive relief to prevent or remedy a violation of Sections 1 to 6 or 16 
', b'7 of t his Act or the effects of such a violation;  17 
', b'3. Compensatory damages for pecuniary or nonpecuniary losses;  18 
', b"4. Reasonable attorney's fees and costs; and  19 
", b'5. Any other appropriate relief.  20 
', b'(e) If a parent brings an unsuccessful civil action against a public sch ool, the 21 
', b"parent shall not be required to pay any associated attorney's fees or costs 22 
", b'incurred by the public school.  23 
', b'(f) All claims shall be initiated within one (1) year of the violation.  24 
', b'(5) Nothing in Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act shall be construed:  25 
', b'(a) To prescribe all rights held by the parent of a child in this state; or  26 
', b'(b) As altering the established presumption in favor of the constitutionality of 27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
', b'Page 5 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  statutes and regulations.  1 
', b'(6) Any portion or section of Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act declared  invalid shall 2 
', b'not affect the validity of the remaining portions or sections of Sections 1 to 6 and 3 
', b'7 of this Act.  4 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2SECTION 3.   A NEW SECTION OF KRS CHAPTER 158 IS CREATED TO 5 
', b'READ AS FOLLOWS:  6 
', b'(1) In accordance with Section  2 of this Act, a parent shall have the following rights 7 
', b"as they relate to the parent's child and a public school:  8 
", b'(a) To access and review:  9 
', b'1. All education records relating to his or her minor child as provided in 10 
', b'KRS 160.700 to 160.730;  11 
', b'2. Any record as sociated with the selection or approval of any guest 12 
', b'lecturer, guest instructor, or outside presenter who participates in the 13 
', b"child's education;  14 
", b'3. Any records in the possession of the school relating to third -party 15 
', b'individuals and organizations contracted  with the school that the child 16 
', b'attends; and  17 
', b'4. Any student well -being questionnaire or health screening form used 18 
', b'for research purposes;  19 
', b'(b) To provide consent prior to:  20 
', b'1. A well -being questionnaire or health screening form used for research 21 
', b'purposes being given to the child. A school shall not require a grant of 22 
', b'general consent to these questionnaires or forms by a parent, but shall 23 
', b'request consent specific to each question naire or form to be provided 24 
', b'to the child;  25 
', b'2. A biometric scan of the child is made, shared, or stored by a school;  26 
', b"3. Any record of the child's blood or deoxyribonucleic acid is created, 27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
", b'Page 6 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  stored, or shared by a school, except as required by law and authori zed 1 
', b'pursuant to a court order; and  2 
', b'4. Each video or voice recording of the child is made by a school unless 3 
', b'it is made during or as part of a court -ordered proceeding or a 4 
', b'forensic interview in a criminal investigation or is to be used primarily 5 
', b'for the fo llowing purposes:  6 
', b'a. Documentation of regular classroom instruction, such as 7 
', b'participation in journalism;  8 
', b'b. Security or surveillance of buildings, grounds, or transportation 9 
', b'vehicles; or  10 
', b'c. Documentation of an extracurricular activity or public event 11 
', b'wher e recording is common practice;  12 
', b'(c) To know the people to whom and material to which the child is exposed 13 
', b'while on property owned, leased, or operated by the school;  14 
', b'(d) To know the identity of the people and entities, including but not limited to 15 
', b'organiza tions, agencies, third -party clearinghouses, and consultants, that 16 
', b"have accessed the child's education records, whether authorized by the 17 
", b'school or not;  18 
', b'(e) To access and review information identified in this section without entering 19 
', b'into a nondisclosure a greement;  20 
', b'(f) To access and review, in physical or digital format, and make copies of any 21 
', b'curricular documents, books, and other educational materials used in the 22 
', b"child's education;  23 
", b'(g) To receive, without request, any course syllabus or course reading lis t prior 24 
', b"to the child's beginning of the coursework or upon the child's enrollment in 25 
", b'the course;  26 
', b'(h) To visit his or her child at school during school hours unless the visit would 27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
', b'Page 7 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  disrupt the educational process of other children;  1 
', b'(i) To be provided a cons ent form prior to, and give written prior consent:  2 
', b'1. To each specific nonemergency health care service provided by the 3 
', b'school to the child;  4 
', b'2. To each and every session of nonemergency mental health care service 5 
', b'provided by the school to the child;  6 
', b'3. That is not a grant of general consent but is specific to each service 7 
', b'provided to the child;  8 
', b"4. That shall not waive the parent's right to access the child's education 9 
", b'or health records or the right to receive notifications required by this 10 
', b'section; and  11 
', b'5. That, if not obtained from the parent, shall prohibit the school from 12 
', b'providing that service;  13 
', b'(j) To be notified:  14 
', b'1. At the beginning of each school year, or upon enrollment, of all 15 
', b"programs and health care services offered at the child's school;  16 
", b"2. Of maj or changes in his or her child's mental, emotional, and physical 17 
", b'health and well -being, including but not limited to:  18 
', b"a. Significant changes to the child's gender expression;  19 
", b'b. Any request to be referred to by a name, pronoun, or other 20 
', b'identifier inconsis tent with the school enrollment documentation 21 
', b'submitted in accordance to KRS 158.032;  22 
', b'c. Indicators of eating disorders;  23 
', b'd. Indicators of chemical dependency;  24 
', b'e. Evidence of pregnancy, whether the result of consensual or 25 
', b'nonconsensual sexual activity;  26 
', b'f. Evidence of self -harm; and  27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
', b'Page 8 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  g. Evidence of suicidal or violent ideation or intention;  1 
', b'3. At the beginning of the school year and upon a change of status, 2 
', b"whether th e child's school campus is assigned a school resource 3 
", b'officer or not;  4 
', b'4. Within one (1) business day of the school attaining knowledge, of the 5 
', b'occurrence of the following incidents on the campus of the school the 6 
', b'child attends:  7 
', b'a. Physical assault;  8 
', b'b. Sexu al assault;  9 
', b'c. Unlawful possession of a weapon on school property;  10 
', b'd. Unlawful drug use or possession;  11 
', b'e Police investigations, unless no report is requested by police;  12 
', b"f. Notice to the parent of the parent's child being involved in a 13 
", b'bullying incident, as  defined in Section 7 of this Act; and  14 
', b"g. Regardless of the incident's location, serious crimes such as 15 
", b'capital offenses, felonies, or Class A misdemeanors, of which a 16 
', b"teacher or other school employee who works at the child's school 17 
", b'campus is charged or co nvicted; and  18 
', b'5. At the beginning of the school year or upon enrollment of a report 19 
', b'compiling the incidents outlined in subparagraph 4. of this paragraph 20 
', b'from the previous school year;  21 
', b'(k) To request and receive, without charge, one (1) copy of all informat ion 22 
', b'identified in this subsection related to the child; and  23 
', b'(l) The rights outlined in the Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act.  24 
', b'(2) To guard the rights outlined in Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act, each local board 25 
', b'of education or charter school board of di rectors shall take necessary actions and 26 
', b'shall adopt policies and procedures to:  27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
', b'Page 9 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  (a) Notify the parents of each enrolled child at the beginning of the school year 1 
', b'or upon enrollment of the parental rights outlined in Sections 1 to 6 and 7 2 
', b'of this Act;  3 
', b'(b) Ensure that no information relating to a child that requires prior consent 4 
', b'under Sections 1 to 6 of this Act is created, collected, stored, or shared 5 
', b'without the prior consent of the parent;  6 
', b'(c) Ensure that no service or activity relating to a child that r equires prior 7 
', b'consent under Sections 1 to 6 of this Act is conducted without the prior 8 
', b'consent of the parent;  9 
', b'(d) Provide prompt notification without solicitation, request, or inquiry from a 10 
', b'parent as required by Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act;  11 
', b'(e) Prov ide the opportunity to access, review, and receive in digital form, 12 
', b'without charge, any requested information involving a parent\xe2\x80\x99s minor child 13 
', b'as permitted by Sections 1 to 6 of this Act, upon the written request of the 14 
', b'parent, within five (5) business day s of the receipt of the request;  15 
', b"(f) Notify parents of major changes in their child's mental, emotional, and 16 
", b'physical health and well -being, including but not limited to those listed in 17 
', b'subsection (1)(j) of this section;  18 
', b'(g) Prohibit any teacher or other s chool employee from withholding any 19 
', b'information concerning a child\xe2\x80\x99s academic record or mental, emotional, or 20 
', b'physical well -being, including but not limited to those referenced in 21 
', b"subsection (1)(j) of this section, from the child's parent;  22 
", b'(h) Prohibit any  teacher or other school employee from coercing or 23 
', b"discouraging a child from sharing any information concerning the child's 24 
", b'academic record or mental, emotional, or physical well -being with his or 25 
', b'her parent, including but not limited to those listed in su bsection (1)(j) of 26 
', b'this section;  27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
', b'Page 10 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  (i) Prohibit the funding of any professional development activity, consultant 1 
', b'services, trainings, or incentives, or the adoption of any policies, practices, 2 
', b'or procedures, that:  3 
', b'1. Advise, compel, or incentivize any teache r, school employee, or 4 
', b'presenter to use pronouns that are inconsistent with the information 5 
', b"on the child's school enrollment documentation;  6 
", b'2. Discourage, punish, or disadvantage a teacher, school employee, or 7 
', b'presenter in any way for refusal or failure to use a name or other 8 
', b'identifier in reference to a child that is inconsistent with the child\xe2\x80\x99s 9 
', b'information listed on the school enrollment docum entation;  10 
', b'3. Assert that possessing any set of immutable characteristics makes a 11 
', b'person in any way responsible for, or a contributor to, the suffering or 12 
', b'adverse conditions experienced by another group of people; or  13 
', b'4. Advise, compel, or incentivize any pe rsons to:  14 
', b'a. Segregate or form affinity groups according to any protected 15 
', b'class;  16 
', b'b. Engage in any activity meant to separate persons based upon any 17 
', b'immutable characteristic with the intent or effect of ascribing 18 
', b'disadvantage, advantage, inferiority, or su periority; or  19 
', b'c. Assert that a person, simply by virtue of any immutable 20 
', b'characteristic, is inherently more valuable than another person 21 
', b'or better qualified to understand or empathize with persons with 22 
', b'that characteristic; and  23 
', b'(j) 1. Prohibit the impositio n of any requirement on any child as a condition 24 
', b'for school admittance or attendance, employment, participation in or 25 
', b'attendance at extra -curricular activities, or access or use of property 26 
', b'located in the Commonwealth of Kentucky, whether owned, leased, or  27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
', b'Page 11 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  operated by the institution, to:  1 
', b'a. Force the use of any type of medical device, including but not 2 
', b'limited to any type of facial coverings; or  3 
', b'b. Submit to any type of medical procedure or treatment, including 4 
', b'but not limited to any type of vaccination o r testing unless 5 
', b'otherwise directed by a court of competent jurisdiction.  6 
', b'2. Nothing in this paragraph shall:  7 
', b'a. Contradict the requirements of KRS 158.035 regarding 8 
', b'certificates of immunization;  9 
', b'b. Apply to nonmedical safety equipment used as a precaution  to 10 
', b'avoid bodily injuries in athletic activities, physical education 11 
', b'instruction, extracurricular activities, classroom instruction, or 12 
', b'demonstrations involving dangerous materials or activities;  13 
', b'c. Apply to a physical examinations or fitness required to 14 
', b'participate or resume participation in any interscholastic athletic 15 
', b'activity; or  16 
', b'd. Invalidate requirements, including those of students that have 17 
', b'curricular or work responsibilities, necessary for student 18 
', b'presence in a medical setting.  19 
', b'(3) The Kentucky Dep artment of Education and the Kentucky Board of Education 20 
', b'shall:  21 
', b'(a) Eliminate any administrative regulations or recommended practices or 22 
', b'procedures that are inconsistent with Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act; and  23 
', b'(b) Develop and recommend best practices t o facilitate compliance by schools 24 
', b'with Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act.  25 
', b'(4) A school shall not be required to adopt or comply with the recommended best 26 
', b'practices developed under subsection (3)(b) of this section, so long as the school 27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 1276  
', b'Page 12 of 27 
', b'XXXX   2/8/2023 10:53 AM   Jacketed  complies with Sect ions 1 to 6 and 7 of this Act.  1 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2SECTION 4.   A NEW SECTION OF KRS CHAPTER 158 IS CREATED TO 2 
', b'READ AS FOLLOWS:  3 
', b'(1) As it relates to public schools, the General Assembly hereby finds and declares 4 
', b'that:  5 
', b'(a) Children have natura l and normal concerns about bodily privacy while 6 
', b'partially or completely unclothed, and most children prefer that members of 7 
', b'the opposite biological sex not be present in those circumstances;  8 
', b'(b) A parent has the right, when entrusting the supervision of h is or her child to 9 
', b'a school, to not have:  10 
', b'1. His or her child permitted to view persons of the opposite sex outside 11 
', b'of the community standard state of dress;  12 
', b'2. Persons of the opposite sex permitted to view his or her child outside 13 
', b'of the community standar d state of dress; and  14 
', b'3. Persons of the opposite sex in the presence of his or her child where 15 
', b'there is a reasonable expectation of bodily privacy;  16 
', b'(c) Allowing students to share private quarters, restrooms, locker rooms, or 17 
', b'shower rooms where there is a reasonable expectation of bodily privacy, 18 
', b'which are reserved for students of a different biological sex creates:  19 
', b'1. A significant potential for disruptio n of school activities and unsafe 20 
', b'conditions; and  21 
', b'2. Potential embarrassment and shame to children; and  22 
', b'(d) Providing children who object to the use of private quarters, restrooms, 23 
', b"locker rooms, or shower rooms designated for the child's biological sex wit h 24 
", b'reasonable alternative accommodations, if and when available, avoids 25 
', b'potential complications and serves to protect their dignity and safety.  26

', b'training for school employees; and  8 
', b'8.[5.] Information reg arding the consequences of bullying and violating the 9 
', b'code and violations reportable under KRS 158.154, 158.156, or 158.444.  10 
', b'(f) The principal of each school shall apply the code of behavior and discipline 11 
', b'uniformly and fairly to each student at the school  without partiality or 12 
', b'discrimination.  13 
', b'(g) A copy of the code of behavior and discipline adopted by the board of 14 
', b'education shall be posted at each school. Guidance counselors shall be 15 
', b'provided copies for discussion with students. The code shall be referenc ed in 16 
', b'all school handbooks. All school employees and parents, legal guardians, or 17 
', b'other persons exercising custodial control or supervision shall be provided 18 
', b'copies of the code.  19 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2Section 8.   Sections 1 to 6 and 7 of this A ct shall be known as the Childhood 20 
', b'Protection in Education Act.  21 ']

title: AN ACT relating to education.
description: Create new sections of KRS Chapter 158 to define terms; make legislative findings and declarations on the rights of parents as it relates to public schools and establish a standard to protect those rights; require public schools to establish a process to receive complaints of violations; create a cause of action for violations and establish limitations; establish specific parental rights as related to public schools; require public schools to adopt policies to protect those rights; require the Kentucky Department of Education to eliminate regulations in violation and develop recommended policies to public schools for compliance; make findings and declarations related to privacy of parents and children and require public schools to adopt policies to safeguard those rights; establish a cause of action for a child encountering a person of the opposite biological sex while in a location where there is a reasonable expectation of bodily privacy; create a cause of action for those who are forced by a public school to share private quarters with specific people of the opposite biological sex and provide exclusions; make findings and declarations relating to controversial subject matter in common schools; establish a parental right of not having a child indoctrinated into any political position or being involved in advocacy in a controversial subject matter; establish limitations on school personnel related to instruction and discussion on sexual orientation, sexual preference, or gender expression; establish limitations on school personnel advocacy in the scope of employment and actions based on the immutable characteristics of students; prohibit compelling school personnel to advocate for or against anything in opposition to sincerely held beliefs and convictions; require public schools to adopt enforcement policies; establish limitations; establish a parental right to expect a child not be exposed to or given access to harmful to minors, pervasively vulgar, or obscene matter or performance or obscene imagery representing minors; require that public schools adopt policies to protect that right by making those materials and performances inaccessible and prohibit matters and performances harmful to minors, drag performances, pervasively vulgar performances, obscene performances, and any performance involving sexual conduct, nudity, or stripping; provide that none of the materials identified shall be deemed to have educational value for minors; establish limitations; amend KRS 158.148 to establish a parental right to expect a child will not be bulled at school and require public schools adopt policies to ensure notification and support of bullying victims, require an order of reporting to staff, require specific time requirements for investigations; provide for an appeal and review of incidents; require identification of actions to prevent future acts of bullying or retaliation; require procedures for supporting victims; establish a short title of the Childhood Protection in Education Act.

text:
[b'UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 943  
', b'Page 1 of 27 
', b'BR094300.100 - 943 - XXXX   2/7/2023 4:15 PM   Jacketed  AN ACT relating to education.  1 
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky:  2 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2SECTION 1.   A NEW SECTION OF KRS CHAPTER 158 IS CREATED TO 3 
', b'READ AS FOLLOWS:  4 
', b'As used in Sections 1 to 6 of this Act:  5 
', b'(1) "Biological sex" means the physical condition of being male or female, as 6 
', b"determined by a person's unambiguous internal and ext ernal genitalia or, if 7 
", b'necessary, sex chromosomes present at birth, and formally recognized on the 8 
', b"person's original birth certificate or the child's school enrollment documentation;  9 
", b'(2) "Child" means a person who has not reached the age of eighteen (18);  10 
', b'(3) "Community standard state of dress" means the condition of being fully clothed, 11 
', b'or partially or fully unclothed in which the bodily coverage by opaque clothing is 12 
', b'appropriate as determined by the average adult citizen of the Commonwealth 13 
', b'applying conte mporary community standards of what is appropriate dress, given:  14 
', b'(a) The age, biological sex, and other demographic factors of the unclothed 15 
', b'person;  16 
', b'(b) The age, biological sex, familial relation, and other demographic factors of 17 
', b'persons able to view the p erson within the situational context; and  18 
', b'(c) The conditions of expectation of privacy within the situational context;  19 
', b'(4) "Parent" means any biological, foster, or adoptive parent, de facto custodian as 20 
', b'defined in KRS 403.270, legal guardian who has lega l custody of a child, or any 21 
', b'adult caregiver authorized to make school -related decisions for a child under 22 
', b'KRS 158.144, whose custody of the child has not been suspended or terminated 23 
', b'by a court order;  24 
', b'(5) "Public school" means any school district or publi c charter school organization, 25 
', b'any public school operated by those entities, the governing boards of those 26 
', b'entities, and the employees, agents, and officers of those entities; and  27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 943  
', b'Page 2 of 27 
', b'BR094300.100 - 943 - XXXX   2/7/2023 4:15 PM   Jacketed  (6) "School enrollment documentation" means either:  1 
', b"(a) A certified copy of the child's birth certificate; or  2 
", b"(b) Other reliable proof of the child's identity, age, and biological sex and an 3 
", b'affidavit of the inability to produce a copy of the birth certificate as provided 4 
', b'upon enrollment of the child for the first time in any prim ary or secondary 5 
', b'school to fulfill the requirements of KRS 158.032.  6 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2SECTION 2.   A NEW SECTION OF KRS CHAPTER 158 IS CREATED TO 7 
', b'READ AS FOLLOWS:  8 
', b'(1) As it relates to public education, the General Assembly hereby finds and declares 9 
', b'that:  10 
', b'(a) A parent of a child shall have the fundamental right to make decisions 11 
', b"concerning the child's care, custody, and control without obstruction or 12 
", b'interference from a public school. As it relates to public schools, this shall 13 
', b'include the:  14 
', b"1. Right to make decisions concerning the child's education, including 15 
", b'the right to cause the child to be educated in any manner that meets 16 
', b'the compulsory attendance requirements and exemptions established 17 
', b'in KRS 159.010 and 159.030 and in any other manner established by 18 
', b'statute or the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Kentucky; and  19 
', b"2. High duty and right to nurture and direct their children's destiny, 20 
", b'including their upbringing and education; mental, emotional, and 21 
', b'physical health care; and moral and reli gious development;  22 
', b'(b) The interests and role of parents in the care, custody, and control of their 23 
', b'children are implicit in the concept of ordered liberty, deeply embedded in 24 
', b"our nation's history and tradition, and among the unalienable rights 25 
", b'retained by  the people under the Ninth Amendment to the Constitution of 26 
', b'the United States;  27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 943  
', b'Page 3 of 27 
', b'BR094300.100 - 943 - XXXX   2/7/2023 4:15 PM   Jacketed  (c) A parent of a child in this Commonwealth has inalienable rights that are 1 
', b'more comprehensive than those listed in Sections 1 to 6 of this Act, unless 2 
', b'such rights have been l awfully waived or terminated;  3 
', b'(d) The Commonwealth has independent authority to protect the parental rights 4 
', b'of its citizens; and  5 
', b'(e) The rights recognized and the protections established in Sections 1 to 6 of 6 
', b'this Act as they are related to public school a re rooted in the right to due 7 
', b'process of law guaranteed pursuant to the Constitution of the United States.  8 
', b"(2) The public schools of the Commonwealth shall not violate a parent's 9 
", b'fundamental rights identified in Sections 1 to 6 of this Act. Any restriction  of or 10 
', b'interference with these rights shall not be upheld unless it is demonstrated by 11 
', b'clear and convincing evidence to be:  12 
', b'(a) Essential to further a compelling governmental interest; and  13 
', b'(b) The least restrictive means available for the furthering of tha t compelling 14 
', b'governmental interest.  15 
', b'(3) To guard the rights established in Sections 1 to 6 of this Act, each local board of 16 
', b'education and charter school board of directors shall establish a process to 17 
', b'receive complaints regarding violations of those rights  that includes:  18 
', b'(a) A designated recipient of complaints for each school;  19 
', b'(b) The procedure for submission of the complaint;  20 
', b'(c) Written confirmation to the parent that the complaint has been received 21 
', b'within five (5) business days of receipt of the complai nt; 22 
', b'(d) A written response to the complaint within thirty (30) business days of 23 
', b'receipt of the complaint that outlines how the school will resolve the 24 
', b'complaint or a written statement of the specific reasons for not resolving the 25 
', b'complaint; and  26 
', b'(e) A final written determination of the merits of the complaint and the actions 27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 943  
', b'Page 4 of 27 
', b'BR094300.100 - 943 - XXXX   2/7/2023 4:15 PM   Jacketed  taken, if any, by the school to resolve the complaint within sixty (60) days 1 
', b'following the receipt of the complaint or the basis for taking no action.  2 
', b'(4) (a) After exhausting the  complaint process established in subsection (3) of this 3 
', b'section without satisfactory resolution, or if the school does not issue the 4 
', b'final written determination within the time established under subsection (3) 5 
', b'of this section, a parent shall have a civil cause of action.  6 
', b"(b) The complaint shall be filed within sixty (60) days of the school's failure to 7 
", b'comply within the time established under subsection (3) of this section or 8 
', b'within sixty (60) days of the final written determination, whichever occurs 9 
', b'last. 10 
', b'(c) The action shall be brought in the Circuit Court of the county in which the 11 
', b'school is located or the parent resides.  12 
', b'(d) Remedies available to a parent under this subsection shall include:  13 
', b'1. Declaratory relief;  14 
', b'2. Injunctive relief to prevent or reme dy a violation of Sections 1 to 6 of 15 
', b'this Act or the effects of such a violation;  16 
', b'3. Compensatory damages for pecuniary or nonpecuniary losses;  17 
', b"4. Reasonable attorney's fees and costs; and  18 
", b'5. Any other appropriate relief.  19 
', b'(e) If a parent brings an unsucces sful civil action against a public school, the 20 
', b"parent shall not be required to pay any associated attorney's fees or costs 21 
", b'incurred by the public school.  22 
', b'(f) All claims shall be initiated within one (1) year of the violation.  23 
', b'(5) Nothing in Sections 1 to 6  of this Act shall be construed:  24 
', b'(a) To prescribe all rights held by the parent of a child in this state; or  25 
', b'(b) As altering the established presumption in favor of the constitutionality of 26 
', b'statutes and regulations.  27 UNOFFICIAL COPY   23 RS BR 943  
', b'Page 5 of 27 
', b'BR094300.100 - 943 - XXXX   2/7/2023 4:15 PM   Jacketed  (6) Any portion or section of Sections 1  to 6 of this Act declared invalid shall not 1 
', b'affect the validity of the remaining portions or sections of Sections 1 to 6 of this 2 
', b'Act. 3 
', b'\xef\x83\xa2SECTION 3.   A NEW SECTION OF KRS CHAPTER 158 IS CREATED TO 4 
', b'READ AS FOLLOWS:  5 
', b'(1) In acc ordance with Section 2 of this Act, a parent shall have the following rights 6 
', b"as they relate to the parent's child and a public school:  7 
", b'(a) To access and review:  8 
', b'1. All education records relating to his or her minor child as provided in 9 
', b'KRS 160.700 to 160.7 30; 10 
', b'2. Any record associated with the selection or approval of any guest 11 
', b'lecturer, guest instructor, or outside presenter who participates in the 12 
', b"child's education;  13 
", b'3. Any records in the possession of the school relating to third -party 14 
', b'individuals and orga nizations contracted with the school that the child 15 
', b'attends; and  16 
', b'4. Any student well -being questionnaire or health screening form used 17 
', b'for research purposes;  18 
', b'(b) To provide consent prior to:  19 
', b'1. A well -being questionnaire or health screening form used for research 20 
', b'purposes being given to the child. A school shall not require a grant of 21 
', b'general consent to these questionnaires or forms by a parent, but shall 22 
', b'request consent specific to each question naire or form to be provided 23 
', b'to the child;  24

title: Discrimination; creating the Women's Bill of Rights; authorizing distinctions for certain purposes. Effective date.

', b'SENATE BILL  408 By: Garvin 
', b'

', b'AS INTRODUCED  
', b' 
', b'An Act relating to discrimination;  creating the 
', b'Women\xe2\x80\x99s Bill of Rights; providing shor t title; 
', b'stating purpose of act; clarifying applica tion and 
', b'interpretation of act;  amending 25 O.S. 2021, 
', b'Sections 16 , 1101, and 1201,  which relate to 
', b'definitions and statutory construction; defining 
', b'terms; construing provisions; authorizing 
', b'distinctions f or certain purposes;  defining term; 
', b'requiring certa in identification in collection of 
', b'data for certain purposes; providing for 
', b'codification; providing for noncodification;  and 
', b'providing an effective date.  
', b' 
', b' 
', b' 
', b' 
', b'BE IT ENACTED BY THE PEOPLE OF THE STAT E OF OKLAHOMA:  
', b'SECTION 1.     NEW L AW     A new section of law not to be 
', b'codified in the Oklahoma Statutes reads as follows:  
', b'A.  This act shall be known and may be cited as the \xe2\x80\x9cWomen\xe2\x80\x99s 
', b'Bill of Rights \xe2\x80\x9d. 
', b'B.  The purpose of The Women \xe2\x80\x99s Bill o f Rights is to bring 
', b'clarity, certainty, and unifor mity under the laws of this state with 
', b'respect to natural persons of both biological sexes and the manner 
', b'in which they are treated as such under the la ws of this state.  All 
', b'laws where the application the reof is contingent upon the  
', b'

', b'24  classification of a per son as bein g female or male, woman or man, 
', b'girl or boy, are hereby superseded and interpreted to the extent 
', b'necessary by this act including but not limi ted to any educational 
', b'benefits, corrections housing,  employment protections, and civil 
', b'rights laws codi fied in the statutes of this state.  
', b'SECTION 2.     AMENDATORY     25 O.S. 2021, Section 16, is 
', b'amended to read as follows:  
', b'Section 1 6.  The word \xe2\x80\x9cperson, \xe2\x80\x9d As used in the Oklahoma 
', b'Statutes : 
', b'1.  \xe2\x80\x9cFather\xe2\x80\x9d means the male parent of a child or children as 
', b'defined in Section 7 of this title;  
', b'2.  \xe2\x80\x9cFemale\xe2\x80\x9d means a natural person whose biological 
', b'reproductive system is developed to produce ova;  
', b'3.  \xe2\x80\x9cMale\xe2\x80\x9d means a natural person whose biological repr oductive 
', b'system is developed to fertilize the ova o f a female;  
', b'4.  \xe2\x80\x9cMan\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cboy\xe2\x80\x9d means a natural person who is male;  
', b'5.  \xe2\x80\x9cMother\xe2\x80\x9d means the female parent of a child or children as 
', b'defined in Section 7  of this title;  
', b'6.  \xe2\x80\x9cNatural person \xe2\x80\x9d means a person as defined in paragraph 7 of 
', b'this section, except for bodies politic or corporate;  
', b'7.  \xe2\x80\x9cPerson\xe2\x80\x9d, except when used by way of contrast, includes not 
', b'only human beings, but bodies politic or corporate ; 
', b'8.  \xe2\x80\x9cSex\xe2\x80\x9d means a natural person \xe2\x80\x99s biological sex at birth; and 
', b'9.  \xe2\x80\x9cWoman\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cgirl\xe2\x80\x9d means a natural person wh o is female .

', b'24  SECTION 3.     AMENDATORY     25 O.S. 2021, Section 1101, is 
', b'amended to read as follows:  
', b'Section 1101.  A.  This act provides for exclusive remedies 
', b'within the state of the p olicies for individuals alleging 
', b'discrimination in employment on the bas is of race, color, national 
', b'origin, sex, religion, creed, age, disability or genetic 
', b'information.  
', b'B.  This act shall be construed according to the fair import of 
', b'its terms to further t he general purposes stated in this section and 
', b'the special purposes of t he particular provision involved.  
', b'C.  Any policy, program, or statute that prohibits sex 
', b'discrimination is to be construed to forbid unfair treatment of 
', b'females or males in relation to  similarly situated members of the 
', b'opposite sex.  T he state or its polit ical subdivisions shall not be 
', b'prohibited from establishing distinctions between sexes when such 
', b'distinctions are substantially related to a n important  government 
', b'objective  including b ut not limited to  biology,  privacy, safety, or 
', b'fairness in locations an d circumstances such as  prisons or other 
', b'detention facilities, domestic violence shelters, rape crisis 
', b'centers, athletics and locker rooms, and restrooms.  
', b'SECTION 4.     AMENDATORY     25 O.S. 2021, Section 1201, is 
', b'amended to read as fol lows: 
', b'Section 1201.  In Section 1101 et seq. of this title, unless the 
', b'context otherwise requires:

title: Elementary schools, etc.; designation of interscholastic, etc., sports, student participation.
description: Elementary and secondary schools and institutions of higher Elementary and secondary schools and institutions of higher education; interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, and club athletic teams and sports; student participation; certain requirements. Requires each interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public elementary or secondary school or a public institution of higher education to be expressly designated as one of the following based on each team member's biological sex at birth: (i) for "males," "men," or "boys"; (ii) for "females," "women," or "girls"; or (iii) as "coed" or "mixed," including both (a) males, men, or boys and (b) females, women, or girls. The bill prohibits any interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public elementary or secondary school or a public institution of higher education and that is expressly designated for "males," "men," or "boys" from being open to any student whose biological sex at birth is female unless such school or institution does not sponsor such a team or sport that is expressly designated for "females," "women," or "girls" or as "coed" or "mixed." The bill prohibits any interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public elementary or secondary school or a public institution of higher education and that is expressly designated for "females," "women," or "girls" from being open to any student whose biological sex at birth is male. The bill prohibits any interscholastic, intercollegiate, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public elementary or secondary school or a public institution of higher education from competing against any interscholastic, intercollegiate, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a private elementary or secondary school or a private institution of higher education unless such private school or institution complies with the applicable provisions of the bill for the team or sport that it sponsors. The bill also establishes a cause of action for students, schools, and institutions that suffer harm as a result of a violation of certain provisions of the bill. The bill finally prohibits any school board from using any funds or permitting any school within the local school division to use any funds to join, affiliate with, pay dues or fees to, or in any way financially support any interscholastic athletic association, body, or entity unless the constitution, rules, or policies of such association, body, or entity recognizes, sanctions, and regulates interscholastic competition between wrestling teams exclusively comprised of students whose biological sex at birth is female.

text:
[b'23100012D
', b'HOUSE BILL NO. 1399
', b'
', b'
', b'Offered January 11, 2023
', b'
', b'
', b'Prefiled November 30, 2022
', b'
', b'A BILL to amend the Code of Virginia by adding sections 
', b' numbered 22.1-206.3, 22.1-206.4, and 23.1-408.2, relating to elementary and secondary 
', b' schools and institutions of higher education; interscholastic, intercollegiate, 
', b' intramural, and club athletic teams and sports; student participation; certain 
', b' requirements.
', b'----------
', b'
', b'Patron-- March
', b'
', b'----------
', b'
', b'Committee Referral Pending
', b'
', b'----------
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Virginia:
', b'1. That the Code of Virginia is amended by adding sections 
', b' numbered 22.1-206.3, 22.1-206.4, and 23.1-408.2 as follows:
', b'\xc2\xa722.1-206.3. 
', b' Interscholastic, intramural, and club athletic teams and sports; student 
', b' participation.
', b'A. For the purposes of this 
', b" section, a statement of a student's biological sex on the student's official 
", b" birth certificate shall be considered to correctly state the student's 
", b' biological sex at birth if the statement was filed at or near the time of the 
', b" student's birth.
", b'B. Each interscholastic, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public 
', b' elementary or secondary school shall be expressly designated as one of the 
', b" following based on each team member's biological sex at birth:
", b'1. For "males," 
', b' "men," or "boys";
', b'2. For "females," 
', b' "women," or "girls"; or
', b'3. As "coed" or 
', b' "mixed," including both (i) males, men, or boys and (ii) females, 
', b' women, or girls.
', b'C. No interscholastic, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public 
', b' elementary or secondary school and that is expressly designated for 
', b' "males," "men," or "boys" pursuant to subsection 
', b' B shall be open to any student whose biological sex at birth is female unless 
', b' such school does not sponsor such a team or sport that is expressly designated 
', b' for "females," "women," or "girls" or as 
', b' "coed" or "mixed."
', b'D. No interscholastic, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public 
', b' elementary or secondary school and that is expressly designated for 
', b' "females," "women," or "girls" pursuant to 
', b' subsection B shall be open to any student whose biological sex at birth is 
', b' male.
', b'E. No interscholastic or 
', b' club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public elementary or 
', b' secondary school shall compete against any interscholastic or club athletic 
', b' team or sport that is sponsored by a private elementary or secondary school 
', b' unless such private school complies with the applicable provisions of 
', b' subsection B, C, or D, mutatis mutandis, for the team or sport that it 
', b' sponsors.
', b'F. Any student who (i) is 
', b' deprived of an athletic opportunity or suffers any other direct or indirect 
', b' harm as a result of a violation of subsection B, C, D, or E or (ii) is subject 
', b' to retaliation or other adverse action by an elementary or secondary school or 
', b' athletic association or organization as a result of reporting a violation of 
', b' subsection B, C, D, or E to an employee or representative of the school or 
', b' athletic association or organization, or to any state or federal agency with 
', b' oversight over elementary or secondary schools in the Commonwealth, may initiate 
', b' a cause of action against the relevant school, provided that such cause of 
', b' action is initiated within two years of such deprivation, harm, retaliation, or 
', b' other adverse action.
', b'G. Any public elementary or 
', b' secondary school that suffers any direct or indirect harm as a result of a 
', b' violation of subsection B, C, D, or E by any governmental entity, licensing or 
', b' accrediting organization, or athletic association or organization may initiate 
', b' a cause of action against such entity, organization, or association, provided 
', b' that such cause of action is initiated within two years of such harm.
', b'\xc2\xa722.1-206.4. 
', b' Interscholastic competition; female wrestling.
', b'No school board shall use 
', b' any funds or permit any school within the local school division to use any 
', b' funds to join, affiliate with, pay dues or fees to, or in any way financially 
', b' support any interscholastic athletic association, body, or entity unless the 
', b' constitution, rules, or policies of such association, body, or entity 
', b' recognizes, sanctions, and regulates interscholastic competition between 
', b' wrestling teams exclusively comprised of students whose biological sex at birth 
', b' is female.
', b'\xc2\xa723.1-408.2. 
', b' Intercollegiate, intramural, and club athletic teams and sports; student 
', b' participation.
', b'A. For the purposes of this 
', b" section, a statement of a student's biological sex on the student's official 
", b" birth certificate shall be considered to correctly state the student's 
", b' biological sex at birth if the statement was filed at or near the time of the 
', b" student's birth.
", b'B. Each intercollegiate, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public 
', b' institution of higher education shall be expressly designated as one of the 
', b" following based on each team member's biological sex at birth:
", b'1. For "males," 
', b' "men," or "boys";
', b'2. For "females," 
', b' "women," or "girls"; or
', b'3. As "coed" or 
', b' "mixed," including both (i) males, men, or boys and (ii) females, 
', b' women, or girls.
', b'C. No intercollegiate, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public 
', b' institution of higher education and that is expressly designated for 
', b' "males," "men," or "boys" pursuant to subsection 
', b' B shall be open to any student whose biological sex at birth is female unless 
', b' such institution does not sponsor such a team or sport that is expressly 
', b' designated for "females," "women," or "girls" or 
', b' as "coed" or "mixed."
', b'D. No intercollegiate, 
', b' intramural, or club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public 
', b' institution of higher education and that is expressly designated for 
', b' "females," "women," or "girls" pursuant to 
', b' subsection B shall be open to any student whose biological sex at birth is 
', b' male.
', b'E. No intercollegiate or 
', b' club athletic team or sport that is sponsored by a public institution of higher 
', b' education shall compete against any intercollegiate or club athletic team or 
', b' sport that is sponsored by a private institution of higher education unless 
', b' such private institution complies with the applicable provisions of subsection 
', b' B, C, or D, mutatis mutandis, for the team or sport that it sponsors.
', b'F. Any student who (i) is 
', b' deprived of an athletic opportunity or suffers any other direct or indirect 
', b' harm as a result of a violation of subsection B, C, D, or E or (ii) is subject 
', b' to retaliation or other adverse action by a public institution of higher education 
', b' or athletic association or organization as a result of reporting a violation of 
', b' subsection B, C, D, or E to an employee or representative of the institution or 
', b' athletic association or organization, or to any state or federal agency with 
', b' oversight over public institutions of higher education in the Commonwealth, may 
', b' initiate a cause of action against the relevant school, provided that such 
', b' cause of action is initiated within two years of such deprivation, harm, 
', b' retaliation, or other adverse action.
', b'G. Any public institution of 
', b' higher education that suffers any direct or indirect harm as a result of a 
', b' violation of subsection B, C, D, or E by any governmental entity, licensing or 
', b' accrediting organization, or athletic association or organization may initiate 
', b' a cause of action against such entity, organization, or association, provided 
', b' that such cause of action is initiated within two years of such harm.']

title: The Title IX Preservation Act; enact.
description: An Act To Enact The Title Ix Preservation Act; To Provide Interpretation And Clarification Of Certain Terms Relating To Title Ix Of The Federal Code; To State Legislative Intent; To Clarify Terms For The Purposes Of State Law; To Provide That Policies And Laws That Distinguish Between The Sexes Are Subject To Intermediate Constitutional Scrutiny; To Require The State Or A Local Governmental Entity To Disaggregate The Data Of Individuals By Sex Based On The Biological Sex Of Individuals At Birth When The State Or Local Governmental Entity Gathers The Data Of Individuals That Is Disaggregated By Sex; And For Related Purposes.

text:
[b'
', b'
', b'MISSISSIPPI LEGISLATURE
', b'2023 Regular Session
', b'To: Judiciary, Division A; Education
', b'By: Senator(s) Hill
', b'Senate Bill 2076
', b'AN ACT TO ENACT THE TITLE IX PRESERVATION ACT; TO PROVIDE INTERPRETATION
', b'AND CLARIFICATION OF CERTAIN TERMS RELATING TO TITLE IX OF THE FEDERAL CODE; TO
', b'STATE LEGISLATIVE INTENT; TO CLARIFY TERMS FOR THE PURPOSES OF STATE LAW; TO
', b'PROVIDE THAT POLICIES AND LAWS THAT DISTINGUISH BETWEEN THE SEXES ARE SUBJECT
', b'TO INTERMEDIATE CONSTITUTIONAL SCRUTINY; TO REQUIRE THE STATE OR A LOCAL
', b'GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY TO DISAGGREGATE THE DATA OF INDIVIDUALS BY SEX BASED ON THE
', b'BIOLOGICAL SEX OF INDIVIDUALS AT BIRTH WHEN THE STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL
', b'ENTITY GATHERS THE DATA OF INDIVIDUALS THAT IS DISAGGREGATED BY SEX; AND FOR
', b'RELATED PURPOSES.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 BE IT ENACTED BY THE
', b'LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI:
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 1. \xc2\xa0This
', b'act shall be known and may be cited as "The Title IX Preservation Act."
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 2. \xc2\xa0The
', b'Legislature finds and declares that:
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (a) \xc2\xa0Males and females
', b'possess unique and immutable biological differences that manifest prior to
', b'birth and increase with age and puberty;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (b) \xc2\xa0Biological
', b'differences between the sexes mean that only females can get pregnant, give
', b'birth and breastfeed children;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (c) \xc2\xa0Biological
', b'differences between the sexes mean that males are, on average, larger in size
', b'and possess greater body strength than females;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (d) \xc2\xa0Whereas biological
', b'differences between the sexes can expose females to greater harm than males
', b'from specific forms of violence, including sexual violence;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (e) \xc2\xa0Females have historically
', b'suffered from discrimination in education, athletics and employment;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (f) \xc2\xa0Females have achieved
', b'inspirational and significant accomplishments in education, athletics and
', b'employment;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Biological differences between
', b'the sexes are enduring and may, in some circumstances, warrant the creation of separate
', b'social, educational, athletic or other spaces in order to ensure safety and/or to
', b'allow members of each sex to succeed and thrive;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (g) \xc2\xa0When it comes to sex:
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (i) \xc2\xa0"Equal"
', b'does not mean "same" or "identical"; and
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (ii) \xc2\xa0Separate is not
', b'inherently unequal; and
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (h) \xc2\xa0Recent misguided
', b'court rulings and policy initiatives relating to the definition of "sex"
', b'have led to the endangerment of single-sex spaces and resources dedicated to
', b'women, thereby necessitating clarification of certain terms.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 3. \xc2\xa0For
', b'the purposes of State law:
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (a) \xc2\xa0The "sex"
', b'of an individual means his or her biological sex (either male or female) at
', b'birth.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (b) \xc2\xa0The terms "woman"
', b'and "girl" refer to human females.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (c) \xc2\xa0The terms "man"
', b'and "boy" refer to human males.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (d) \xc2\xa0The word "mother"
', b'refers to a parent of the female sex.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (e) \xc2\xa0The word "father"
', b'refers to a parent of the male sex.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 4. \xc2\xa0(1)
', b'\xc2\xa0There are important reasons to distinguish between the sexes with respect to
', b'athletics, prisons, domestic violence shelters, restrooms, and with respect to
', b'other areas, particularly where biology, safety and privacy are implicated.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (2) \xc2\xa0Policies and laws that
', b'distinguish between the sexes are subject to intermediate constitutional
', b'scrutiny and permitted when they serve an important governmental objective and
', b'are substantially related to achieving that objective.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 5. \xc2\xa0When
', b'the State or a local governmental entity gathers data of individuals that is disaggregated
', b'by sex, the state or local governmental entity shall disaggregate the data of individuals
', b'by sex based on the biological sex of individuals at birth.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 6. \xc2\xa0Any
', b'person who suffers any direct or indirect harm as a result of a violation of this
', b'act shall have a private cause of action for injunctive relief, damages and any
', b'other relief available under law against the state or its political subdivision
', b'causing the harm.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 7.\xc2\xa0 This act
', b'shall take effect and be in force from and after July 1, 2023.
', b'
']

title: Parental rights.
description: Parental rights. Provides that the state of Indiana, a political subdivision or other governmental entity of the state of Indiana, a government official, or any other person acting under the color of law shall not infringe on the fundamental right of a parent to direct the upbringing, education, health care, and mental health of the parent's child without demonstrating that the infringement: (1) is required by a compelling governmental interest of the highest order as long recognized in the history and traditions of the state of Indiana; and (2) as applied to the child, is narrowly tailored and not otherwise served by a less restrictive means. Creates a right of action for violation of a parent's rights with respect to the upbringing, education, and health care of the parent's child. Provides that a child is not a child in need of services due to the child's parent, guardian, or custodian: (1) referring to and raising the child consistent with the child's biological sex; or (2) declining to consent to the child receiving: (A) specified medication; (B) a medical procedure the purpose of which is to alter the apparent gender or sex of the child or affirm the child's perception of the child's gender or sex in a manner inconsistent with the child's biological sex; or (C) counseling or other mental health services the purpose of which is to affirm the child's perception of the child's gender or sex if the child's perception is inconsistent with the child's biological sex. Provides that if the juvenile court finds that a child is a child in need of services because the child substantially endangers the child's own or another's health, the court shall release the child to the child's parent, guardian, or custodian and may not enter a dispositional decree ordering removal of the child, unless: (1) the court also finds that the child is a child in need of services for another reason; or (2) the parent, guardian, or custodian consents to the child being removed from the child's home. Specifies that the parental rights and responsibilities do not: (1) authorize a parent to: (A) abuse or neglect a child; or (B) make the decision to end the child's life; or (2) prohibit a court from issuing an order that is otherwise permitted by law. Makes conforming changes.
