text:
[b' 
', b'Introduced Version
', b'HOUSE BILL No. 1407
', b'_____
', b'DIGEST OF  INTRODUCED B ILL
', b'Citations Affected:  IC 31-9-2-13; IC 31-10.5; IC 31-34.
', b'Synopsis:  Parental rights. Provides that the state of Indiana, a political
', b'subdivision or other governmental entity of the state of Indiana, a
', b'government official, or any other person acting under the color of law
', b'shall not infringe on the fundamental right of a parent to direct the
', b"upbringing, education, health care, and mental health of the parent's
", b'child without demonstrating that the infringement: (1) is required by a
', b'compelling governmental interest of the highest order as long
', b'recognized in the history and traditions of the state of Indiana; and (2)
', b'as applied to the child, is narrowly tailored and not otherwise served by
', b'a less restrictive means. Creates a right of action for violation of a
', b"parent's rights with respect to the upbringing, education, and health
", b"care of the parent's child. Provides that a child is not a child in need of
", b"services due to the child's parent, guardian, or custodian: (1) referring
", b"to and raising the child consistent with the child's biological sex; or (2)
", b'declining to consent to the child receiving: (A) specified medication;
', b'(B) a medical procedure the purpose of which is to alter the apparent
', b"gender or sex of the child or affirm the child's perception of the child's
", b"gender or sex in a manner inconsistent with the child's biological sex;
", b'or (C) counseling or other mental health services the purpose of which
', b"is to affirm the child's perception of the child's gender or sex if the
", b"child's perception is inconsistent with the child's biological sex.
", b'Provides that a juvenile court may not enter a dispositional decree
', b"ordering removal of a child from the home of the child's parent,
", b'guardian, or custodian if: (1) the juvenile court has found the child to
', b'be a child in need of services under a specified statutory definition of
', b'a child in need of services; and (2) the parent, guardian, or custodian
', b'of the child: (A) is a fit parent, guardian, or custodian of the child; and
', b"(B) does not consent to the child being removed from the child's home.
", b'Effective:  July 1, 2023.
', b'DeVon
', b'January 17, 2023, read first time and referred to Commi ttee on Family, Children and
', b'Human Affairs.
', b'2023 IN 1407\xe2\x80\x94LS 7365/DI 119
', b'Introduced
', b'First Reg ular Sessio n of the 123rd General A ssem bly (2023)
', b'PRINTING CODE. Amendments: Whenever an existing statute (or a section of the Indiana
', b'Constitution) is being amended, the text of the existing provision will appear in this style type,
', b'additions will appear in this sty le type, and deletions will appear in this style type.
', b'  Additions: Whenever a new statutory provision is being enacted (or a new constitutional
', b'provision adopted), the text of the new provision will appear in  this  style  type. Also, the
', b'word NEW will appear in that style type in the introductory clause of each SECTION that adds
', b'a new provision to the Indiana Code or the Indiana Constitution.
', b'  Conflict reconciliation: Text in a statute in this style type or this style type reconciles conflicts
', b'between statutes enacted by the 2022 Regular Session of the General Assembly.
', b'HOUSE BILL No. 1407
', b'A BILL FOR AN ACT to amend the Indiana Code concerning
', b'family law and juvenile law.
', b'Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Indiana:
', b'1 SECTION 1. IC 31-9-2-13, AS AMENDED BY P.L.243-2019,
', b'2 SECTION 2, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
', b'3 JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 13. (a) "Child", for purposes of IC 31-15, IC 31-16
', b'4 (excluding IC 31-16-12.5), and IC 31-17, means a child or children of
', b'5 both parties to the marriage. The term includes the following:
', b'6 (1) Children born out of wedlock to the parties.
', b'7 (2) Children born or adopted during the marriage of the parties.
', b'8 (b) "Child", for purposes of the Uniform Interstate Family Support
', b'9 Act under IC 31-18.5, has the meaning set forth in IC 31-18.5-1-2.
', b'10 (c) "Child", for purposes of IC 31-19-5, includes an unborn child.
', b'11 (d) Except as otherwise provided in this section, "child", for
', b'12 purposes of the juvenile law and IC 31-27, means:
', b'13 (1) a person who is less than eighteen (18) years of age;
', b'14 (2) a person:
', b'15 (A) who is eighteen (18), nineteen (19), or twenty (20) years
', b'16 of age; and
', b'17 (B) who either:
', b'2023 IN 1407\xe2\x80\x94LS 7365/DI 119
', b'2
', b'1 (i) is charged with a delinquent act committed before the
', b"2 person's eighteenth birthday; or
", b'3 (ii) has been adjudicated a child in need of services before
', b"4 the person's eighteenth birthday; or
", b'5 (3) a person:
', b'6 (A) who is alleged to have committed an act that would have
', b'7 been murder if committed by an adult;
', b'8 (B) who was less than eighteen (18) years of age at the time of
', b'9 the alleged act; and
', b'10 (C) who is less than twenty-one (21) years of age.
', b'11 (e) "Child", for purposes of IC 31-36-3 and IC 31-10.5, means a
', b'12 person who is less than eighteen (18) years of age.
', b'13 (f) "Child", for purposes of the Interstate Compact on Juveniles
', b'14 under IC 31-37-23-1, has the meaning set forth in IC 31-37-23-1.
', b'15 (g) "Child", for purposes of IC 31-16-12.5, means an individual to
', b'16 whom child support is owed under:
', b'17 (1) a child support order issued under IC 31-14-10 or IC 31-16-6;
', b'18 or
', b'19 (2) any other child support order that is enforceable under
', b'20 IC 31-16-12.5.
', b'21 (h) "Child", for purposes of IC 31-32-5, means an individual who is
', b'22 less than eighteen (18) years of age.
', b'23 (i) "Child", for purposes of the Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction
', b'24 Act under IC 31-21, has the meaning set forth in IC 31-21-2-3.
', b'25 (j) "Child", for purposes of IC 31-35-2-4.5, means an individual who
', b'26 is:
', b'27 (1) less than eighteen (18) years of age; and
', b'28 (2) a delinquent child or a child in need of services.
', b'29 SECTION 2. IC 31-10.5 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA CODE AS
', b'30 A NEW ARTICLE TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE JULY 1,
', b'31 2023]:
', b'32 ARTICLE 10.5. PARENTAL RIGHTS AND
', b'33 RESPONSIBILITIES
', b'34 Chapter 1. Definitions
', b'35 Sec. 1. Except as otherwise provided, the definitions in this
', b'36 chapter apply throughout this article.
', b'37 Sec. 2. "Parent" means, with regard to a child:
', b'38 (1) a biological parent of the child;
', b'39 (2) an adoptive parent of the child; or
', b'40 (3) a legal guardian of the child.
', b'41 Chapter 2. Rights of Parents
', b'42 Sec. 1. (a) The state of Indiana, a political subdivision or other
', b'2023 IN 1407\xe2\x80\x94LS 7365/DI 119
', b'3
', b'1 governmental entity of the state of Indiana, a government official,
', b'2 or any other person acting under the color of law shall not infringe
', b'3 on the fundamental right of a parent to direct the upbringing,
', b"4 education, health care, and mental health of the paren t's child
", b'5 without demonstrating that the infringement:
', b'6 (1) is required by a compelling governmental interest of the
', b'7 highest order as long recognized in the history and traditions
', b'8 of the state of Indiana; and
', b'9 (2) as applied to the parent and the child, is narrowly tailored
', b'10 and not otherwise served by a less restrictive means.
', b'11 (b) Unless those rights have been legally waived or legally
', b'12 terminated, parents have inalienable rights that are more
', b'13 comprehensive than those described in subsection (a). Subsection
', b'14 (a):
', b'15 (1) does not prescribe all rights of parents; and
', b'16 (2) does not preempt or foreclose claims or remedies in
', b'17 support of parental rights that are available under the
', b'18 Constitution of the United States, the Constitution of the State
', b'19 of Indiana, or the statutes and common law of the state of
', b'20 Indiana.
', b'21 Sec. 2. (a) A parent:
', b'22 (1) may bring an action for a violation of this chapter; and
', b'23 (2) may raise this chapter as a defense in any judicial or
', b'24 administrative proceeding regardless of whether the
', b'25 proceeding is brought by or in the name of the state of
', b'26 Indiana, a private person, or any other party.
', b'27 (b) Notwithstanding any other provision of law:
', b'28 (1) an action under this section may be commenced; and
', b'29 (2) a court may grant relief in an action commenced under
', b'30 this section;
', b'31 regardless of whether the person commencing the action has
', b'32 sought or exhausted administrative remedies available to the
', b'33 person.
', b'34 (c) A court may grant to a person who successfully asserts a
', b'35 claim or defense under this section:
', b'36 (1) declaratory relief;
', b'37 (2) injunctive relief;
', b'38 (3) compensatory damages;
', b"39 (4) reasonable attorney's fees and costs; and
", b'40 (5) any other relief the court considers appropriate.
', b'41 (d) Sovereign, governmental, and qualified immunity to suit and
', b'42 from liability are waived and abolished to the extent of liability
', b'2023 IN 1407\xe2\x80\x94LS 7365/DI 119
', b'4
', b'1 created by this chapter.
', b'2 SECTION 3. IC 31-34-1-17 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA CODE
', b'3 AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE JULY
', b'4 1, 2023]: Sec. 17. A child is not a child in need of services under any
', b"5 section of this chapter due to the child's parent, guardian, or
", b'6 custodian:
', b'7 (1) referring to and raising the child consistent with the
', b"8 child's biological sex;
", b'9 (2) declining to consent to the child receiving:
', b'10 (A) puberty blocking medication;
', b'11 (B) supraphysiologic doses of testosterone or estrogen; or
', b'12 (C) any surgical procedure the purpose of which is to:
', b'13 (i) alter the apparent gender or sex of the child in a
', b"14 manner inconsistent with the child's biological sex; or
", b"15 (ii) affirm the child's perception of the child's gender or
", b"16 sex, if the child's perception is inconsistent with the
", b"17 child's biological sex; or
", b'18 (3) declining to consent to the child receiving counseling or
', b'19 other mental health services for the purpose of affirming the
', b"20 child's perception of the child's gender or sex, if the child's
", b"21 perception is inconsistent with the child's biological sex.
", b'22 SECTION 4. IC 31-34-20-1, AS AMENDED BY P.L.172-2022,
', b'23 SECTION 9, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
', b'24 JULY 1, 2023]: Sec. 1. (a) Subject to this section and section 1.5 of this
', b'25 chapter, if a child is a child in need of services, the juvenile court may
', b'26 enter one (1) or more of the following dispositional decrees:
', b'27 (1) Order supervision of the child by the department.
', b'28 (2) Order the child to receive outpatient treatment:
', b'29 (A) at a social service agency or a psychological, a psychiatric,
', b'30 a medical, or an educational facility; or
', b'31 (B) from an individual practitioner.
', b"32 (3) Remove the child from the child's home and authorize the
", b'33 department to place the child in another home, shelter care
', b'34 facility, child caring institution, group home, or secure private
', b'35 facility. Placement under this subdivision includes authorization
', b'36 to control and discipline the child.
', b'37 (4) Award wardship of the child to the depa rtment for
', b'38 supervision, care, and placement.
', b'39 (5) Partially or completely emancipate the child under section 6
', b'40 of this chapter.
', b"41 (6) Order the child's parent, guardian, or custodian to complete
", b'42 services recommended by the department and approved by the
', b'2023 IN 1407\xe2\x80\x94LS 7365/DI 119
', b'5
', b'1 court under IC 31-34-18 and IC 31-34-19, which may include
', b'2 services described in section 3(a) of this chapter.
', b'3 (7) Order a person who is a party to refrain from direct or indirect
', b'4 contact with the child.
', b'5 (8) Order a perpetrator of child abuse or neglect to refrain from
', b"6 returning to the child's residence.
", b'7 (b) A juvenile court may not place a child in a home or facility that
', b'8 is located outside Indiana unless:
', b'9 (1) the placement is recommended or approved by the director of
', b"10 the department or the director's designee; or
", b'11 (2) the juvenile court makes written findings based on clear and
', b'12 convincing evidence that:
', b'13 (A) the out-of-state placement is appropriate because there is
', b'14 not an equivalent facility with adequate services located in
', b'15 Indiana;
', b'16 (B) institutional care in the other jurisdiction is in the best
', b'17 interest of the child and will not produce undue hardship; or
', b'18 (C) the location of the home or facility is within a distance not
', b'19 greater than fifty (50) miles from the county of residence of
', b'20 the child.
', b'21 (c) A juvenile court may not enter a dispositional decree
', b"22 ordering removal of a child from the home of the child's parent,
", b'23 guardian, or custodian if:
', b'24 (1) the juvenile court has found the child to be a child in need
', b'25 of services under IC 31-34-1-6; and
', b'26 (2) the parent, guardian, or custodian of the child:
', b'27 (A) is a fit parent, guardian, or custodian of the child; and
', b'28 (B) does not consent to the child being removed from the
', b"29 child's home.
", b'30 (c) (d) If a dispositional decree under this section:
', b"31 (1) orders or approves removal of a child from the child's home or
", b'32 awards wardship of the child to the department; and
', b'33 (2) is the first juvenile court order in the child in need of services
', b'34 proceeding that authorizes or approves removal of the child from
', b"35 the child's parent, guardian, or custodian;
", b'36 the juvenile court shall include in the decree the appropriate findings
', b'37 and conclusions described in IC 31-34-5-3(b) and IC 31-34-5-3(c).
', b'2023 IN 1407\xe2\x80\x94LS 7365/DI 119
']

title: SCH CD-BIO-RESTROOM ACCESS
description: Amends the School Code. Provides that school districts may regulate and restrict access to public restrooms, locker rooms, dressing rooms, and other similar places on the basis of biological sex and may also adopt a policy that provides for gender neutral or alternative facilities for students, staff, and members of the public, as the school district deems appropriate. Provides that school districts are not required to: (1) adopt a policy that restricts or regulates access to public restrooms, locker rooms, dressing rooms, and other similar places on the basis of biological sex; (2) adopt a policy that includes the facilitation of gender neutral or alternative facilities for students, staff, and members of the public; (3) limit access by a minor accompanied by an adult guardian of the opposite sex into a specified facility appropriate for the adult guardian; (4) prohibit a person with disabilities from using a specified facility appropriate to the biological sex of either the person with disabilities or of an adult caretaker providing assistance; (5) prohibit access to these facilities by custodial staff, school staff, or other persons in an emergency situation; or (6) alter their current policies on access to public restrooms, locker rooms, dressing rooms, and other similar places.

', b'\xe2\x80\x9cfull development of the talent and capac ities of our 
', b'Nation\xe2\x80\x99s people \xe2\x80\x9d is in the context of sports and 
', b'athletics , 
', b'h. courts have recognized that the inherent, 
', b'physiological differences between males and females 
', b'result in different athletic ca pabilities.   For 
', b'example, Kleczek v. Rhode Island Inter scholastic 26 
', b'League, Inc., 612 A.2d 734, 738 (R.I. 1992) ( \xe2\x80\x9cBecause 
', b'of innate physiological differences, boys and girls 
', b'are not similarly situated as they enter athletic 
', b'competition. \xe2\x80\x9d); Petrie v. I ll. High Sch. Ass \xe2\x80\x99n, 394 
', b'N.E.2d 855, 861 (Ill. App. Ct. 197 9) (noting tha t

', b'those advantages give them an unfair lead over girls 
', b'in some sports like \xe2\x80\x9chigh school track \xe2\x80\x9d),

', b'American track athlete Dor iane Coleman, te nnis 
', b'champion Martina Navratilova, and Olympic track gold 
', b'medalist Sanya Richards -Ross recently wrote, \xe2\x80\x9c[T]he

', b'to-head competition.   Claims to the contrary are 
', b'simply a denial of science. \xe2\x80\x9d (Doriane Coleman, Martina 
', b'Navratilova, et al., \xe2\x80\x9cPass the Equality A ct, But Don \xe2\x80\x99t 
', b'Abandon Title IX, \xe2\x80\x9d Washington Post (Apr. 29, 2019)) , 
', b'k. the benefits that natural testosterone provides to 
', b'male athletes are not diminished through the use of 
', b'puberty blockers and cross -sex hormones.   A recent

', b'women. (Wi lk, Anna, et al. , \xe2\x80\x9cMuscle Strength, Size and 
', b'Composition Following 12 Months of Gender -Affirming 
', b'Treatment in Transgender Individuals, \xe2\x80\x9d The Journal of

title: The Title IX Preservation Act; enact.
description: An Act To Enact The Title Ix Preservation Act; To Provide Interpretation And Clarification Of Certain Terms Relating To Title Ix Of The Federal Code; To State Legislative Intent; To Clarify Terms For The Purposes Of State Law; To Provide That Policies And Laws That Distinguish Between The Sexes Are Subject To Intermediate Constitutional Scrutiny; To Require Any Public School, School District, State Or Local Agency, Department Or Office That Collects Vital Statistics For The Purpose Of Complying With Anti-discrimination Laws Or For The Purpose Of Gathering Accurate Public Health, Crime, Economic Or Other Data To Identify Each Individual Who Is Part Of The Collected Data Set As Either Male Or Female At Birth; And For Related Purposes.
history: [{'date': '2023-01-16', 'action': 'Referred To Judiciary A', 'chamber': 'H', 'chamber_id': 57, 'importance': 1}, {'date': '2023-01-31', 'action': 'Died In Committee', 'chamber': 'H', 'chamber_id': 57, 'importance': 1}]
text:
[b'
', b'
', b'MISSISSIPPI LEGISLATURE
', b'2023 Regular Session
', b'To: Judiciary A
', b'By: Representative Ford (73rd)
', b'House Bill 1074
', b'AN ACT TO ENACT THE TITLE IX PRESERVATION ACT; TO PROVIDE INTERPRETATION
', b'AND CLARIFICATION OF CERTAIN TERMS RELATING TO TITLE IX OF THE FEDERAL CODE; TO
', b'STATE LEGISLATIVE INTENT; TO CLARIFY TERMS FOR THE PURPOSES OF STATE LAW; TO
', b'PROVIDE THAT POLICIES AND LAWS THAT DISTINGUISH BETWEEN THE SEXES ARE SUBJECT
', b'TO INTERMEDIATE CONSTITUTIONAL SCRUTINY; TO REQUIRE ANY PUBLIC SCHOOL, SCHOOL DISTRICT,
', b'STATE OR LOCAL AGENCY, DEPARTMENT OR OFFICE THAT COLLECTS VITAL STATISTICS FOR THE
', b'PURPOSE OF COMPLYING WITH ANTI-DISCRIMINATION LAWS OR FOR THE PURPOSE OF GATHERING
', b'ACCURATE PUBLIC HEALTH, CRIME, ECONOMIC OR OTHER DATA TO IDENTIFY EACH INDIVIDUAL
', b'WHO IS PART OF THE COLLECTED DATA SET AS EITHER MALE OR FEMALE AT BIRTH; AND
', b'FOR RELATED PURPOSES.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE
', b'OF THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI:
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 1. \xc2\xa0This
', b'act shall be known and may be cited as "The Title IX Preservation Act."
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 2. \xc2\xa0The
', b'Legislature finds and declares that:
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (a) \xc2\xa0Males and females
', b'possess unique and immutable biological differences that manifest prior to
', b'birth and increase as they age and experience puberty;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (b) \xc2\xa0Biological
', b'differences between the sexes mean that only females are able to get pregnant,
', b'give birth and breastfeed children;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (c) \xc2\xa0Biological
', b'differences between the sexes mean that males are, on average, bigger, stronger,
', b'and faster than females;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (d) \xc2\xa0Biological differences
', b'between the sexes leave females more physically vulnerable than males to
', b'specific forms of violence, including sexual violence;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (e) \xc2\xa0Females have historically
', b'suffered from discrimination in education, athletics and employment;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (f) \xc2\xa0Biological differences
', b'between the sexes are enduring and may, in some circumstances, warrant the creation
', b'of separate social, educational, athletic, or other spaces in order to ensure safety
', b'and/or to allow members of each sex to succeed and thrive;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (g) \xc2\xa0Inconsistencies in
', b'court rulings and policy initiatives with respect to the definitions of "sex,"
', b'"male," "female," "man," and "woman" have
', b'led to the endangerment of single-sex spaces and resources, thereby
', b'necessitating clarification of certain terms.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 3. \xc2\xa0For
', b'the purposes of state law:
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (a) \xc2\xa0A person's "sex"
', b'is defined as his or her biological sex (either male or female) at birth;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (b) \xc2\xa0A "female"
', b'is an individual whose biological reproductive system is developed to produce ova;
', b'a "male" is an individual whose biological reproductive system is developed
', b'to fertilize the ova of a female;
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (c) \xc2\xa0The terms "woman"
', b'and "girl" refer to human females, and the terms "man" and "boy"
', b'refer to human males; and
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (d) \xc2\xa0The term "mother"
', b'is defined as a parent of the female sex, and the term "father" is defined
', b'as a parent of the male sex.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 4. \xc2\xa0There
', b'are legitimate reasons to distinguish between the sexes with respect to
', b'athletics, prisons, or other detention facilities, domestic violence shelters, rape
', b'crisis centers, locker rooms, restrooms, and other areas where biology, safety
', b'and/or privacy are implicated.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 5. \xc2\xa0Policies
', b'and laws that distinguish between the sexes are subject to intermediate constitutional
', b'scrutiny which forbids unfair discrimination against similarly-situated males and
', b'females but allows the law to distinguish between the sexes where such
', b'distinctions are substantially related to important governmental objectives.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 6. \xc2\xa0Any
', b'public school or school district and any state or local agency, department, or office
', b'that collects vital statistics for the purpose of complying with anti-discrimination
', b'laws or for the purpose of gathering accurate public health, crime, economic or
', b'other data shall identify each individual who is part of the collected data set
', b'as either male or female at birth.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 7.\xc2\xa0 (1)\xc2\xa0
', b'Any person employed by any public school, school district, state or local agency,
', b'department or office shall not be required to address any other employee or
', b'student enrolled with such entity by any pronoun, salutation, greeting, or other
', b"terminology that is inconsistent with that person's sex as defined herein.
", b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 (2)\xc2\xa0 A public school, school
', b'district, state or local agency, department or office shall not be required to
', b'permit an employee or student to dress in a manner inconsistent with professional
', b'standards of dress generally prevailing in the community for persons of the
', b'same sex, as defined herein, of that person or student.
', b'\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 SECTION 8.\xc2\xa0 This act
', b'shall take effect and be in force from and after July 1, 2023.
', b'
']
